loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
La señora Feliciana es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Rio Blanco”, en el sector cuatro, comunidad de Sucano, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 58 años de edad, de estado civil es casada y tiene tres hijos, asimismo posee estudios de primaria incompleta (segundo de primaria).
Trabaja desde hace cuatro años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, posee un negocio de engorde de ganado vacuno; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, que los destinó a la compra de forraje para engordar ganado y comercializarlo en las ferias ganaderas de Pilcuyo y de Ilave.
Ella piensa alimentar mas ganado vacuno, asimismo requiere asistencia técnica para poder hacer un mejor engorde, con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles le servirá como capital para adquirir ganado y una parte en la alimentación de su ganado, finalmente la ganancias de su negocio lo viene invirtiendo en la educación de sus hijos y el sustento diario; se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en tres cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Feliciana is a member of "Las Brisas del Río Blanco" Communal Bank in sector four of the Sucano community, located in the Pilcuyo district of El Collao province in the state of Puno. She is 58 years old, married with three children and has a 2nd grade education. She has worked for four years with the Manuela Ramos Movement and her business is raising cattle. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy feed for the cattle to fatten them to sell in the animal markets of Pilcuyo and Ilave. She wishes to feed her cattle but also requires technical assistance in order to fatten them more. This loan of 1,500 soles will serve as capital to acquire cattle and feed. The earnings from her business are invested in the education of her children and used to pay their daily expenses. She promises to repay the loan on time in three monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle and feed

loans.name: Crecer Group

texts.es:
El Banco Crecer inicia su segundo ciclo  con  18 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes en general, artesania, cereales, golosinas, leña, frutas, verduras, comidas.

Como es el caso D. Vidalina que es conviviente. Tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Vidalina venD. abarrotes por mayor a diferentes tiendas, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad D. Lima. Vidalina tiene una tienda en Lima, negocio que esta administrado por su esposo. Vidalina necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz.

Por otro lado Ursula es viuda, tiene 69 años y 8 hijos, Ursula realiza bellos trabajos artesanales en textiles como pasadizos, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. 1 D. sus hijos, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado. Además Ursula tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa. Ursula necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, arroz, aceite. 

Mientras que Martina es soltera, tiene 30 años y vive con sus padres, Martina viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. compra cereales, quesos. Además Martina trabaja como asistenta en un consultorio dental. 

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, 1050 soles haciendo un total D. 10,200 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideo, trigo, cebada, lanas, galletas, caramelos, frutas, verduras.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener un carro, sus hijos salgan adelante, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, construir su casa y tener una tienda estable.
texts.en:
The bank Crecer (“To Grow”) began a second circle with 18 members. The members have different businesses, like the sale of general groceries, crafts, cereal grains, sweets, wool, fruit, vegetables, and food. This is the case for Vidalina, who is in a common law marriage. She is 33 years old and has two children. Vidalina sells groceries for profit in different stores. She gets her products in the city of Lima. Vidalina has a stO. in Lima, a business that is run by her husband. Vidalina needs a loan of 900 soles that she would invest in the purchase of rice. On the other siD., Ursula is a widow. She is 69 years old and has 8 children. Ursula makes pretty crafts in textiles like table runners. She does this work with the help of one of her children, who does sales in the market. Also, Ursula has a small stO. in her home. Ursula needs a loan of 1050 soles that she would invest in the purchase of sugar, rice, and oil. While Martina is single, she is 39 years old and she lives with her parents. Martina travels to different markets of the region where she buys cereal grains and cheese. Also, Martina works as an assistant for a dental consultant. The members need different amounts of loans like 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, 1050 soles to make a total of 10,200 soles in loans from the community bank. Their loans would be invested in rice, sugar, oil, vermicelli noodles, wheat, barley, wool, cookies, candy, fruit, and vegetables. The dreams of the members are to have a car, for their children to improve their lives, to proviD. a good education for their children, to build a home and to have a stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, oil, vermicelli noodles, wheat, barley, wool, cookies, candy, fruit, and vegetables

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy K. is 38 years old. She is married with one boy, who is currently in senior high school. She is a hardworking woman who sells charcoal in her neighborhood. She has been in the charcoal business for the past 5 years. She travels to Edwura in the Ashanti region to buy her charcoal, which is about 400 kilometers from where she lives with her family. She is requesting a loan to buy charcoal to supply nearby restaurant operators, which she believes will give her additional income so she can support her husband to take care of the home. Mercy says her dream is that her family will own a house of their own.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Kantuta.
Delia es soltera, tiene 27 años y vive con sus padres, Delia es docente y trabaja en zonas rurales, Delia vende cosméticos por catalogaos sus productos los ofrece a sus amigos, colegas y sus ventas son al crédito.
Delia necesita un préstamo de 1500 dinero que será invertido en la compra vitrina para exhibir sus productos.
Los sueños de Delia son ampliar su negocio y tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the community bank Kantuta. Delia is single. She is 27 years old and she lives with her parents. Delia is a teacher and she works in rural areas. Delia sells cosmetics from catalogues. She offers her products to her friends, co-workers, and she takes orders on credit. Delia needs a loan of 1500, money that she would invest in the purchase of a cabinet to display her products. The dreams of Delia are to increase her business and to have a shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cabinet to display merchandise

loans.name: Constantina

texts.es:
La señora Constatina es socia del Banco Comunal “La Juleñita” de la Provincia Juli, Departamento de Puno; de  43 años de edad, estado civil casada, con 5 hijios, posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja desde hace tres años, con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, ella es artesana; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para comprar materiales para su  artesanía como lana de distintos colores, lana sintética, bayetas y otros.
Ella piensa mejorar su negocio de artesanía, ella desea tener un restaurante y un hospedaje , con este préstamo de  S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles podrá comprar al por mayor lana sintética  de distintos colores y bayetas, napa, y otros materiales, todo ello lo hace para obtener mas ingresos económicos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar, finalmente se compromete a pagar puntualmente su  préstamo en seis cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Constantina is a member of the communal bank "La Juleñita” located in the Juli province, Puno department. She is 43 years old and is married with five children. Constantina finished high school. Constantina has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years and works as a craftswoman. Her first loan was in the amount of $100 which she used to purchase materials for her crafts such as wool in different colors, synthetic wool and flannel. She wants to improve her business and wants to open a restaurant and offer lodging. With this loan in the amount of $400 she will be able to purchase wholesale quantities of synthetic wool in different colors as well as flannel, cord and other materials. This will allow her to obtain greater income so that she can improve the quality of life in her home. Finally, Constantina promises to pay this loan on time in six monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wholesale quantities of synthetic wool in different colors as well as flannel, cord and other materials.

loans.name: Mari

texts.en:
Mari M. is 25 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. Two are in elementary school, while the last born is breastfeeding. She is really dedicated to her work and supportive of her children. By her own effort and hard work through her business, Mari has supported her husband to start a farming business in the area of vegetables.

Mari owns and operates a cosmetics shop in the local market of Abofour, where she lives. She believes she can make her business grow bigger and brighter with loan support and wants to use the loan to buy more assorted cosmetics to increase her stock of goods. She believes this would help her to send her child to a good school next year. Mari belongs to a village bank called Jabaz. She also hopes to receive GH500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to support her home.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials and assorted cosmetics

loans.name: Salome

texts.es:
Salome es socia del Banco Comunal Kantuta.
Salome es casada, tiene 60 años y 4 hijos, Salome tiene un puesto en el mercado Playa Grau en donD. venD. cereales que adquiere D. las feriantes que le traen a su puesto, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Salome necesita un préstamo D. 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. pallar, garbanzo, lenteja, arveja.
El sueño D. Salome es mejorar su negocio, surtiendo con mas productos.
texts.en:
Salome is a member of the community bank Kantuta. Salome is married. She is 60 years old and she has 4 children. Salome has a stall in the market of Playa Grau, where she sells cereal grains that she gets from the sellers who come to her stall, an activity that she does every day. Salome needs a loan of 2100 soles, money that she would invest in the purchase of butter beans, garbanzo beans, lentils, and peas. Salome’s dreams are to improve her business, carrying more products.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy butter beans, garbanzo beans, lentils, and peas

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria L. is 44 years old. She is divorced and has 2 children. One of her children just got married and has moved out of the family house. The other one is in senior high school. She trades in fish, eggs, and meat at the Accra central market. She has been in this business for the past 13 years. She supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. Gloria says she works very hard to provide for her children since her ex-husband does not contribute to their welfare. She buys her stock from Tema. She is, however, convinced that her business can grow with increased capital and therefore wants the loan to buy more cartons of fish, crates of eggs, and meat. She hopes to use part of her proceeds to finance her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy cartons of fish, meat, and crates of eggs

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
La señora Hilaria es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco”, en el sector cuatro, comunidad D. Sucano, distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 47 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y tiene tres hijos, asimismo posee estudios D. primaria incompleta (cuarto D. primaria).
Trabaja desD. hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, posee un negocio D. compra y venta D. quesos y venta D. cereales en las ferias D. Pilcuyo, Acora y en los mercados D. Tacna; su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que destinó a la venta D. sus productos en la feria D. El Altipano en Tacna.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles le servirá como capital para poder adquirir ganado vacuno para engorD., y comprar quesos para llevarlos a los mercados D. Tacna y Arequipa. Asimismo ella piensa comprar Chuño, Papa entre otros y venderlos en los mercados D. Tacna los días domingos, las ganancias D. su múltiple negocio lo viene invirtiendo en el sustento diario y la educación D. sus hijos; se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en cinco cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Hilaria is a member of the Las Brisas del Rio Blanco community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Puno. She is 47 years old, married and the mother of three children. Her schooling was cut short and she only completed four years of elementary school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for three years. She operates a business buying and selling cheese and selling grains at markets in Pilcuyo, Acora and Tacna. Her first loan was for S/.300 [300 Peruvian soles], a sum she used to sell her products at the El Altipano market in Tacna. This S/.3000 loan will be used to buy cattle which she will fatten and cheese that she will take to the markets in Tacna and Arequipa. She is also thinking of buying "chuno" and potatoes, among other things, and selling them in the Tacna market on Sundays. The earnings from her multiple businesses will be used for day-to-day needs and her children's schooling. She is committed to repaying the loan promptly in five monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cattle for fattening and cheese to resell.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
La señora Herminia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Rio Blanco”, resiD. en el sector Uno, comunidad D. Sucano, distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 48 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y tiene seis hijos, asimismo posee estudios D. secundaria incompleta (primero D. secundaria).
Trabaja desD. hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, se dedica en su negocio D. engorD. D. ganado menor (ovinos y porcinos); su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que destinó a la compra D. porcinos para su engorD. y venta como carne en las ferias Ilave y Puno.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles le servirá como capital para poder adquirir mas ganado; además piensa dedicarse a su anterior negocio D. compra D. ropas para niños y su venta en las ferias D. Tacna y Arequipa; los ingresos surgidos D. su negocio lo viene invirtiendo en la educación superior D. sus hijos; espera que Manuela Ramos siempre les brinD. este tipo D. apoyos y agradece por su confianza y apoyo; finalmente se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en cinco cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Herminia is a member of the communal bank "Las Brisas del Rio Blanco". She lives in sector Uno, Sucano community, Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 48 years old, is married and has six children. She did not complete her high school education. Herminia has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years. She dedicates herself to the business of fattening small livestock (sheep and pigs). The first loan she received was in the amount of $100 which she used to purchase pigs for fattening and to sell their meat at fairs. The loan she is requesting in the amount of $950 will be used as capital to acquire more livestock. She also wants to dedicate herself to her previous business which was the purchase and sale of children's clothing at fairs in Tacna and Arequipa. She invests the income obtained from her business in the higher education of her children. She hopes that Manuela Ramos will always be able to proviD. this type of support and she is thankful for her confidence and support. Finally, she promises to pay her loan on time in five monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more livestock.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca L. is 31 years old. She is married and has given birth to 3 children. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a suburb of Accra. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, biscuits, etc. in the local market. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk supplies to expand her business. Rebecca hopes to make a good income from the expanded business to enable her to provide her children with a quality education.

loans.use: To buy bulk supplies for her grocery shop

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice A., a 29-year-old trader, is divorced and has one child, who is currently in school. She is a very resourceful young woman whose hard effort brings livelihood to the family. Rita supports her child by providing quality education through the sale of used shoes and ladies’ slippers. Selling used shoes and slippers has a very big market in Ghana, as brand new ones are very expensive for the poor. Therefore selling used shoes and slippers has created a market for many women like Alice in Accra and its surrounding areas.

With the loan, Alice wants to purchase more used shoes and slippers to increase her inventory. She believes the loan would help her save for her child’s education and also to rent a store for her trade.

loans.use: To buy second-hand shoes and slippers

loans.name: Malima

texts.en:
Malima S. is a 37-year-old trader, who is divorced and the mother of 5 children. Currently 4 of them attend school, and the oldest is learning a trade (seamstress). She lives with her children in a rented apartment in the Abofour community.

She trades in foodstuffs like bags of onions and bags of maize in the village market center. She also sells gallons of red oil to the food sellers in the surrounding towns. She treks to Kintampo to buy her stock of goods in bulk and sells them in the surrounding towns during their market days. She says through this business, she has endeavored to support 2 of her kids to finish junior high school. She requests the loan to enable her to buy increased stock of onions and maize to grow her business to boost profits. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education to give them a future and hope.

Malima is convinced that with her 4 years trade experience, when the loan is given to her she will be more resourceful to expand her business growth. She belongs to a village bank called Agnes. She hopes to receive GH500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: Malima wants the loan to buy cereals in bulk, such as maize.

loans.name: Alimatu

texts.en:
Alimatu Y. is a 52-year-old mother of 5 children. Two have successfully completed their university education, and the rest are in senior and junior high. She lives and works in Abofour in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Alimatu lives with her husband, who is also a trader in the village. Alimatu is very hardworking and resourceful for her family. She trades in charcoal and the sale of maize in her neighborhood market. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all Ghanaian traditional homes.

Alimatu obtains her supply of charcoal and bags of maize from the surrounding villages of Abofour, where she lives and retails them to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk supplies of charcoal and bags of maize to increase her inventory. She hopes the loan will enable her to increase her savings to pay her children’s educational fees.

Alimatu belongs to a village bank called Isaac. She hopes to receive GH450 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to support her husband in taking care of the home.

loans.use: To buy bulk supplies of charcoal and bags of maize

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora K. is a 25-year-old trader. She is married with 4 children who are currently attending school. She said it has been possible that her kids are schooling through the help of the government's free compulsory education. It is her daily dream to provide a quality education for her children to give them a better future.

She lives in a family house in Abofour in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Within the community there are diverse business activities, but most of them are farmers. Dora owns and operates a grocery shop with items like rice, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, assorted biscuits, candies, and evaporated milk.

She wants to use the loan to increase her stock of goods. With increased stock of different variety, she hopes to make more income to provide for the educational needs of her children. She hopes to pay back the loan in due time because she believes the loan would boost her business growth. Dora belongs to a village bank called Isaac. She hopes to receive GH500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more in taking care of the household.

loans.use: To buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks, and cooking oil

loans.name: Zoila Albina

texts.es: La Sra. Zoila vende en un kiosco en un colegio,  desde hace diez años, tiene 48 años de edad, y habita en anexo en villa Venezuela, con un hijo de 18 años de edad, que estudia, inicio cuando ingreso una solicitud para administrar el kiosco del bar., para esto presto dinero en una financiera, con esta solicitud en Afodenic es la segunda que ha sido de mucha beneficios ya que ha logrado invertir en su negocio, con esta solicitud de préstamo va invertir en infraestructura para hacer varias reparaciones a su casa de habitación. Sus planes a futuro es poder crecer y mejorar las finanzas para el bienestar de su familia. a si como poder terminar de hacer las mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zoila, 48, lives near Venezuela village with her 18-year old son, who is a student. She has been selling goods in a kiosk (inside a local school) for ten years. After making her initial request and securing the rights to operate the kiosk, she was able to begin operating her business by borrowing money from a local finance institution. She will use the current loan amount she is requesting from Afodenic to make necessary infrastructure improvements to her home. This loan will allow her not only to make these much-needed repairs, but also to grow (and therefore improve!) her family's financial well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials necessary for home improvement

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria N. is a 35-year-old woman. She is married but has no children. She lives with her husband in her matrimonial home in Abofour, a suburb of Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Victoria is an achiever and a resourceful woman. She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living.

Victoria has traded in bananas in Abofour market for more than 20 years. She treks to surrounding villages in the central part of Ghana to purchase bulk stocks of bananas from the farmers and retails them to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to pick enough stock to make enough profit to support her family. Victoria will buy the unripe bananas in bulk, and she will cover them with plantain leaves in the bush. She leaves them for a while so when they are ripe she will sell them to her customers.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bulk supplies of bananas to enable her to scale up her sales. She believes the loan would enable her to save more income to support her business growth. Victoria belongs to a village bank called Isaac. She hopes to receive GH500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to support her husband in taking care of the home.

loans.use: To purchase bulk supplies of bananas

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Doña Rosa es una mujer luchadora a sus 41 años sigue trabajando para apoyar a sus dos hijas de 12 y 18 años de edad, que están estudiando y lo que mas desea es verla una señoritas formadas profesionalmente, ella vende ropa de segunda desde hace dieciséis años que inicio con prestamos en una financieras,  su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada Traquinsa, esta es su séptima solicitud en Afodenic que por ser de bajo intereses y buenos plazo opto por trabajar con esta institución
La cual quiere invertir en la compra de una paca y comprar uniformes ya que es la temporada por el ingreso a clases. Sus planes es poder tener un local fijo donde ubicar su tienta para captar clientes y poder vender mas sus productos ya que por sus bajos costos y por ser de buena calidad los vende, es por ende espera crecer y tener su propia y bonita tienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is a real fighter. At 41 years of age, she continues working to support her two daughters who are students, 12 and 18 years old. What she wants more than anything is to see the young women professionally educated. She has sold second-hand clothes for 16 years, starting out with loans from a finance company. Her husband works in a private enterprise, Traquinsa. This is her seventh petition from Afodenic, which she has chosen to work with because of its low interest and good payment terms. She wants to invest the money in the purchase of a bale of clothing and to buy uniforms, since it is time for class admissions. Her plan is to be able to set up shop in a fixed premises in order to attract customers and to be able to sell more of her goods, which sell because of their low price and good quality. Therefore, her hope is that her business will grow and that she will have her own, lovely shop.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothing and uniforms

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
ADELA CÁRDENAS GONZALES, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Guerreras”, ubicado en el Jr. Fernando Stall N° 187  de la Ciudad de Pucallpa, Distrito de Callería, tiene 02 hijos, el trabajo que realiza su esposo es independiente, es socia de Manuela Ramos hace 02 años.

Su primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró implementos para repostería (tazones, fuentes, moldes) ella prepara, tortas, pasteles, bufetes, moldes a la vez administra un hospedaje llamado “Las Orquídeas”

Con este préstemo de S/.2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en  la compra de materiales de limpieza para el Hospedaje como, papel higiénico, 04 jabones de tocador, 02 cajas, toallas 02 docenas, sábanas 06 juegos, ambientado el local. La señora ADELA continúa con su preparación de tortas y bufetes.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por su apoyo, se siente bien.
texts.en:
Adela Cardenas Gonzales is a member of the communal bank "Las Guerreras" which is located at Fernando Stall N° 187 in the city of Pucallpa, district of Callería. Adela has two children and her husband works independently. She has been a member of Manuela Ramos for two years. The first loan Adela received was in the amount of $100 and she used it to purchase implements for confectionery (bowls, molds, serving dishes). She prepares tarts and cakes and also runs a lodging business named "Las Orquideas." She will invest this loan of $800 in the purchase of cleaning products for the lodgings such as toilet paper, soap, towels and sheets. Adela will also continue preparing her baked goods. Adela is thankful to Manuela Ramos for her support.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cleaning products for lodging.

loans.name: Adilia Yudith

texts.es:
ADILIA YUDITH VÁSQUEZ D. CALENZANI, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valientes” ubicado en el Jr. Coronel Portillo N° 556-B del Distrito D. Callería, tiene 45 años D. edad, 06 hijos, su esposo trabaja en petróleos.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró productos D. belleza D. marca Unique en poca cantidad, su esposo le ayudaba en su trabajo, en la venta por catálogos.

Con este préstamo D. S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, implementa más su negocio; invertir en productos chinos y artículos D. perfumería y belleza.

Muy contenta por el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Adilia Yudith Vasquez D. Calenzani is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Valientes" located in Jr. Coronel Portillo N° 556-B in the district of Callería. She is 45 years old and has six children. Her husband works in the oil industry. The first loan Adilia received was in the amount of $100 which she used to purchase Unique brand beauty products in small quantities. Her husband used to help her in her work in catalog sales. With this loan in the amount of $650 she will further establish her business by investing in Chinese products, perfumes and beauty products. She is very happy with the support that Manuela Ramos provides.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Further establish her business by investing in Chinese products, perfumes and beauty products.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Mercedes del carmen A. Pérez tiene la edad de 20 años, habita en el barrio la borgoña ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, ella es soltera vive con sus padres, los planes para su familia es mejorar las condiciones de la pulpería para obtener mejor ganancia y apoyarle mas a sus padres; desde hace  cinco años se dedica a esta actividad, la cual inicio con ayuda de sus padres, esta es la primer solicitud de préstamo pues quiere invertir en granos básicos, y consumos diarios para ofertar a sus clientes. Lo cual espera sea de muchos beneficios como en su vida personal, y en su negocio. Entre otros planes es mejorar la infraestructura del local para  brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ms. Mercedes del Carmen A. P. is 20 years old and lives in the Borgoña neighborhood in the town of Ticuantepe. She is single and lives with her parents. She plans to improve the conditions of her family store to increase profits and provide them with more support. She started working in the store five years ago, which she started with the help of her parents. This is her first loan request, and she wants to use the proceeds to purchase basic grains and daily inventory to offer her clients. She hopes this will benefit her personal life and her business. Among other things, she plans to improve the building where the store is located to provide a better service for her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains and daily inventory for her store

loans.name: Carmen Francisca

texts.es:
CARMEN FRANCISCA E. SANCHEZ, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valientes” ubicado en el Jr. Trujillo N° 250 del Distrito de Callería, tiene 48 años de edad, 03 hijos, su esposo trabaja en la extracción de madera.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, a condicionó unos cuartos y los puso al alquiler.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,800.00 Nuevos Soles, arregló los ambientes de sus habitaciones, pinto la fachada, arreglo las ventanas y el techo para que sus inquilinos se sientan cómodos.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por apoyarle en el momento que más necesitaba, gracias Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Carmen Francisca E. Sanchez is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Valientes" located at Jr. Trujillo N° 250 in the district of Callería. Carmen is 48 years old and has three children. Her husband works in the removal of wood. The first loan Carmen received was in the amount of $100 which she used to prepare some rooms for rent. She will use this loan in the amount of $575 to improve the conditions of the rooms, paint the facade, repair the windows and the roof so that her renters will be comfortable. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for this support which she was granted right at the moment when she most needed it.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix the conditions of rooms, paint the facade, fix windows and roof.

loans.name: Jenitt Jacqueline

texts.es:
Jenitt es socia del Bancomunal Las Amigas. 
Jenitt es casada, tiene 33 años, dos hijos de 6 y 11 años ellos estudian en la escuela, ella se dedica a venta de ropa.  Llegó a Lima por el trabajo de su esposo, él es chofer profesional, vio la necesidad económica que había en su casa, es cuando empieza a trabajar en la venta ropa  desde hace varios años, le va bien. Cuando viaja a Lambayeque a ver a su familia aprovecha y lleva ropa para venderles.

Se compró su terreno hace un  año y  lo ha construido de madera machihembrado  todavía no tienen pared  de ladrillo.
Tiene dos años en Finca, encuentra mucho apoyo económico, pudo invertir, ha aprendido a organizarse  a no sacar un crédito por sacar, Le gusta las reuniones del Bancomunal, sus compañeras son responsables  y muy solidarias.
Jenitt necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, para invertir en la compra de uniformes escolares, polos, chompas, pantalones, camisas.   
El sueño de Jenitt  es construir su casa  y tener una boutique.
texts.en:
Jenitt is a member of the communal bank Las Amigas. Jenitt is married, 33 years old, has two sons aged 6 and 11 who are studying in school and she is dedicated to selling clothes. She arrived in Lima because of her husband's work; he is a professional driver and when she saw the economic need in her house she began to work selling clothes and for several years she has done well. When she travels to Lambayeque to see her family she takes advantage of the opportunity to bring clothes and sell them. She bought the land a year ago, it was build on grooved wood that still doesn't have a brick wall. She has spent two years on the farm, found a lot of economic support, was able to invest and has learned to organize themselves and not take credit from outside. She likes the meetings in Bancomunal, her partners are responsible and very supportive. Jenitt needs a loan of 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of school uniforms, polo shirts, sweaters, pants, shirts. Jenitt dreams of building her house and having a boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Jenitt needs a loan of 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of school uniforms, polo shirts, sweaters, pants, shirts.

loans.name: Cintya

texts.es:
Cintya es socia del Bancomunal Las Amigas 
Cintya tiene 21 años, es soltera, es la menor de tres hermanos,  el negocio que tiene es familiar, se dedican a la Publicidad en su casa. El negocio lo empezaron sus padres, su mamá era socia del Bancomunal por varios años. Lamentablemente su mama murió de un aneurisma de un momento a otro hace dos años,  ella habló con la promotora para poder  pertenecer al Bancomunal y ser socia en Finca, y la aceptaron con gusto. Su negocio tiene más de diez años, ella se encarga de los trabajos manuales, su papá estudió serigrafía, ellos realizan trabajos para  varios colegios.

Cintya necesita un crédito de 2800 soles, para, invertir en la campaña escolar y hacer, insignias, correas, acrílicos, distintivos. 
El sueño de Cintya es estudiar publicidad y poner una imprenta.
texts.en:
Cintya is a member of the communal bank Las Amigas. She is 21 years old, single and is the youngest of three siblings. Her business is the family business, they are dedicated to advertising in their house. The business was started by her parents, her mother was a member of the communal bank for several years. Unfortunately her mother died of an aneurysm two years ago. Cintya talked to the promoter to be able to belong to the community bank and be a member in Finca and they accepted her with pleasure. Her business is more than 10 years old, she is responsable for the manual work, her father studied serigraphy and they do work for various schools. Cintya needs a loan of 2800soles to invest in the school year and make badges, belts, acrylics. Cintya's dream is to study publicity and have a printing press.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cintya needs a loan of 2800soles to invest in the school year and make badges, belts, acrylics,

loans.name: Daniel Enrique

texts.es:
Daniel es socio del Bancomunal Las Amigas 
Daniel es conviviente, tiene 39 años, cuatro hijos, de 19 y 17 trabajan, su hijo de 15 años no quiere estudiar, y el de 11 años esta en la escuela.  
Daniel  es de Lima, solo estudió hasta el tercero de secundaria, por falta de dinero, trabajó en varios oficios pero a los veinte años se dedico a ser cachinero, (la persona que recolecta fierro, botellas, papeles)

Daniel conoció a su esposa comprando chatarra por las calles. Han alquilado un local hace un año y medio, ella es la cajera, ahora vende cada semana una tonelada de fierro, papel, o plástico. Según como junten, ya tiene clientes fijos que cada semana lo buscan para comprarle.
Daniel necesita un crédito de 600 soles, para comprar chatarra, plásticos fierro.
texts.en:
Daniel is a member of the communal bank Las Amigas. Daniel is married, 39 years old and has 4 children. The 19 and 17-year olds work, his 15 year-old son doesn't want to study and his 11 year-old is in school. Daniel is from Lima, he only studied until the third year of high school because he lacked the money and he worked in various trades until he was 20 years old when he dedicated himself to being a cahinero, or a person who collects iron, bottles and plastic. Depending on how much they collect, they already have secured clients that look for them every week to buy from them. Daniel needs a loan of 600 soles to buy scrap metal, iron and plastics.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Daniel needs a loan of 600 soles to buy scrap, plastic, iron

loans.name: Lidez

texts.es:
Lidez es socia del Banco Comunal Kantuta.
Lidez  es casada, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, Lidez tiene un puesto en el mercado Playa Grau en donde vende comida, prepara desayuno y almuerzo que vende a los comerciantes del mercado, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además junto a su esposo se dedican a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno.
Lidez necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en el negocio de su esposo para la compra de ganado.
Los sueños de Lidez son comprar un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Lidez is a member of the communal bank Kantuta. Lidez is married, 39 years old and has 3 children. She has a market stall in Playa Grau where she sells food, prepares breakfast and lunch that she sells to the traders in the market, an activity that she does every day. In addition, together with her husband she is dedicated to buying and selling cattle. Lidez needs a loan of 2100 soles that will be invested in her husband's business to purchase cattle. Lidez dreams of purchasing land to build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Claudia Pamela

texts.es:
CLAUDIA PAMELA P. CÁRDENAS, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Guerreras”, ubicado en el Jr. Fernando Stall N° 187 en la ciudad de Pucallpa, en el Distrito de callería, tiene 21 años de edad, es una joven muy trabajadora, no tiene niños, es soltera, su actividad es la cocina y repostería.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró moldes para hacer tortas y galletas y venderlos en un billar en el que trabaja su papá.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá para comprar más moldes, y materia prima para realizar su preparación como: un honor moderno, para tortas, esencias, azúcar, brinda servicios de alimentos bufetes, comidas varias.

Está muy agradecida de Manuela Ramos, porque le da un gran apoyo a las mujeres para poder trabajar.
texts.en:
Claudia Pamela P. Cardenas belongs to the Communal Bank 'Las Guerreras," located on Jr. Fernando Stall No. 187 in the city of Pucallpa, in the Calleria district. She is 21 years old, and is a very hardworking young owman,. She does not have children, is single, and her activity is cooking and baking. The first loan she received was for 200 Nuevos Soles, she bought molds to make cake and chickens and sold them at her father's work. With this loan of 1500 Nuevos Soles, she will invest in buying more molds and raw material to complete her perparation like: a modern oven for cakes, spices, sugar, and various foods. She is very thankful to Manuela Ramos, because it gives a lot of support to women to be able to work.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying molds and ingredients for cakes

loans.name: Maria Elisa

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Kantuta.
Maria es casada, tiene 45 años y 2 hijos, Maria tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado que esta ubicado en una calle concurrida, Maria anteriormente tenia su fuente de soda y en los últimos meses ha ampliado su negocio, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de 3 personales.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, gaseosas.
Los sueños de Maria son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Kantuta Communal Bank. Maria is married, 45 years old and she has 2 children. She has a restaurant in a rented space located in a busy street. Previously, Maria had just a soda fountain, and she has expanded her business in the last few months, which she operates with 3 employees. Maria needs a $950 loan to purchase rice, sugar, and sodas. Maria's dreams are to provide a good education for her children and to continue improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, and sodas.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
CONSUELO S. DÍAZ, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Líderes”, ubicada en el Jr. Atenas del Ucayali N° 349, Distrito de Callería tiene 25 años de edad, 02 hijos menores, su esposo se dedica a la extracción de madera.

El primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró implementos para vender comida en un puesto del mercado N° 03, adquirió muchos clientes por su sazón y atención, con la ayuda de su mamá.

El último préstamo que recibió fue de S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compró arroz 20 kg., azúcar 08 kh., aceite 12 litros, una docena de platos, vasos, una docena de cubiertos, ambientación de su local, ahora tiene personal que trabaja para ella.

Muy agradecida de Manuela Ramos por confiar en ella, se siente contenta porque de tal manera también colabora en su hogar.
texts.en:
Consuelo S. D. belongs to the communal bank, "Mujeres Líderes" (Women Leaders). She is 25 and has 2 young children. Her husband is a logger. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles. With it, she purchased supplies to sell food in a market. She acquired many clients because of her good food and service and with the help of her mother. The last loan she received was for 2,000 nuevos soles. She purchased 20 kg of rice, 8 kg of sugar, 12 liters of oil, one dozen plates, glasses, and one dozen place settings. She also fixed up her location. Now she has employees who work for her. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for trusting in her. She feels happy because in this way she can help support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She purchased 20 kg of rice, 8 kg of sugar, 12 liters of oil, one dozen plates, glasses, one dozen place settings, and fixed up her location.  She now has employees that work for her.

loans.name: Danilza

texts.es:
DANILZA G. D. LÓPEZ, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Solidarias”, ubicado en el Jr. Ricardo Palma N° 383 del Distrito D. Callería, tiene 57 años D. edad, un hijo, es madre soltera, con 03 años D. socia en Manuela Ramos. 

El primer préstamo fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró artículos D. pasamanería, vendía jugos, sandwichs, kekes, en su casa, el negocio seguía progresando.

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compró una vitrina chica para poder mostrar sus artículos, golosinas, artículos D. pasamanería en general.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por confiar y cree en ella, ya que es una mamá soltera que le ayudaron a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Danilza G. D. Lopez belongs to the “Women United” cooperative bank located on Richardo Palma Street in the Callería district. She is 57 years old, the single mother of one son, and has belonged to Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan was for 300.00 Peruvian soles, with which she bought stationery and school supplies, sold juices, sandwiches, and smalle cakes in her home. The business continued to progress. With this loan of 1,000.00 Peruvian soles, she bought a small display case to show her merchandise which includes snacks and general stationery and school supplies. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for having confidence and believing in her, as she is a single mother who they’ve helped get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a small display case in which to show her merchandise, generally stationery, school supplies, and snacks.

loans.name: Corazon Group

texts.es:
El Banco Corazón inicia su segundo ciclo con  17 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como ropa, cereales, tuberculos, verduras, abarrotes en general, articulos D. ferretería, plásticos, cereales y tambien se dedican a la africultura.

Como es el caso D. Gerarda es casada, tiene 49 años y 4 hijos, Gerarda tiene un puesto en el mercado Carmen Alto, en donD. venD. papa, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además se dedica a la agricultura D. papa en sus terrenos D. Ccasaorcco. Gerarda necesita un préstamo D. 300 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. papa.

Mientras que Gregoria es casada, tiene 49 años y 6 hijos, Gregoria viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. venD. abarrotes y D. las ferias compra cereales. Además Gregoria junto a su esposo venD. productos naturales. Gregoria necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. productos naturales y arroz.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles,  haciendo un total D. 8,500 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideo, trigo, cebada, chompas, blusas, verduras, papa.

Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar sus negocios, sus hijos sean profesionales y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Heart Bank is beginning its second cycle with 17 associates.

The associates carry out various businesses such as selling clothing, grains, root vegetables, green vegetables, general foodstuffs, hardware, plastic goods and also farming.

Like the case of Gerarda, who is married, is 47 years old and has four children. She has a stall in the Carmen Alto market where she sells potatoes every day. Moreover, she farms potatoes in her lands in Casaorco. Gerarda needs a loan of 300 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of potatoes.

Whereas Gregoria is married, is 49 years old and has six children. She travels to the different markets of the region where she sells foodstuffs and buys grains. FurthermO., Gregoria and her husband sell natural products. Gregoria needs a loan of 600 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of natural products and rice.

The associates need different loan amounts, such as 300, 600 and 900 soles, making a total loan of 8,500 soles in the Communal Bank.

Their loans will be invested in rice, sugar, oil, pasta, wheat, barley, sweaters, blouses, green vegetables, potatoes.

The dreams of the associates are to improve their businesses, that their children be professionals and to offer their children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For rice, sugar, oil, pasta, wheat, barley, sweaters, blouses, green vegetables, potatoes.

loans.name: Dina Emerita

texts.es:
DINA EMERITA A. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Guerreras” ubicado en el Psje. Centenario Mz. A-24, Lt. 15 AA.HH. 09 de Octubre, Distrito de Callería, tiene 50 años de edad, 06 hijos, su esposo es técnico en refrigeración.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró ropas de segunda mano como: Polos, shores, pantalones, en poca cantidad, llevaba a vender al pimental km. 34 de la C.F.B. del Distrito de Campo Verde – Ucayali.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,700.00 Nuevos Soles, comprara 01 fardo de ropas usadas, vende en el pimental, tiene muchos clientes le hacen pedidos, ella los cumple en el tiempo determinado.

Está muy contenta con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos, súper contenta con su familia y su trabajo.
texts.en:
DINA EMERITA A. C. is a member of the “Las Guerreras” microfinance institute located on Centenario Way, block A-24, lot 15 AA.HH. 09 de Octubre, in the district of Callería. She is a 50-year-old mother with 6 children. Her husband is an air conditioning technician.

With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased used clothing, such as T-shirts, shorts and pants in small quantities. She sold her merchandise in Pimental km. 34 C.F.B in the Campo Verde district of Ucayali.

With this 1,700.00 PEN loan, she will purchase 1 bundle of used clothing. She sells her merchandise in Pimental. She has many customers who put in orders, which she fills on time.

She is very happy with Manuela Ramos for its support, and super happy with her family and job.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 1 bundle of clothing

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
ELIZABETH DÁVILA O., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valientes” ubicado en el Jr. Saenz Peña N° 320 en la Ciudad de Pucallpa, del Distrito de Callería, tiene 51 años de edad, 02 hios, su esposo es comerciante vende repuestos.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró tapears para poder repartir la comida que ella preparaba, su contrato con la Dirección Regional de Educación, brindaba servicios alimenticios, cambio su tipo de venta ahora vende madera en tablillas.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, invierte en tablillas machimbreadas de shihuahuaco de tipo cortos el cual trabaja solo con pedidos, que usa para cielorraso.

Está muy agradecida con el gran apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth D. O. belongs to the Mujeres Valientes (Courageous Women) Village Bank, located at Jr. Saenz Peña No. 320 in the Callería district of Pucallpa. She is 51, has two children, and her husband is a spare parts salesman. She used her first loan of 300 nuevos soles to buy plastic containers for delivering the food she prepared as per her food-service contract with the Regional Directorate of Education. Now she sells wood panels instead. Elizabeth will invest this loan of 1000 nuevos soles in short Shihuahuaco tongue and groove ceiling panels, for which she only takes custom orders. She is very appreciative of the great deal of support she gets from Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in Shihuahuaco tongue and groove ceiling panels, for which she only takes custom orders

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
ELSA T. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sol Naciente” ubicado en el Jr. Guillermo Sisley N° 735 del Distrito de Callería, la señora Elsa tiene 54 años de edad, 05 hijos, su esposo es médico.

El primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, apertura su fuente de soda, vendía comidas a la carta, jugos, gaseosas, cervezas, ceviches, al ver que la fuente de soda crecía, los clientes clamaban.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, amplió su negocio compró en cantidad sus productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, refaccionó su techo.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos su gran éxito que ahora viene teniendo es solo pedidos porque su sazón es única y el apoyo económico que le brinda.
texts.en:
Elsa T. C. belongs to the Rising Sun (“Sol Naciente”) Community Bank located in Jr. Guillermo Sisley N° 735 in the district of Callería. Mrs. Elsa is 54 years old, has 5 children, and her husband is a doctor. The first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos was for 300 soles. She opened a snack bar and sold food à la carte, juice, soda, beer, and ceviche. The clients were clamoring for her products, so the snack bar grew. With this loan for 1000 soles, she will grow her business by buying more products, like rice, sugar, oil and will fix her roof. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for her success, as she now takes orders because her seasoning is unique and because of the support that it offers her.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products, like rice, sugar, and oil, and to fix her roof

loans.name: Erika Pilar

texts.es:
ERIKA PILAR V. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Guerreras” ubicado en el Jr. Padre Gimer N° 129 del Distrito de Callería, tiene 29 años de edad, 02 hijos, su esposo es administrador, es socia 03 años de Manuela Ramos.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compro un poco de joyas, perfumes, vende en el mercado, a crédito, su cobranza es diario, vende en el mercado de Bellavista del Jr. Maya de Brito.

Con este préstamo de S/.3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará más joyas de productos Unique, perfumes, la venta es igual en el mercado a crédito, el cobro es diario, la venta crece cada vez más.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por apoyarla y así formar su pequeña empresa, es lo que más anhelaba.
texts.en:
Erika Pilar V. R. belongs to The Warriors (“Las Guerreras”) Community Bank, located in Jr. Padre Gimer N° 129 in the district of Callería. She is 29 years old, has 2 children, and her husband is an administrator. She has been a member of Manuela Ramos for 3 years. The first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos was for 300 soles. She bought some jewelry and perfumes that she sells in the market on credit. She recovers this daily. She sells her products in the market in Bellavista in Jr. Maya de Brito. With this loan of 3000 soles, she will buy more unique jewelry products and perfumes. She will sell these in the market on credit. Her recovery is daily, and her sales will grow more every time. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for supporting her and, because of this, she has begun her small business, which is what she wanted most.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more jewelry and perfumes so that her business will grow

loans.name: Rumichaka Group

texts.es:
El Banco Rumichaca que significa lugar D. piedra en quechua, el Banco Comunal inicia su cuarto ciclo con  20 socias. Las socias son D. la comunidad D. Rumichaca que se encuentra a 15 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como venta D. comida, abarrotes en general, venta D. animales, también se dedican a la agricultura, crianza D. animales los cuales los comercializan en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Como es el caso D. Norma que es casada, tiene 33 años y 4 hijos, Norma se dedica a la agricultura D. verduras. Norma necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. semillas.

Por otro lado Dionisia es casada, tiene 37 años y 6 hijos, Dionisia tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa en donD. venD. bebidas, además Dionisia se dedica a la agricultura D. verduras y alfalfa. Dionisia necesita un préstamo D. 300 soles para la compra D. abonos.

Mientras que Maria Elena es casada, tiene 39 años y 6 hijos, Maria Elena se dedica a la siembra D. verduras que luego venD. en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, Maria necesita un préstamo D. 300 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. semillas. 

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, haciendo un total D. 10,450 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. animales, semillas, abono, cerveza, gaseosas y para el pago D. los peones.

Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar la producción en sus tierras, sus hijos culminen sus estudios, progresar mas y tener capital propio.
texts.en:
The Rumichaca Bank, which means a place with stone in Quechua, is a community bank and began its 4th cycle with 20 members. The members are from the community of Rumichaca, which you can find 15 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. The members are in different businesses such as food sales, general groceries, selling animals and also agriculture and raising animals that are sold in the markets of the city of Ayacucho. Such is the case with Norma who is married, 33 years old with 4 children, Norma is dedicated to growing vegetables. Norma needs a loan of 600 soles to be invested in the purchase of seeds. Furthermore Dionisia is married, 37 years old with 6 children, Dionisia has a small store in her home where she sells drinks, she is also dedicated to growing vegetables and alfalfa. Dionisia needs a loan of 300 soles to buy fertilizers. While Maria Elena is married, 39 years old with 6 children, Maria Elena is dedicated to planting vegetables that she then sells in the market in the city of Ayacucho. Maria needs a loan of 300 soles that will be invested in the purchase of seeds. The members need different amounts of loans such as 300,600 and 900 soles, totalling 10,450 soles in loans from the communal bank. Their loans will be invested in the purchase of animals, seeds, fertilizer, beer, drinks and to pay laborers. The dreams of the members are to improve the production in their lands, that their children finish their studies, progress more and have their own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of animals, seeds, fertilizer, beer, drinks and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
ERIKA RÍOS GARCÍA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “De la Amistad II”, ubicado en el Jr. Libertad N° 820 int. 08 del Distrito de Callería, tiene 25 años de edad, dos menores hijos, su esposo trabaja vendiendo ropas en el mercado, con tres años de ser socia de Manuela Ramos.

Su primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró ropas, shores, blusas, polos, vendía de casa en casa, adquirió muchos clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, compró sábanas importadas, blusas, shorts, zapatos, camisas, todo lo vende en el Mercado, deja a crédito, cobra diario, luego vuelve a invertir.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por la confianza y credibilidad de su persona.
texts.en:
Erika R. G. belongs to the From Friendship II Community Bank, located in Jr. Libertad N° 820 int. 08 in the district of Callería. She is 25 years old, has two young children, and her husband sells clothes in the market. She has been a member of Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan was for 300 soles. She bought clothes, blouses, and polo shirts. She sold her products door to door and gained many clients. With this loan of 1500 soles, she will buy imported sheets, blouses, shorts, shoes, and shirts. She will sell of this in the market on credit. She will cover this daily and then will invest the money. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for their trust and credibility that they have.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy imported sheets, blouses, shorts, shoes, and shirts, which she will sell in the market

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
FELICITA RODRIGUEZ S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sol Naciente” ubicado en el Jr. Augusto B. Leguia N° 1098 del Distrito de Callería, tiene 59 años de edad, 06 hijos, su esposo es carpintero.

El primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró harina por sacos e implementó su panadería, poco a poco creció la venta, los clientes no dejaban de llegar, sus panes hasta el día domingo, trabaja mucho.

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000.00 construyó un techito, compró madera, calaminas, clavos, pues ahora vende comidas, en el patio de su casa, los domingos vende pollos a la parrilla.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por el gran apoyo que le brinda
texts.en:
Felicita Rodriguez S. belongs to the Rising Sun Community Bank, located in Jr. Augusto B. Leguia N° 1098 in the district of Callería. She is 59 years old, has 6 children, and her husband is a carpenter. Her first loan was for 300 soles. She bought sacks of flour, stocked her bakery, and little by little grew her sales. She always has clients for her bread until Sunday. She works very hard. With this loan of 2000 soles, she will build a roof and buy wood, corrugated iron, and nails, since she sells food on the patio of her house. On Sundays, she sells grilled chicken. She is thankful for Manuela Ramos for the great support they offer her.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood, corrugated iron, and nails to fix her roof, since she sells food on her patio

loans.name: Gladys Patricia

texts.es:
GLADYS PATRICIA P. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Solidarias” ubicada en el Jr. Raymondi N° 901 del Distrito de Callería, tiene 36 años de edad, 03 hijos menores de edad, socia de Manuela Ramos 02 años, su esposo es Técnico en Computación.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró productos de primera necesidad e instaló una pequeña bodega en la sala de su casa.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, compró ½ saco de arroz, ½ saco de azúcar, ½ caja de leche, ½ caja de huevos, ambientación de su local como la iluminación y el pintado.

Contenta con Manuela Ramos por el apoyo que le brinda.
texts.en:
Gladys Patricia P. M. belongs to the Solidary Women Community Bank, located in Jr. Raymondi N° 901 in the district of Callería. She is 36 years old and has 2 young children. She has been a member of Manuela Ramos for 2 years. Her husband is a Computing Technician. With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought basic goods and started a small grocery store in her house. With this loan of 1500 soles, she will buy ½ sack of rice, ½ sack of sugar, ½ box of milk, and ½ box of eggs. She will also improve the setting of her store with lighting and painting. She is happy with Manuela Ramos for the support that they offer her.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy  ½ sack of rice, ½ sack of sugar, ½ box of milk, and ½ box of eggs and to improve the setting of her store with lighting and painting.

loans.name: Lili

texts.es:
LILI G. G., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Guerreras ubicado en la Calle Salaverry N° 120, AA.HH. 09 de Octubre, Distrito de Callería, tiene 60 años de edad, 02 hijos, madre soltera, 09 años socia en  Manuela Ramos.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró 40 pollos vendía en el mercado de Bellavista, ubicado en el Jr. Maya de Britto, dejó de vender porque falleció su hija, la que más le ayudaba por lo menos, 02 años, luego vendió jugos, sandwich en su casa, regreso luego a Manuela Ramos.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500.00 comprara 10 cajas de cajas de gaseosa, 16 paquetes de gaseosas descartables, arreglo de su local.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos el gran apoyo y por entender su ausencia, por estar de luto, y no va apartarse, siempre va a estar con nosotras.
texts.en:
LILI G. G., belongs to “Las Guerreras" communal bank located at Salaverry Street N° 120, AA.HH. 09 de Octubre, Callería district. She is 60 years old, has 2 children, is a single mother and has been a member of Manuela Ramos for 9 years. The first loan that she received was for S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles with which she bought 40 chickens and sold them at the Bellavista market located at Jr. Maya de Britto. She stopped selling for two years because her daughter passed away, who helped her the most. Then she sold juices and sandwiches in her house and later returned to Manuela Ramos. With this loan of S/.1,500.00 she will buy 10 boxes of soft drinks, 16 packages of disposable soft drinks and will fix up her stand. She thanks Manuela Ramos for the great support and for understanding her absence because of her mourning. She is not going to distance herself and always is going to be with us.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 boxes of soft drinks, 16 packages of disposable soft drinks and to fix up her stand.

loans.name: Bismarck Antonio

texts.es:
EL microempresario Bismarck Antonio M. tiene 42 años de edad, es casado con 4 hijos todos estudian niveles primario y secundario respectivamente. El señor M. se dedica hace más de 20 años a la profesión de barbero y a la vez aprovecha su local para vender refrescos.

Este microempresario tiene muchos clientes quienes lo visitan ya que cuenta con una variedad de cortes de pelos tanto estilos de moda como otros que son preferidos por personas adultas.

Actualmente el señor  M. tiene 2 sillas de barbero por lo que contrata a otra persona para que también realice esta actividad, sin embargo tiene una buena demanda de clientes por lo que requiere aumentar su inventario comprando otra silla, espejos y televisor que le permita dar una mejor atención a sus clientes, esto con la finalidad de obtener mayores ganancias y  poder pagar el alquiler del local.

Por tal razón solicita se le financie lo siguiente:


1 silla de barbero la cual tiene un valor de US$ 500 dólares, 2 espejos grandes  que les cuesta US$ 100 dólares cada uno y 1 televisor a colores que le cuesta US$ 300 dólares.
texts.en:
The micro-entrepreneur Bismarck Antonia M. is 42 years old and is married with 4 children, all of whom are in primary or secondary school. Mr. M. has been a barber for more than 20 years and is now taking advantage of his store to sell refreshments. This micro-entrepreneur has many clients who visit him because they know that he can give them a variety of haircuts, including fashionable styles, like those that adult men like. At present, Mr. M. has 2 chairs in his store, so he hires another person who also does this activity. However, he has many clients, so he needs to buy another chair, mirrors, and television, which will allow him to take better care of his clients. This will allow him to earn more income so that he can pay the rent for his store. As a result, he is requesting financing for the following: 1 barber’s chair for $500, 2 mirrors for $100 each, and 1 television for $300.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 1 barber's chair, 2 large mirrors, and a color television

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
LIZ Z. GUERRA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Solidarias” ubicado en el Jr. Nemesio Cacedo Mz. 17, Lt. 13, AA.HH. “José Olaya” del Distrito de Yarinacocha, ella tiene 40 años, 03 hijos, es madre soltera.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, utilizó en tramitar sus documentos y servicio varios en la extracción de maderas.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, compró madera, realiza trámites documentarios forestales, envía a lima.

Muy agradecida de Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de trabajar y así mantener a sus hijos.
texts.en:
LIZ Z. GUERRA, belongs to the “Mujeres Solidarias” Communal Bank located at Jr. Nemesio Cacedo Mz. 17, Lt. 13, AA.HH. “José Olaya” in the Yarinacocha District. She is 40 years old, has 3 children and is a single mother. The first loan that she received was for S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, which she used to process her documents and for various services related to wood extraction. With this loan of S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles she buys wood, she carries out forestry work and sends it to Lima. She is very thankful to Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to work and support her children.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buys wood, carries out forestry work and sends it to Lima.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señora Rosa Sánchez C. tiene la edad de 34 años habita en el reparto Juan ramón padilla  en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su familia ella es soltera , no tiene hijos , doña Rosa desde hace veinte años tiene su propio negocio el cual con las ganancia que obtiene le apoya a su familia  , los planes para su familia es incrementar su inventario de su negocio para poder ayudar  mas  con los gastos a sus padres ; ya que ella tiene el sueño de construirle su casa,  doña Rosa con su propio esfuerzos y el apoyo de afodenic ha incrementado su negocio y esta muy contenta con los resultado , esta señora es muy trabajadora ya que los fines de semana vende comida para obtener otros ingresos. y salir adelante con su negocio, con esta solicitud va invertir en productos varios, como granos básicos, productos enlatados, carnes entre otros.
texts.en:
Rosa Sánchez C. is 34 years and lives with her family in the Juan Ramón Padilla neighborhood in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She is single and does not have any children. For the past twenty years Rosa has had her own business and with the earnings that she obtains she supports her family. The plans for her family are to increase her business' inventory to be able to help her parents more with their expenses. She already has the dream of building them a house. Rosa with her own effort and support from AFODENIC has enlarged her business and is very happy with the results. This woman is very hard working as on the weekends she sells food to obtain other income and get ahead with her business. With this request she is going to invest in various products such as basic grains, canned goods, and meats among others.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains and canned goods to diversify her grocery store

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
La Señora de Nombre Silvia Elena Rodríguez B. tiene la edad de 41 años, su estado civil es soltera, Doña Silvia tiene 4 hijos sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 25 cursa el 4 año de su carrera, su otro hijo de 23 años de edad cursa el 3 año de su carrera, su otra hija de 22 años cursa el 1 año de su carrera y su hija menor de 9 años cursa el 5 grado de primaria, sus propósitos  son de producir mayores volúmenes de unidades de materiales para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, sus deseos son de mejorar la calidad de sus productos ya que así aumentaría sus ventas por que sus clientes se mostrarían satisfechos por el tipo de producto que fabrica, sus sueños son de adquirir maquinas mas modernas para la elaboración de materiales de construcción para garantizar la estabilidad de su familia y proporcionarle un futuro para su hijo menor.

La actividad económica es la venta de materiales de construcción, la ubicación del negocio es de la iglesia de Guadalupe 2 cuadras al oeste 1 cuadra l sur, el tiempo que tiene de 12 años, ella da inicio a esta actividad por su papa quien era el que estaba a cargo del negocio pero como su papa de enfermo se hizo a cargo del negocio pero al comienzo fue muy difícil por que no poseía conocimientos del manejo del negocio por lo que tuvo que investigar acerca de este tipo de negocio ya que tenia que buscar el medio de trabajo para sustentar a su familia de una forma honesta ya que su papa quería que el negocio perdurara dentro de la familia y del mercado y es por eso que se esfuerza por no defraudar a su familia y así ha logrado ampliar su negocio contratando nuevos trabajadores y produciendo mas material, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de productos de materiales de construcción como: bloques, ladrillos, bloques decorados, venta de arena y de hierro.
texts.en:
Ms. Silvia Elena Rodríguez B. is a 44-year-old single mother with 4 children. Her eldest son is 25 years old and in his fourth year of college, her other son is 23 years old and in his third year of college, her daughter is 22 years old and in her first year of college, while her youngest daughter is 9 years old and in fifth grade. Her goal is to produce greater quantities of materials to meet customer demand. She would like to improve the quality of her products so that she can increase sales since her customers will be satisfied with the products she makes. She would also like to obtain more updated machinery to make construction materials and guarantee financial stability to her family, providing her youngest child with a better future.

Ms. Rodríguez sells construction materials for a living. Her business is located 2 blocks west, 1 block south of the Guadalupe church. She has been in business for 12 years. She started the business because of her father, who used to be in charge. However, when her father became ill, she took over. At first, it was very difficult for her because she did not have any business management skills, so she had to research information about this type of business because she needed to make an honest living to support her family. Also, her father wanted the business to be kept in the family, which is why she is trying so hard not to let her family down. Thus, she has managed to expand the business by hiring new workers and producing more construction materials. This loan will be used as business capital to purchase raw materials to make cinder blocks, bricks and decorative bricks. She will also invest the money in sand and iron sales.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Luciola Doris

texts.es:
LUCIOLA DORIAS D. AGUILA D. Y., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Guerreras ubicado en la Av. 09 D. Octubre N° 228 – Asentamiento Humano, 09 D. octubre sector Jorge Chávez, D. Distrito D. Callería, tiene 50 años D. edad, 03 hijos, su esposo es chofer, socio D. Manuela Ramos, 08 años, que ella es costurera.

El primer préstamo que recibimos fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró telas D. algodón para confeccionar brasieres, ropas interiores, compró hilos, elásticos, blondas, adornos, cintas, pasacintas,, trabajaba muy duro ya que tenía problemas económicos, su esposo no trabajaba, poco a poco surgía la confección.

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,700.00 comprara 35 mts D. tela, hilos 02 docenas, 20 docenas D. botón, ahora cose por contratos, a diferentes instituciones.

Está muy agradecida D. Manuela Ramos por comprenderla, brindarle el apoyo que más ha necesitado, en el momento preciso gracias, muchas gracias Manuela Ramos por entenderla y confiar en ella.
texts.en:
LUCIOLA DORIAS D. AGUILA D. Y. belongs to “Las Guerreras" Communal Bank located at 9 D. Octubre Avenue N° 228 – Humano Settlement, 9 D. Octubre Sector Jorge Chávez, of the Callería district. She is 50 years old, has three children, and her husband is a driver. She has been a member of Manuela Ramos for 8 years and she is a dressmaker. With the first loan that she received of S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, she bought cotton fabric to make brassieres and underwear. She bought thread, elastic, lace, adornments and tape and she worked very hard because she already had economic problems as her husband did not work. Little by little her production grew. With this loan of S/.1,700.00 she will buy 35 meters of fabric, 2 dozen spools of thread, and 20 dozen buttons. She sews for different institutions by contract. She is very thankful to Manuela Ramos for understanding her and providing her with the support that she has needed at the precise moment. Many thanks to Manuela Ramos for understanding her and trusting in her.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sewing supplies to make clothing that she sews on contract for different institutions.

loans.name: Luz Estela

texts.es:
LUZ ESTELA C. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “De la Amistad II”, ubicado en el Jr. Libertad N° 820, del Distrito de Callería, tiene 57 años de edad, madre soltera con 03 hijos, todos mayores de edad, socia de Manuela Ramos 08 años.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, arregló el local que alquila para comprar y vender artefactos electrodomésticos, en un jirón muy concurrido cerca al mercado con la ayuda de sus hijos sigue progresando.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, compró más artefactos, fuera de servicios para luego ella arreglarlos y venderlos, ahora el negocio va bien creció más con la ayuda de sus hijos.
texts.en:
LUZ ESTELA C. P. belongs to “De la Amistad II” Communal Bank located in Libertad N° 820 Street in the Callería District. She is 57 years old, is a single mother with 3 children, all of whom are adults, and has been a member of Manuela Ramos for 8 years. The first loan that she received was for S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, with which she fixed up the stand located on a very busy street near to the market that she rents to buy and sell appliances. With her children's help it continues progressing. With this loan of S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, she bought more appliances in disrepair to later fix and sell them. Now her business is going well and grew more with her children's help.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase appliances in disrepair to fix and sell them

loans.name: Lucia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Lucia del Socorro Martines, tiene la edad de 35 años,  habita en reparto Juan Ramón Padilla ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, es madre soltera con mucha dificultad a logrado mantener a sus hijos ya que ella trabaja como modista desde hace diez años , tiene a su cargo tres hijos los cuales le apoyan con las cosas de la casa uno de sus hijos trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ella solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción y darle una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. Lo cual desea tener una casa digna para su familia. A futuro espera tener otra maquina de coser y una persona que le apoye con las costura para salir mas rápido de los encargo a si como vender mas para obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Lucia del Socorro Martines is 35 years old and lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla neighborhood located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She is a single mother and with much difficulty she has managed to support her children as she has worked as a dressmaker for the past 10 years. She cares for her three children who help her with things around the house. One of her children works to help her with the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy construction materials and give better living conditions to her children. She wishes to have a dignified house for her family. In the future she hopes to have another sewing machine and a person who helps her with the sewing to work on the orders more quickly and through this sell more to obtain a higher income.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to make improvements to her house

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan Bautista M.
