L. tiene la edad de 53 años, su estado civil es soltero, este Señor tiene 53 años, Don Juan tiene 3 hijos su edades sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 25 años que trabaja por cuenta propia y su otro hijo de 23 años que también trabaja por cuenta propia y su hijo menor de 13 años cursa el 1 grado de primaria, sus aspiraciones son de adquirir otra unidad de taxi para descansar un poco mas y brindar un servicio de calidad a su clientes y garantizar una estabilidad familiar y económica a su hijo menor ya que sus deseos son que sus hijos logren las metas propuestas por ellos mismos por lo que se sentiría muy orgulloso al saber que sus hijos pueden manejar muy bien las dificultades que se le presenten.

La actividad económica a la que Don Juan se dedica es la venta de mercadería y además es taxista, la ubicación de ambos negocios es de manera ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 15 años, Don Juan inicia esta actividad por empezó a desempeñarse como comerciante por lo que dio inicio a un negocio de distribuir sus productos a los diferentes clientes por lo que tuvo luchar mucho para llegar conseguir lo que el quería y al inicio comenzó con pocos productos como: pantalones, camisas y ropa interior y decide que la mejor manera es distribuir los productos a sus amistades y poco a poco fue aumentando en productos y en mercadería y cada una de sus ganancias las conservaba para establecerse con otro negocio como lo es el servicio de taxi ya si obtiene sus 2 negocios con ambos negocios logra sacar adelante a sus hijos con el fin de que estos se preparen para el futuro siendo el servicio de taxi el cual es la mejor fuente de ingresos para su familia, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita darle mantenimiento a su unidad de transporte además invertir en mercadería ya que sus amistades les han  hecho mucho encargos para la distribución de la mercadería y agradece a las organizaciones amigas y a la Fundación León 2000 por darle la oportunidad de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Juan Bautista M. L., 53, is a single father of three sons. The two oldest are 25 and 23, and they already live and work on their own. The youngest is 13 and attends middle school. Juan hopes to purchase another taxi to give himself some time to rest, to offer a better service to his customers, and to provide a stable family and economic situation for his youngest son. Juan's wishes for his sons is that they reach the goals that have set for themselves, and he feels very proud to know that his sons are able to overcome the obstacles they meet. Juan sells various merchandise, and also owns a taxi. He started 15 year ago selling pants, shirts and underwear to friends and neighbors, and little by little increase the merchandise he offered and the number of customers. He saved part of the profits from the clothing sales to buy a taxi. Both businesses allowed him to support his sons, but the taxi has been the main source of income for his family. The loan Juan is requesting will be used a work capital. He needs to pay for repairs and maintenance for his vehicle and to invest in more clothing items to distribute among customers who have already placed orders. Juan is thankful to Kiva partners and Fundacion Leon 2000 for the opportunity to do better.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Nelinda

texts.es:
NELINDA VÁSQUEZ OCHAVANO, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valientes” ubicado en el Jr. Coronel Portillo N° 836 del Distrito de Callería tiene 36 años de edad, 01 hija, madre soltera.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compro tarjetas telefónicas al por mayor, vendía en el frontis de su casa, complementando con productos de belleza.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,700.00 Nuevos Soles, compro más productos de belleza y accesorios.

Agradezco a Manuela Ramos por confiar en mi persona.
texts.en:
Nelinda Vasquez Ochavano is a member of the Communal Bank "Corageous Women", located in the Calleria District. She is 36 years old and is the single mother of one daughter. She used the first loan that she received (300 soles) to purchase phone cards and cosmetics that she sold out of her home. This new loan of 1,700 soles is to purchase more cosmetics and accessories. Nelinda is thankful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the trust she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cosmetics and accessories

loans.name: Neomila

texts.es:
NEOMILA P. T., pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Amistad” ubicado en la Av. Bolognesi Mz. H, Lt. 8 del AA.HH. “Nuevo Bolognesi” C.F.B. km. 7.000 del Distrito de Callería, tiene 43 años, 03 hijos, su esposo es profesor.

	El primer préstamo que recibio de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró pollos bebe, e implementos para la crianza, ella trabajaba en el comedor Nacional de Pucallpa N° 18 en sus momentos libres, hacia los alimentos para los pollos.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compró más pollos bebes, los cría en su fundo, por ahora ella viene a la ciudad a comprar los alimentos e implementar para su crianza, y ya no trabaja en el comedor solo cría a sus pollos.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por su comprensión y confianza.
texts.en:
Neomila P. T., 43, is amember of the Communal Bank "Friendship", located in the Calleria district. Neomila has 3 children, and is married to a school teacher. Neomila used the first loan that she received to purchase chicks and supplies to raise them. At that time, she also worked in a "comedor nacional" (government-run soup kitchen). This loan (1,000 soles) will be used to buy more chicks. Now Neomila just raises her chickens, and goes to town to buy feed and supplies. She does not need to work in the "comedor" anymore. Neomila is thankful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for its support and trust.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing more chicks

loans.name: Freddy Ramon

texts.es:
El Señor de nombre Freddy Ramón V. C. tiene la edad de 34 años, su estado civil es casado Don Freddy tiene 2 hijas su edades son las siguientes su hija mayor de 19 años de edad y cursa el 1 año de su carrera y su otra hija de 13 años de edad cursa el 2 año de bachillerato, su compañera de vida labora como comerciante, los propósitos de   Don Freddy son de mantener la actividad económica por lo cual es su medio de trabajo y además el medio de sustento de su familia, sus sueños don de asegurar el futuro de sus hijas para que el día de mañana logren ser unas profesionales y puedan servir a la sociedad ya que la situación que enfrentamos en el país esta muy difícil y no todos los jóvenes tienen la oportunidad de estudiar ya que sus padres no cuentan con los recursos necesarios para apoyarlos con los estudios, sus deseos son de que sus hijas logren seguir con este medio de trabajo y que logren ampliarlo ya que esto les beneficiara para sus futuro y no se perderá la tradición familiar de este humilde trabajo.


La actividad económica a la que Don Freddy se dedica es a la sastrería, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación y además de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 13 años, Don Freddy dio inicio a esta actividad con el apoyo de su hermana y por su Mama quienes ya tienen años de dedicarse a esta digna actividad por lo que al comenzar no fue tan difícil ya que su Mama le enseño a realizar faldas para damas por lo que al principio le costo mucho trabajo elaborarlas ya que presentaba problemas por lo que su Mama le enseña a realizar pantalones para caballeros y le resulta mucho mas fácil realizar los pantalones por lo que su Mama  le ayuda a que se instruya mas en este campo por lo que mas tarde decide independizarse de su Mama y establecer su propio negocio con el fin de sacar adelante a su familia por lo que empezó con un maquina de coser y ciertos encargos de sus amigos y familiares y es así como da comienzo a su trabajo a pesar de las dificultades que paso por obtenerlo, el  financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que es necesario la compra de materia prima como: tela, alfiler, tijeras, hilos y botones ya que sus encargos son solo uniformes por lo que no quiere perder la oportunidad de trabajar.
texts.en:
Freddy Ramon V. C., 34, is married and has two daughters, ages 19 and 13. The older daughter is a freshman in college and the younger is in middle school. Freddy's wife works in sales. Freddy hopes to continue working and support his family. His dream for his daughters is that both receive a college education, become productive citizens and that they continue the family business. Freddy is a tailor. He works off his home and he also goes door to door offering his services. He has been a tailor for 13 years. He started this business with the help of his mother and sister, who are both seamstresses. First, his mother taught him to make ladies' skirts, and then how to make men's pants. Later he started to work on his own to support his family, with one sewing machine and orders from a few customers. The loan Freddy is requesting will be used as work capital to purchase fabric, needles, scissors, thread and buttons, to make uniforms.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
El señor Lorenzo Hernández O. tiene 59 años de edad, es casado tiene 5 hijos todos mayores de edad, 2 de estos hijos aun viven con don Lorenzo y además conviven 3 nietos. El microempresario Hernández tiene desde hace 15 años una pulpería la cual le sirve para mantener los gastos del hogar.

Esta pulpería esta ubicada en un barrio periférico de esta ciudad de Bluefields y goza de una buena clientela que lo visita  diariamente a comprarles productos de consumo como alimentos y otros de necesidad básica.

Sin embargo por la situación económica necesita tener variedad de productos y poder cumplir con las demandas de sus clientes, por lo que necesita se le financie para comprar: 2 quintales de harina a US$ 50 dólares cada quintal, 2 quintales de Frijoles a US$ 55 dólares cada quintal, 2 bidones de aceite a US$ 27 dólares cada bidón, 2 quintales de arroz americano a US$ 58 dólares cada quintal, 2 quintales de azúcar a US$ 30 dólares cada quintal y 4 cajas de jabón de lavar ropa a US$ 15 dólares cada caja.
texts.en:
Señor Lorenzo Hernández O., 59, is married with 5 grown children. Two of them still live with Lorenzo, as well as 3 grandchildren. This small businessman has had a local store for 15 years that supplies the household expenses. The store, located in an outlying neighborhood of Bluefields, has a good clientele that shops daily to buy consumables such as food and other basic necessities. In the current economic situation he needs to maintain a variety of products to satisfy the requests of his customers, so he needs a loan to buy 200 Kg. of flour at US$50 per Kg., 200 Kg. of beans at US$55 per Kg., 2 cans of oil at US$27 per can, 200 Kg. of American rice at US$58 per Kg., 200 Kg. or sugar at US$30 per Kg., and 4 cases of laundry soap at US$15 per case.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, beans, oil, rice, sugar and laundry soap

loans.name: Norma Gladys

texts.es:
NORMA GLADYS P. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Guerreras” ubicado en la Calle Salaverry N° 140, frente al Parque Otorongo en la ciudad de Pucallpa del Distrito de Callería, tiene 48 años de edad, con 01 hijo, madre soltera, socia 09 años en Manuela Ramos.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, sandalias, bandejas, vestidos, polos todo lo que sus clientes del mercado le pedían, cobraba del diario. Gracias a sus ahorros y préstamos compró un motokar, el cual le robaron, volvió a comprar otro motokar el cual le ayuda a realizas sus cobranzas.

Con este préstamo que recibió fue de S/.3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprara repuestos para arreglar su motokar como tapizar los asientos, volver a pintarlo, la señora Norma vende productos de belleza, por catálogo, adquirió muchos clientes.

Está muy agradecida de Manuela Ramos, por entenderla y apoyarla en los momentos que más necesitaba.
texts.en:
Norma Gladys P. R., 48, is a member of the Communal Bank "The Warriors", located in the Calleria district. Norma is the single mother of one son, and has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for 9 years. The first loan that she received (300 soles) was used to purchase sandals, dresses, t-shirts that her customers ordered. Later, she bought a motocar with her savings and other loans. This motocar was stolen, and she bought yet another, to be able to drive around collecting payments from her customers. This loan of 3,000 soles is to repair and maintain her motocar. Norma sells beauty products by catalog, and has a large number of customers to visit. Norma is thankful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for providing help and support when she most needed them.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintain motocar used in beauty product sales

loans.name: Damaris Del Scorro

texts.es:
La Señora Damaris del Socorro M. Sánchez tiene la edad de 34 años, su estado civil es soltera, Doña Damaris solo tiene 1 hijo de la edad de 5 años y cursa el 1 grado de primaria, sus propósitos son de mantener su negocio activo ya que su negocio es el medio que utiliza ganarse la vida, su deseos son de que Dios le siga prestando mas vida porque tiene que velar por su hijo quien todavía esta muy pequeño y además tiene quiere que aprenda a desenvolverse ante cualquier situación que se le presente para que día de mañana pueda ser un hombre de bien que sirva para la sociedad, sus sueños son de establecer una tienda de venta de mercadería en general debido a que en las cercanías de su vivienda no existe ningún tipo de negocio y esto seria una gran ventaja para ella ya que así podría obtener clientela y además serian sus principales ingresos y a la misma ves podría cuidar a su hijo en su vivienda ya que tiene 2 trabajos trabaja como docente en una universidad y en un instituto por lo que su otro medio de trabajo es la venta de mercadería en general que la distribuye de forma ambulante.  

La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante ya que su mercadería es ofrecida a sus vecinos, amigos y algunos estudiantes, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 4 años, Doña Damaris dio inicio a esta actividad por la necesidad de generar mas ingresos para su familia ya que tenia que responsabilizarse por su hijo y por su Mama ya que el salario de docencia que poseía no era muy alto y decide involucrarse en el negocio de la mercadería en general  y da sus inicios con poco productos como: ropa, perfumes y cosméticos por lo que recurre a las casas comerciales como Avon y Oriflame por lo que al principio fue muy difícil obtener la venta de los productos ya que no poseía la experiencia que necesitaba para ofrecer los productos y recurre a sus amigas para que ellas pudieran instruirlas en ofertar el producto mas tarde logra captar lo necesario y obtiene a sus clientes por lo que además el tiempo que poseía no le permitía pasar mucho tiempo con sus clientes pero su interés por este negocio le ayudo, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que necesita comprar productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Damaris del Socorro M. Sánchez, 34, is a single mother of a 5-year-old son, who is in the first grade. She hopes to make her business business grow to support her family and to live a long life to care for her child, and raise him to be a productive man. Damaris would love to open a small grocery store in her home, to be able to care for her son while tending her business. There is no other store in the area, so opening one would be a good business move. She believes that she would not have to work two jobs as she does now (as a teacher and selling merchandise on the street). Damaris' business is the sale of general merchandise. She offers her products to family, friends and neighbors. She started 4 years ago, urged by the need to support her child and help out her mother. She began selling Avon and Oriflame products, and with the help of friends she learned the business and established a customer base. The loan she is requesting will be used a work capital, to purchase more products to satisfy her customers' demand.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
OLGA M. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “De la Amistad II” ubicado en el Av. Tupac Amaru Mz. 09, Lt. 11 AA.HH. Martha Chávez II” San Fernando del Distrito de Manantay.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles compró televisores en desuso, los arregló y vendió, su local estaba en alquiler, trabajan con sus hijos, se compró un terreno.

Con este préstamo de S/.2,800.00 Nuevos Soles, compró un motokar, reaperturó su vulcanizadora y su máquina de soldar, compró varillas para soldar.

Muy contenta con Manuela Ramos, por el apoyo que le brinda.
texts.en:
OLGA M. C. is a member of the “De la Amistad II” microfinance institute located on Tupac Amaru Avenue in San Fernando district of Manantay. With her first 300.00 PEN loan that she received, she purchased old television sets, then repaired and sold them. She paid rent for her business space, and worked with her children. She then bought a plot of land. With this 2,800.00 PEN loan, she purchased a motorcycle taxi, reopened her vulcanizing and welding shop, and purchased welding rods. She is very happy with Manuela Ramos for its support.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: A motorcycle taxi and industrial supplies

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
OLINDA T. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Guerreras” ubicado en el Jr. Puebla N° 174 del Distrito de Callería, tiene 50 años de edad, con 04 hijos, su esposo es obrero, ella vende calzados de vestir.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compro 10 pares de zapatos, vendía en el mercado a crédito, pero algunas personas no le pagaban, dejo de vender, decaía, con lo poco que tenia compró más zapatos pero esta vez solo a oficinas.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprara 30 pares de zapatos, su venta es exclusiva a oficinas, el pago seguro, cada vez trae novedades, gracias a los pedidos que le hacen.

Está agradecida con Manuela Ramos, por la oportunidad que le brinda a generar trabajo y a trabajar, es una ayuda muy generosa.
texts.en:
Olinda T. P. belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Guerreras” [The female warriors] located in the district of Callería, Perú. She is 50 years old with four children. Her husband is a laborer, and Olinda sells dress shoes. The first loan that she received was for S/.3000.00 Nuevos Soles (Peruvian currency). She purchased 10 pairs of shoes, and sold them in the market on credit. However, some clients did not repay her, so she quit selling and faced declining circumstances. With the little that remained she purchased more shoes but this time sold them only at offices. With this loan of S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles ($325 US), she will purchase 30 pairs of shoes, selling them exclusively to offices. Payment is secure, and with every order she brings the newest fashions thanks to the requests that she receives. She is thankful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the opportunity they have provided to generate a job and allow her to work. It is very generous assistance.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase 30 pairs of shoes, selling them exclusively to offices

loans.name: Rogelia Mercedes

texts.es:
ROGELIA MERCEDES CARRIÓN T., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Solidarias”, ubicado en el Jr. Inmaculada N° 169 del Distrito de Callería, un jirón muy concurrido por muchos turistas, por la variedad de comidas típicas que preparan y venden.

La señora Rogelia tiene 58 años de edad, 03 hijos, su esposo trabaja en una granja, ella es socia de Manuela Ramos hace siete años, con su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 que recibió compro una cocinita a carbón, en la cual asaba sus pescados, plátanos verdes, pollos, etc., preparaba juanes (arroz envuelto en hoja) patarashca (pescado envuelto en hoja) y asado, todo en poca cantidad.

Con este préstamos de S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, ambiento su local, compró pintura, platos, vasos, cubiertos, aumentó sus clientes y de personal, su Restaurant lleva el nombre de “July Jessy”.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por confiar en ella.
texts.en:
ROGELIA MERCEDES CARRIÓN T. belongs to the "Banco Comunal"Mujeres Solidarias", located in Jr. Inmaculada No. 169, District of Callería, a very popular street for many tourists due to the variety of typical food prepared and sold there.

Doña Rogelia is 58 years old, has 3 children and her husband works at a farm. She has been a partner of Manuela Ramos for seven years. With a first loan of S/.300.00 she bought a coal kitchen where she fried her fish, green bananas, chicken, etc. and prepared "juanes" (rice wrapped in leaves) "patarashca" (fish wrapped in leaves), and roast, all in small quantities.

With this loan of S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, she will adapt her premises, buy paint, plates, glasses, cutlery, increase her clients and staff. Her restaurant is named "July Jessy". She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for having confidence in her.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase paint, plates, glasses, cutlery; increase number of clients and staff.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
ROSA R. D. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sol Naciente”, ubicado en el Jr. Jhon F. Kennedy N° 1085 del Distrito D. Callería, tiene 62 años D. edad, 01 hijo, su esposo compra madera y venD..

Su primer préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró un poco D. triplay confeccionó esteras y ponía a la ventalos pollos que criaba, poco a poco sus clientes solicitaban más el producto.

Con este préstamo D. S/.2,000.00 compró 500 pollos bb y sus alimentos, virutas, para que se calienten los pollitos, pero continúa con la confección D. esteras.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por el gran apoyo que le brinda.
texts.en:
ROSA R. D. R. is a member of the “Sol Naciente” microfinance institute, located on John F. Kennedy Street N° 1085, in the district of Callería. She is 62 years old, has 1 son, and her husband buys and sells lumber for a living.

With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased a bit of three-ply, maD. mats, and sold the chickens that she was raising. Little by little, her customers kept requesting her products.

With this 2,000.00 PEN loan, she purchased 500 chicks and wood shavings to keep them warm. She is still making mats as well. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for its support.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 500 chicks and wood shavings

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Juana Mercedes R. tiene la edad de 41 años,  habita en el barrio Buenos Aires Ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , ella es madre soltera tiene a su cargo dos hijas las cuales estudian actualmente  ella se dedica a la agricultura y al comercio desde hace diez años . Los planes hacia su familia es lograr que sus hijos sean profesionales; la mayor dificultad ha sido la falta de financiamiento ya que ella con sus propios esfuerzos a logrado establecer 2 ½ mz de plátano  y necesitan fertilizantes para poder sacar una buena producción y vender a un buen precio en el mercado es por eso que con esta solicitud de prestamos es para invertir en fertilizante y salir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana Mercerdes R. is 41 years old and she lives in the neighborhood of Buenos Aires, in the county of Ticuantepe. She is a single mother and has two daughters who are currently studying. She has been working in agriculture and business for ten years. Her plan for her family is for her daughters to become professionals; her biggest difficulty has been a lack of finance. With her own hard work she has been able to establish two and a half acres of plantain and she needs fertilizer to be able to grow a good product and to sell it in the market for a good price. It is for this reason that she would like a loan; to invest in fertilizer and to move forward with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy agricultural products to produce plantain/Comprar insumos agricola para la produccion de platanos

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
VIRGINIA V. D. GONZALES, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valientes”, ubicada en el Jr. Guillermo Sisley N° 675, del Distrito D. Callería, tiene 60 años D. edad, 03 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, es socia D. Manuela Ramos hace 07 años.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró mangueras, detergente, algunos utensilios para lavar, inauguró su lavadero poco a poco decaía y el lavadero ya no rendía pues vendía repuestos para motos, así surge poco a poco.

Con este préstamo D. S/.3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compró productos D. rodamiento vale decir, repuestos para motos y motokar, tiene a su costado una mecánica que van D. la mano con la tienda D. repuestos.

Agradecida D. Manuela Ramos por brindarle un apoyo tan granD. que a hecho que su familia será más unida, ahora su esposo trabaja con ella.
texts.en:
Virginia Valeria D. Gonzales belongs to the communal group 'Mujeres Valientes - Courageous Women', located in Jr Guillermo Sisley, number 675, in the district of Calleria. She is 60 years old and has 3 kids. Her husband is a storekeeper. She has been a member of Manuela Ramos for 7 years.

The first loan she received was for 300 new sols, and she bought hoses, detergent and some washing up utensils. She opened her laundrette but bit by bit it went downhill and was not making money so she started selling motorbike parts, and this has developed bit by bit.

With this loan of 3,000 new sols she bought bearing parts, like motorbike and motorbike-car replacement parts. She has a mechanic next door who works hand in hand with her spare part store.

She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for giving her the support that has maD. her family more united, as now her husband also works with her.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She bought bearing parts, like motorbike and motorbike-car replacement parts/Compró productos de rodamiento es decir, repuestos para motos y motokar, tiene a su costado una mecánica que van de la mano con la tienda de repuestos.

loans.name: Ivette Milenia

texts.es:
La microempresaria Ivette Milenia Álvarez A. tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo el cual se encuentra estudiando en la universidad. La señora Álvarez tiene una pulpería desde hace 10 años con la que se apoya para los gastos del hogar ya que además es profesora en un instituto de esta ciudad de Bluefields.

En su pulpería vende granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, maíz etc. Pero también vende productos carnicos como pollo y  res. En ocasiones contrata a una amiga para que le despache en el negocio y poder ir a impartir clases ya que el salario de profesor es uno de los más bajos en este país.

La señora Álvarez al igual que otras microempresarias requiere del financiamiento para comprar: 75 libras de pollo a US$ 1 dólar cada libra , 80 libras de carne de res a US$ 1.50 dólar cada libra, 1 quintal de harina a US$ 50 dólar cada quintal , 1 quintal de Frijoles a US$ 55 dólar cada quintal, 2 bidones de aceite a US$ 27 dólar cada bidon, 2 quintales de arroz americano a US$ 58 dólar cada quintal y 2 quintales de maíz amarillo a US$ 15 dólar cada quintal.
texts.en:
Milenia Álvarez A., a small businessperson, is 44, a single parent with one son studying at the university. Señora Álvarez has had a small store for 10 years which covers the household expenses, and she is also a professor in an institute here in Bluefields. In her store she sells basic grains such as rice, beans, corn, etc. She also sells meat products such as chicken and beef. Sometimes she hires a friend to take care of the business so she can go teach classes, but a professor's salary is one of the lowest in the country. Señora Álvarez, like other small businesspersons, needs financing to buy 75 pounds of chicken at US$1 per pound, 80 pounds of beef at US$1.50 per pound, 100 Kg. of flour at US$50 per 100 Kg., 100 Kg. of beans at US$55 per 100 Kg., 2 cans of oil at US$27 per can, 200 Kg. of American rice at US$58 per 100 Kg., and 200 Kg. of yellow corn at US$15 per 100 Kg.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicken, beef, flour, beans, oil, rice and corn flour

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es:
ZOILA ROSA M. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Amistad II” ubicado en el AA.HH. Sagrado Corazón de Jesús – San Fernando, Distrito de Manantay, tiene 36 años de edad, cuatro hijos, su esposo es estibador.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró telas, elásticos, hilos, botones, cremas para confeccionar blusas, pantalones, shorts de niños, poco a poco surgía e iba invirtiendo en artículos de primera necesidad.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compró 01 saco de arroz, 01 saco de azúcar, golosinas en general, artículos de pasamanería, ahora tiene su bodega.

Está contenta por haber crecido poco a poco gracias a Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Zoila Rosa M. P. belongs to the communal group 'La Amistad II - Friendship II', located in AA.HH, Sagrado Corazon de Jesus - San Fernando, in the district of Manantay. She is 36 years old and has four kids. Her husband is longshoreman.

With the first loan she received of 300 new sols she bought material, elastic, thread, buttons, creams to make shirts, pants and kids' shorts, and bit by bit her business developed and she started investing in essential commodities.

With this loan of 1,000 new sols, she bought 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, candy in general and weaving tools, and now she has a store.

She is happy as her business has grown bit by bit thanks to Manuela Ramos.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, candy in general, weaving tools; she now has her own store/Comprar 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, golosinas en general, artículos de pasamanería, ahora tiene su bodega.

loans.name: Martha Aryera

texts.es: La señora Martha Aryera U. Tercero tiene la edad de 28 años,  habita en el barrio los Venegas ubicado en carretera hacia Masaya, junto a su esposo y hijos, el esposo trabaja para apoyarla con los gastos del hogar. Ellos tienen a su cargo dos hijas las cuales tiene cuatro y dos años de edad, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, ella trabaja como comerciante desde hace dos años, con sus propios esfuerzos ha logrado crecer el inventario de su negocio en la venta de cosméticos que vende al contado como al crédito, esta es su segunda solicitud en Afodenic y ha sido de muchos beneficios en lo personal como en su negocio, ya que ha incrementado su inventario, con esta solicitud espera comprar cosméticos como muchos perfumenes y aprovechar la temporada de la amistad que se obsequian muchos regalos, espera poder obtener buenas ganancias y en un futuro proyectarse a tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Martha Aryera U. Tercero is 28 years old and she lives in the neighborhood of Venegas, which is loacted on the highway to Masaya. She lives with her husband and kids. Her husband works to support her with the household costs. They have two daughters to support, and they are four and two years old. Their plan for the future is to improve their families' living conditions. She has worked as a storekeeper for two years, and through her own efforts she has managed to create an inventory for her business selling cosmetics which she sells them on credit to her clients. This is her second loan application through Afodenic. It has helped her personally, as well as with her business as she has increased her inventory. With this application she hopes to buy cosmetics like perfumes and to use Valentine's Day to sell a lot of gifts. She hopes to be able to obtain good earnings and, in the future, have a store in her house.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and perfumes to increase her inventory/Comprar cosmeticos y perfumes para incrementar su inventario

loans.name: Kantutas Group

texts.es:
La asociación kantutas pertenece al centro focal Cascada ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto, hace un año que trabajan junto a la familia de Pro – Mujer.
La mayoría casadas y con familias numerosas, necesitan recursos económicos, para cubrir ciertas necesidades como ser guardapolvos y material escolar, ya que empieza un nuevo año escolar. Por este motivo  necesitan de mayores créditos para ampliar sus ventas con la seguridad de obtener mayores ingresos.
La asociación Kantutas se dedica al comercio en general, diversos productos son vendidos en puestos de mercados y calles de la ciudad, otras también tiene tiendas de barrio.
texts.en:
The Kantutas Association is in the Cascada center of the city of El Alto. They have been working for one year with the Pro-Mujer family. Most are married with large families, in need of economic resources to cover certain necessities such as school uniforms and supplies, since a new school year is starting. This is why they need large loans to increase their sales and to have the security of a larger income. The Kantutas Association are all in general business, selling various products in market stands and on the streets of the city. Some also have neighborhood shops.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: They need loans to increase their sales

loans.name: Martha Aryera

texts.es: La señora Martha Aryera U. T. tiene la edad de 28 años,  habita en el barrio los Venegas ubicado en carretera hacia Masaya, junto a su esposo y hijos, el esposo trabaja para apoyarla con los gastos del hogar. Ellos tienen a su cargo dos hijas las cuales tiene cuatro y dos años de edad, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, ella trabaja como comerciante desde hace dos años, con sus propios esfuerzos ha logrado crecer el inventario de su negocio en la venta de cosméticos que vende al contado como al crédito, esta es su segunda solicitud en Afodenic y ha sido de muchos beneficios en lo personal como en su negocio, ya que ha incrementado su inventario, con esta solicitud espera comprar cosméticos como muchos perfumenes y aprovechar la temporada de la amistad que se obsequian muchos regalos, espera poder obtener buenas ganancias y en un futuro proyectarse a tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
La señora Martha Aryera U. T. tiene la edad de 28 años, habita en el barrio los Venegas ubicado en carretera hacia Masaya, junto a su esposo y hijos, el esposo trabaja para apoyarla con los gastos del hogar. Ellos tienen a su cargo dos hijas las cuales tiene cuatro y dos años de edad, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, ella trabaja como comerciante desde hace dos años, con sus propios esfuerzos ha logrado crecer el inventario de su negocio en la venta de cosméticos que vende al contado como al crédito, esta es su segunda solicitud en Afodenic y ha sido de muchos beneficios en lo personal como en su negocio, ya que ha incrementado su inventario, con esta solicitud espera comprar cosméticos como muchos perfumenes y aprovechar la temporada de la amistad que se obsequian muchos regalos, espera poder obtener buenas ganancias y en un futuro proyectarse a tener una tienda en su casa.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar cosmetico y perfumes para cumplir demanda de los clientes

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El señor Francisco Javier O. G. tiene la edad de 49 años, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa y hijos. La esposa de don Francisco trabaja para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar, al igual que sus hijos, los planes hacia un futuro es lograr mejorar sus cultivos para obtener mejor ganancia. El se siento muy contento ya que a trabajado con AFODENIC durante nueve ciclo y a logrado establecer 4 ½ mz de piña. Este financiamiento que solicita es para aplicarle a sus cultivos los fertilizantes necesarios que se le han recomendado, para obtener una producción buena y poder vender a buen precio en el mercado, así como mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier O. G. is 49 years old and he lives in the county of Ticuantepe with his wife and kids. His wife works to help out with the household costs, as do his kids. Their plan for the future is to have better crops which will earn more money. He is very happy to be working with Afodenic through this new harvest and has been able to get 4.5 acres of pineapple. The loan he would like is to apply the necessary and recommeneded fertilizer to his crops to get a better product and to be able to sell it for a better price in the market, as well as improving his crop.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and products for cultivation/Comprar fertilizante y insumos para el cultivo

loans.name: Estrellas De Mururata Group

texts.es:
La asociación “Estrellas de Mururata” forma parte de la familia de Pro-Mujer hace un año, grupo formado por 13 miembros que trabajan con mucha responsabilidad.  .
Distintas son las actividades del grupo, algunas se dedican a venta de golosinas, otras a la venta de productos de limpieza, también son artesanas. Una actividad muy particular es la escultura, Jorge junto a su esposa se dedican al tallado en piedra, estas obras líticas son vendidas solamente a pedido. La asociación Estrellas del Mururata desea incrementar sus ventas para esto, necesitan capital para la compra de materia prima, con la seguridad de generar mayores ingresos, que les permita ahorrar para el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Estrellas de Mururata” Association, part of the Pro-Mujer family for one year, consists of 13 members who all work responsibly. The group's activities are varied, some sell sweets, others cleaning products, some are artisans. One particular activity is sculpture: Jorge and his wife create stone carvings, sold only by order. The Estrellas del Mururata Association wants to increase their sales, so they need capital to buy raw materials. The security of increased income will allow them to save for the future of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to buy raw materials

loans.name: Flores De Primavera Group

texts.es: La asociación  “F. de primavera” pertenece al centro focal Cascada. El mencionado grupo esta formado por 15 socias que trabajan  hace un año con la entidad de Pro-Mujer. Existen diversas actividades de dentro el grupo, por ejemplo algunas se dedican a la venta de ropa;  comercio de verduras; servicio de café; otras son artesanas, realizan tejidos de chompas en alpaca y otros. La asociación F. de primavera desea ampliar su producción, por lo que necesita de mayores créditos para la compra de materia prima y/o insumos, solo con el fin de mejorar sus ganancias para el beneficio de sus  hogares.
texts.en:
The “F. de Primavera” Association is in the main center of Cascada. This group consists of 15 members who have been working with Pro-Mujer for one year. The group has varied activities, some sell clothing, vegetables, or coffee, while others are artisans, creating hand-knit alpaca sweaters or other items. The “F. de Primavera” Association wants to increase their production, so they need larger loans to purchase raw materials or ingredients with the goal of increasing their earnings to benefit their households.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Loans to purchase raw materials or ingredients

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Mrs. Thy L. is a villager in the Roka Kdouch Choerng Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a pig breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing ten more piglets and pig food. She hopes to increase her income and provide a better life for her family after she sells her pigs. Her husband, Mr. Young Yen, is a construction worker. Mrs. Thy L. is 33 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy ten more piglets to breed and later resell and pig food

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Mrs. Ny N. is a villager in the Koun Tnaut Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate cassavas. She now faces a problem with her plantation because she does not have enough money to grow them. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She hopes to increase her income and to improve the living conditions with this new loan. Her husband, Mr. Ath Un, is a rice middleman. Mrs. Ny N. is 46 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a farmer who helps his mother, and the other is attending the local school. Her husband is presented on right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy cassavas to plant and grow in her fields

loans.name: Theana

texts.en: Mrs. Theana H. was born in 1983 and she now lives in the Chey Nang Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a housewife. Her husband, Mr. Toem Hor, repairs motorbikes. Since his business has a lot of customers, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Theana H. decided to request a loan to buy more motorbike parts for her husband's business. She hopes to increase their income and provide a better life for their family. She has three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is also presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more motorbike parts for her husband's repair business

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en: Mrs. Vong Chouy is a villager in the Toul Kandal Choerng Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Horn Sinan, is a construction worker. He has a problem because he does not have enough money to buy construction supplies to support his work. Thus, Mrs. Vong Chouy decided to ask for a loan to buy those supplies for her husband's career. She is 29 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to support her husband's career

loans.name: Ath

texts.en: Mrs. Ath O. lives in the Toul Kandal Choerng Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and later re-sells at better prices. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more rice to resell. She hopes to increase her income and to improve the living conditions of her family with this loan. Her husband, Mr. En Kheng, is an assistant village chief. Mrs. Ath O. is a 54-year-old mother of four children, three of whom stay at home to do housework and help with their mother's business while the other is a construction worker. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice to keep in stock and later re-sell at better prices

loans.name: Charm

texts.en: Mrs. Cham Chou is 50 years old and she now lives in the Ta Keb Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. In cultivating vegetables, she faces a problem because she does not have enough money to grow cassavas in the fields. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more cassavas to plant and grow. Her husband, Mr. Lorn Sao, is a fisherman. Mrs. Cham Chou has a child who is a laborer. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy cassavas to plant and grow in the fields

loans.name: Srim's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Srim P. is a group leader of five who all live in the Lek Boun Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a vegetable middleman. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to request a loan to purchase more vegetables to resell. Her husband, Mr. Em SoP., is a soldier who does not make enough to support the family. Mrs. Srim P. is 48 years old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Sok-Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Sok-heng N., 40 and his wife, Mrs. Hong Kheav, 42, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital of Cambodia. They were married in 1984 and have three children: two sons who have full-time employment in Phnom Penh and one daughter. The daughter stays at home and assists her mother in selling flowers.

Sok-heng has been driving a motor taxi for three years. Sometimes he drives in his village and sometimes he drives in Phnom Penh. His wife has been selling flowers for 24 years. It’s a skill she learned from her parents. She grows the flowers on their farm and sells them at the Derm Kor market in Phnom Penh. Mrs. Hong Kheav hopes to expand her business.

Sok-heng is asking for a loan of $600 in order to build a concrete foundation for his home. This is his second loan.

loans.use: To build a concrete foundation for his home

loans.name: Sam-Ang

texts.en:
Miss. Sam-ang N. (shown in the photo with her mother), 24, is single and lives with her widowed mother. She has three siblings. All of them have full-time employment. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capita of Cambodia.

Sam-ang has been a full-time employee in a company in Phnom Penh for six years. She earns about $80 a month. The family's income is from her and her brothers and sisters. The kitchen in their home is very old and needs to be rebuilt. Therefore, Sam-ang is requesting a loan of $800 to rebuild it. This is her second loan.

loans.use: To build a new kitchen

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mr. Chea S., 32, and his wife, Mrs. Channy Sorm, 30, live along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1994 and have one young son. Besides their son, his parents are living with them.

Chea has been driving a motor taxi for 16 years, a skill he learned by himself. His wife has been a garment factory worker for 10 years. In the future, the couple wants to create their own business selling fruit. Now Chea is requesting his first loan of $700 which he will use to build a fence around his house and to buy a new motorbike to replace the old one for his motor taxi business.

loans.use: To build a fence and to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Soktieng

texts.en:
Mrs. Soktieng L., 28, and her husband, Mr. Sopheak Mom, 28, live aL. the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital of Cambodia. They were married in 2002 and have two sons who are still very young.

Soktieng has been selling longans (a local fruit) since 2002. She buys them from villagers in the village where she lives and sells them at the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been an electrician in a company in Phnom Penh since he married. Soktieng is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase longans to resale.

loans.use: To purchase longans

loans.name: Kheun

texts.en:
Mrs. Kheun H., 44, and her husband, Mr. Huot Hin, 41, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital of Cambodia. They were married in 1992 and have two children: one son and one daughter, both of whom attend school.

Kheun and her husband have been farming for 29 years. They grow cucumbers, green beans, and jasmines. They sell them at the Prek Phnao market. Kheun hopes to support her children so they can attend the university. She is requesting her first loan of $500 to use for growing cucumbers and green beans and to build a kitchen.

loans.use: To use for growing cucumbers and green bean and to build a kitchen

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Mr. Neang O., 59, and his wife, Mrs. Chantha Chhorn, 52, live in a small village in a suburb of PhnO. Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They were married 1974 and have six children: one daughter who is married but still lives in the family home and five sons. Two of their sons are soldiers, two sons attend school, and the other son studies in the university. 

Neang and his wife have been growing rice since 1979. They sell their products to a middleman. Neang hopes to support his children so they can get a better education and have good careers. So, he is requesting a loan of $200 to pay school fees for his son who studies in the university.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his son

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Mr. Lun D., 22, and his wife, Mrs. Samut Yorn, 24, were married in 2007 and have one daughter. They live in a small house next to their parent’s house. The family lives along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Lun has been repairing motors, bicycles, and motorcycles for one year. His wife is a garment factory worker. She just gave a birth and started her job one month ago. Lun is requesting his first loan. He is asking for $700 to purchase a motor and a machine for renting musical instrument to his villagers so he can earn extra income. He will also use part of the loan for his motor repair shop.

loans.use: To buy a motor and a machine for renting musical instruments, and to repair his motor repair shop.

loans.name: Sae

texts.en: Sae S. is a grocer and owns a small grocery store in Tra Beak village in Takeo province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Seas Chin, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. His field has infertile soil affecting the growth of his crops.  In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Sae S. requests a loan to purchase fertilizer to support the rice plantation to make the crops more productive. She is 53 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory and the other is attending a local school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to support the field to make crops more productive.

loans.name: Sary

texts.en: Mrs. Sary L. is a villager in Kvav village in Takeo province, Cambodia. She and her husband, Mr. Mao Kha are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. On there plantation they usually pay a lot of money to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field. Mrs. Sary L. requests a loan to buy an ox to plow her field and thereby reduce her expenses. She is 48 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, two are coconut sellers and two are attending the local school. Her husband is also shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy an ox for plowing their rice field

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Mrs.Ry S. is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She is also a chicken middleman. Her business is going well and she would like to expand by purchasing more chickens to resell. She is requesting a loan to  purchase more chickens to sell. She hopes to increase her income and provide a better life for her family. Mrs. Ry S. is a widow with two children, one of whom helps her mother's business while the other is attending the local school. She was born in 1967 and she now lives in Pech Entrea village in Takeo province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to resell.

loans.name: Reaksmei

texts.en: Mrs.Reaksmei I. is a villager I. Kvav village I. Takeo province. She is a basket maker. Her husband, Mr. Morm Virak, is a coconut seller. His business is going well and he wants to expand it. Mrs. Reaksmei is requesting a loan to buy more coconuts to resell. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. She is a 27-year-old mother with a young child, who isn't able to work or study yet. Her husband is with her I. the picture.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts to resell

loans.name: Vany

texts.en: Vany S. is a villager in Kvav village in Takeo province, Cambodia. She and her husband, Mr. Meth Mao, are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate rice.They do not have enough oxen to plow their field and usually pay a lot of money to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow.  Vany S. requests a loan to buy one ox to accompany their old ox to help plow the field. She is 45 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in garment factory, one is a coconut seller and the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy an ox to plow the field.

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en: Mr. Chhoeun I was born in 1979 and lives in Trapaing Kork village in Takeo province, Cambodia. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land and cultivates rice. His wife, Mrs. Chim Theat, is a duck breeder. Her business is going well and she would like to expand. Mr. Chhoeun is requesting a loan so his wife can buy more ducks to breed and duck food. He hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. They have two children, one is attending a local school and the other is too young to work or study. His wife is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more ducks to breed and duck food.

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Khorn N. lives in Krang Roung village in Takeo province, Cambodia. She is a duck breeder.  Her duck business is going well, and she wants to expand. She is requesting a loan to purchase more ducks to breed. She hopes to increase her income and provide a better life for her family. Her husband, Mr. Pho Kosal, is a farmer cultivating rice on a piece of land he owns. 
Mrs. Khorn N. is 49 years old and the mother of eight children, three of whom are employed in different positions, two are farmers and help their parents and three are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more ducks to breed

loans.name: Muhidin

texts.en:
Muhidin has to shoulder a great deal of responsibility, which drives him to work hard to improve his life. He is farmer; specifically, he grows potatoes and maize. He hopes to improve his business in order to better provide for his family. For that reason, he wants to invest in his business, expand his crop fields, and improve the quality of his crops. Indeed, Muhidin knows that, by taking care of his land and working diligently, he will grow excellent crops which will be well-received in the marketplace. Now, Muhidin is seeking a loan so that he can purchase fertilizers for his land. Please support this hardworking man so that his efforts are worthwhile.

Information about Tajikistan: Tajikistan is well known for the following: (1) its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; (2) the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and (3) its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, and Mavlavi Rumi, to name a few. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. On the other end of the spectrum, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and thus only 7% of the land is arable; accordingly, this confluence of factors has resulted in high levels of unemployment and has forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries (primarily Russia). Even though the people of Tajikistan are working hard to improve the country's agriculture and manufacturing sectors, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON International's History: Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Sudin

texts.en:
Sudin H. was born in 1960 and is married with 3 children. He is an extremely hardworking man who has always dreamed of achieving success in whatever he does. Thus, when he joined IMON International, he was able to make a great deal of progress as a result of his previous loans, the proceeds of which he invested primarily in his farming business. More specifically, for the past eight years, Sudin has been growing potatoes and other vegetables on his land with the help of his sons. Sudin explains that he wants his children to receive a good education so that they have a better chance than he did to succeed in life, which is what makes his sacrifices worthwhile. Indeed, thanks to his efforts and diligence, his oldest son is currently studying at the university. Currently, Sudin requests a loan in the amount of 1,500 Somoni ($425) over a 12-month term in order to buy potato seeds and mineral fertilizer. In turn, he plans to use the expected increase in profits from his business to educate his children, improve the structure of his home, and more generally improve his family's standard of living.

Information about Tajikistan: Tajikistan is well known for the following: (1) its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; (2) the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and (3) its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, and Mavlavi Rumi, to name a few. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. On the other end of the spectrum, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and thus only 7% of the land is arable; accordingly, this confluence of factors has resulted in high levels of unemployment and has forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries (primarily Russia). Even though the people of Tajikistan are working hard to improve the country's agriculture and manufacturing sectors, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON International's History: Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Irsalat

texts.ru: Эрматова Ирсалат женщина 48 лет , мать шестерых детей, муж работает в колхозе трактористом. Ирсалат занимается откормом скота, в основном коровами.Сейчас у неё 4 дойные коровы. которые дают в день 20 литров молока.Для покупки корма и ещё двух коров она решила взять кредит.Днём Ирсалат выводит коров на поле , а вечером они сами возвращаются.Поэтому при мониторинге нам не удалось снять на фотографии её коров.На снимке Ирсалат в день выдачи.Но при отчёте обязятельно её скот будет на фото.
texts.en:
Irsalat E. is 48 years old and the mother of six children. Her husband drives a tractor at the collective farm. Irsalat raises livestock, cows in particular. At present she has four dairy cows, which produce 20 liters of milk a day. She has decided to take out a loan to purchase feed and two more cows. During the day Irsalat puts the cows out to pasture, and in the evening they return home, therefore when MLF MicroInvest visited it was not possible to photograph her cows. Irsalat's photograph was taken the day the loan was disbursed, however the cattle will certainly be in the photograph when the accounting is done.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru:
Каромат 45 летняя женщина, мать четверых детей ,муж работает частным мастером по ремонту домов.Сама Каромат продаёт на рынке Дусти В Сомгаре продукты питания.Этот базар работает всего один раз в неделю.
В остальные дни она занимается уходом за скотом.У неё сейчас 7 баранов и 10 коз.Целыми днями скот у неё посётся на пастбище.А вечером возвращается.Для увеличения скота Каромат решила взять кредит.На закуп скота Каромат ездит на рынок с мужем,т.к. он хорошо разбирается в породистых баранах.
texts.en:
Karomat Y. is a 45-year-old woman and the mother of four children. Her husband has his own home repairs business. Karomat herself sells food products at the Dusti market in Somgar. This bazaar is only open one day a week; on the other days, she cares for her livestock. At present she has seven sheep and ten goats. Karomat pastures her livestock during the day, and at night they return home. In order to increase her herd, Karomat has decided to take out a loan. She goes together with her husband to purchase livestock in the market, because he is knowledgeable about purebred sheep.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Mr. Sreng Vong is a villager in Lvea village in Takeo province, Cambodia. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land and  cultivates rice. His land is infertile and he does not have enough money to hire a laborer to work his field. He requests a loan to hire a few laborers to work on his field and purchase fertilizer for the soil. 

Mr. Sreng Vong  is a 55-year-old father of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory and three are attending a local school. His wife, Mrs. Duong Torn, is a housewife.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work on the field and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en:
Bashir K. is a member of Kisakya mukama in Kikajjo.  He is a 27-year-old, single man who operates a motorcycle (bodaboda) business.  In fact, he notes that he has been in this line of business for 2 years from the Namasuba stage.  Moreover, he explains that he takes care of his elderly grandparents, who were kind enough to care for him after he lost his parents at a very young age. 

This is the second loan he has sought with his group, and he plans to use the loan proceeds to repair his motorcycle.  He dreams of owning more motorcycles, which will enable him to improve his standard of living.  In the future, he plans to marry a woman, but only if he has achieved something in life, such as buying a plot of land and constructing a house to provide shelter for his future wife and kids.

loans.use: To improve his business by repairing his motorcycle

loans.name: Savun

texts.en:
Mr. Savun T. is a villager in Krang Roung village in Takeo province. He is a duck breeder. His business is going well and he would like to expand. He requests a loan to buy more ducks to breed and duck food. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions with this loan. 
Mr. Savun T. is 30 years old and the father of three children, one attending a local school and the other two are too young to work or study.  His wife, Mrs. T. Sinuon, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. He's with his wife in the photo.

loans.use: To request a loan to buy more ducks to breed and duck food

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Mrs. Un O. was bO. in 1974 and lives in Thkouv village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Buo Bou, is a motor taxi driver. Even though they work hard, they still don't earn enough income to provide a better life for their family. In order to improve their lives, Mrs. Un Om requests a loan to buy a cow to breed. They have four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school, and the youngest is not in school yet. Her husband and child are also shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To request a loan to buy a cow fto breed.

loans.name: Srey Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Aun K. is a villager in Srae Boeung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She does not have enough money to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow her field but her field is infertile. She also has a lot of insects who damage her crops. She requests a loan buy fertilizer and pesticides to support her field to make her fields more productive and crops more successful. 
Mrs. Srey Aun K. is a 37-year-old widow with a child, who is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides to support the field and make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Шухрат парень 34 лет , женат имеет 3 детей нигде не работает . а занимается только откормом и продажей скота.Он с молодости занимается с отцом, поэтому хорошо разбирается в этом бизнесе.Его друзья посоветовали в кредит увеличит его оборот.На сегодняшний день у него 30 баранов и 20 коз.Он сам их пасёт на пастбищах,что и запечатлено на фотографии.
texts.en:
Shuhrat is 34 years old, married and has three children. His sole job is raising and selling livestock. From a young age he worked with his father, so he is very knowledgeable about this business. His friends advised him to take out a loan to increase his turnover. Today he has 30 sheep and 20 goats, and in the photograph, he is shown shepherding them to pasture.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle

loans.name: Badam Gul Group

texts.en:
Zayajan is the group leader of the Badam Gul group, which has three members. The group's members are each seeking to receive funding for their own businesses in order to better support their families and to solve some of their financial problems.

Specifically, Badam Gul and Zayajan are seeking a loan for their respective carpet-weaving businesses because they want to expand and improve such businesses. Meanwhile, Anesa is requesting a loan for the benefit of her brother’s business. They explain that these loans can be very useful because they provide a chance for poor entrepreneurs like themselves to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To expand their businesses and to better support their families

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en: Mrs. Chreb C. is a villager in Thkouv village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Phen Ya, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. They don't earn enough income to provide a better house for their family. Mrs. Chreb C. requests a loan to buy timber to repair her house. She is 43 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory, the other two are attending school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy timber to repair her house.

loans.name: Rasul

texts.ru: Расул 37 летний мужчина, отец троих детей,работает слесарем на заказ.Также он занимается уходом за скотом.У него сейчас 25 коз.Для увеличения числа скота он решил взять кредит.В его отсутствии за скотом ухаживает жена.Но целый день пасёт скот его друг вместе со своими.Жена Расула продаёт вязанные своими руками носки из козьей шерсти.
texts.en:
Rasul T. is a 37 year old man and the father of three children. He works as an on-demand mechanic, and also raises livestock. He currently has 25 goats, and decided to take out a loan to expand the herd. When he is absent his wife takes care of the animals, but a friend tends to them on pasture all day with his own herd. Rasul's wife knits and sells goat hair socks.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock

loans.name: Vith

texts.en: Mr. Vith U. lives in Samraung village in Takeo province, where he makes a living breeding ducks. Since his  business is going well, he wants to expand it by buying more ducks and duck food. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions with this loan. His wife, Mrs. Kin Sreymom, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. They have four children, three of whom attend the local school while the fourth is too young to work or study. His wife is with him in this photograph.

loans.use: To buy more ducks and duck food.

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Mr. Ban V., 25, and his wife, Mrs. Sinat Khan, 30, live in a small village off of National Road number Two about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They were married in 2006 and they have no children. Ban's sister, brother, and his parents live with them.
 
Ban has been farming for over 10 years, a skill he learned from his father. He grows tomatoes and cucumbers. Mrs. Sinat Khan has been a garment factory worker for 13 years. Ban is requesting his first loan. He is asking for $400 USD to purchase a water pump machine for the farm and to buy some parts so his bother can repair his motor remoque trailer (motor taxi).

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine and to repair his brother's motor taxi.

loans.name: Koem Pov

texts.en: Mrs. Koem Pov P. lives in Srae Boeung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice. She faces some problems today because she does not have the rice seeds she needs to plant a new crop. In order to deal with this problem and make her field more productive, she has decided to apply for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer and pesticides. Mrs. Koen Pov P. is 39 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school. Her third child earns a living making pots.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to make her field more productive.

loans.name: Nara

texts.en:
Mrs. Nara K., 38, and her husband, Mr. Savun Ben, 36, live in a small village along National Road Number five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia They were married in 1993 and have two children: one son and one daughter, both of whom attend school. 

Nara has been a garment factory worker for nine years. Her husband has been a fisherman for about 15 years, which is a skill he learned from his father. He catches fish from a river nearby his house and sells them in his village. Nara is requesting a loan of $400 to repair their boat and to purchase a boat motor for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To repair boat and to purchase a boat motor

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Mrs. Phorn T. lives in Srae Boeung village in Takeo province and makes a living breeding ducks. Because her business is going well, she wants to expand it by getting a loan to buy more ducks. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan. Mrs. Phorn T. is 46 years old widow with two children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more ducks for breeding.

loans.name: Sary

texts.en: Mrs. Sary U. lives in Chhoer Teal Phlos village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates both rice and vegetables. She also sells rice. She is facing a problem because she does not have enough money to buy rice to resell. Thus, Mrs. Sary U. has decided to seek a loan to make this possible. She is 31-year-old widow and the mother of a child who is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice to re-sell.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthy K. lives in Srae Boeung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she makes a living growing rice. To make her farm more productive, she needs money to buy fertilizer, pesticides and fuel. Her husband, Mr. Em Bross, is a fisherman. They have three children who are too young to work or go to school.  Her husband is seen here with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and fuel to make her farm more productive.

loans.name: Mov

texts.en:
Mr. Mov E., 39, and his wife, Mrs. Sorath Soun, 41, were married in 1988 and have three children: one son and two daughters. All of thE. are in school. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number five about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.

Mov and his wife have been in the business of producing vermicelli for over seven years, a skill they learned from their parents. They sell their product to a middleman. Mov is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase rice to produce vermicelli and to buy a motorbike to drive a motor taxi.

loans.use: To purchase rice and a motorbike

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan S., 60, and her husband, Mr. Thoeun Soun, 66, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1973 and have five children: two sons who are in school and three daughters. Two of their daughters are married but still live in the family home and the other daughter is a silk weaver.

Chan has been a silk weaver for 40 years. She sells her finished products to a middleman, who sells them at a market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been farming for 42 years. He grows many types of vegetables and other crops.

Chan is requesting her second loan of $1000 to purchase water pipe and a water pump machine for her husband's farm and to buy silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy a water pump for the farm and to buy silk material for her weaving business

loans.name: Sokunthea

texts.en: Mrs. Sokunthea H. lives in Boeung Tranch village in Takeo province, where she works as a tailor. Her husband, Mr. Keav Doeun, is a policeman. Even though they work hard, they cannot earn enough money to support their family. In order to improve their life, Mrs. Sokunthea H. has applied for a loan to buy chickens and a cow for breeding. She is 43 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school. The other two are too young to work or study. Her husband is seen here with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy chickens and a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Phun

texts.en:
Mrs. Phun C., 55, is a widow with eight children, four sons and four daughters. Four of her children are married and live outside the family home, one daughter is a farmer. The family lives on an Island in Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Phun has been a silk weaver for 42 years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman who then sell them at a market in Phnom Penh. She is asking for a loan of $1000. She will use some of the loan to purchase silk materials for her weaving business and some of it to help her daughter with her farm.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business and to use for farming.

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Mrs. Lorn P. is a 60-year-old widow who lives in Kna Roung village in Takeo province. She is a tailor and has six children, four of whom are employed in a garment factory. The others attend the local school. Even though Mrs. Lorn P.’s family members have jobs, they do not have enough money to buy a better house to live in. This is why Mrs. Lorn P. has decided to ask for a loan, which she will combine with her savings to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To help build a house.

loans.name: Vanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanthy P., 40, and her husband, Mr. Vang Pich, 47, live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1987 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. One of their daughters has full-time employment, and the other children attend school.

Vanthy has been raising pigs for seven years. Her husband has full-time employment at a hotel in Phnom Penh. Vanthy is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase piglets and to buy feed for the pigs.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Horn

texts.en: Mr. Horn K. lives in Kna Roung village in Takeo province, where he drives a motor taxi. His wife, Mrs. Ouk Sa Um, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows rice. In order to earn more money, Mr. Horn K. has decided to apply for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family's living standards with this loan. He is 49 years old and the father of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory. His second child is a security guard and his youngest attends the local school. His wife is seen here with him in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Ngat

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngat K., 54, is a widow with five children -  two daughters and three sons. One of her children is married and lives separately from home. Another  daughter is a tailor, two sons have full-time employment and another son is a silk weaver. The family lives on an Island off MeK. River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Ngat has been a silk weaver and selling silk fabric since 1979. She learned her skills from her neighbor. She buys them from the villagers for resale to provinces far away from her house, such as Siem Reap and Pursat provinces. Ngat is requesting for a second loan of $500 to purchase silk fabric for resale.

loans.use: To purchase silk fabric for resale.

loans.name: Samorn

texts.en: Mrs. Samorn K. lives in Ta Dork Pong village in Takeo province, where she makes a living breeding pigs. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she has decided to request a loan to buy more pigs to breed. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's life. Her husband, Mr. Pech Sarith, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. Mrs. Samorn K. is 47 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory. Her second child is enrolled in the local school and the youngest is too young to work or study. Her husband is seen her with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Dy

texts.en: Mrs. Dy T. lives in Prey May Lang Choreng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. She and her farm face a problem because her field is infertile. In order to grow a good crop, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer. Her husband, Mr. T. Sokhum, owns a plow which her rents out to other villages. Mrs. Dy T. is 39 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom attends the local school.
