Her second child repairs cars and her third is a laborer. Her husband is shown here with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to make her farm more productive.

loans.name: Vith

texts.en: Mrs. Vith T. lives in Srae Boeung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows rice. She is facing some problems because she does not have enough money to buy rice seed, fertilizer and pesticides to make her crop more productive. Thus, she decided to apply for a loan buy these things. Her husband, Mr. Ket Suy, is a hairdresser. Mrs. Vith T. is 43 years old and the mother of two children, both of who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is seen here with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer and pesticides to make her farm more productive.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Mr. Thy A. lives in Thmey village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he grows rice. His wife, Mrs. Chum Sareth, is a weaver. Even though they work hard, they cannot earn enough money to provide a better house for their family. Thus, Mr. Thy A. has decided to apply for a loA., which he will combine with his savings to buy a palm tree. He will use the timbers from this tree to build a house, hire the laborers he needs to do the work and buy other materials.  He is 40 years old and has four children, one of whom is a silk weaver. The other three attend the local school. We see his wife here with him in the photo.

loans.use: To buy palm tree and use the timbers to build a house

loans.name: Sok Kheng

texts.en: Mrs. Sok Kheng C. is a villager in Chhkae Slab village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Through her farm, she earns too little income to provide a better house for her family. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy timbers to build the house. Mrs. C. is a 55-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a security guard while the other attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy timbers to build a house

loans.name: Kol

texts.en: Mrs. Kol C. was born in 1972, and she now lives in Srey Chey village in Takeo province. She sells sand. Her husband, Mr. Mae Ry, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. C. is requesting a loan to build a staircase for her house. She is a mother of two children, who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To build a staircase for her house

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en: Mr. Sarun C. lives in Boeung Tranh village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In addition to this work, he is a policeman. His wife, Mrs. Lao Sokny, is a tailor. Even though they try to work hard, they earn too little income to support their family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. He hopes to increase his income with this loan. He is 48 years old and the father of four children, who attend the local school. His wife is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Panjperan Group

texts.en:
The Panjperan group has three member. All of the members would like to receive money for their businesses.

Anesgul and Sajeda want to take a loan for their husbands' fruit carts. Badamgul is taking a loan for her carpet-weaving business. They all want to see progress in their businesses and earn more money to better support their families.

They say that these loans can be very useful because they provide a chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To see progress in their businesses

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Mrs. Sophal T. is a farmer in Roluos village in Takeo province. She owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. She faces a problem: her field is infertile, which is diminishing her crop. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field and make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Nhouv Sovan Rath, is an assistant in a government department. Mrs. Sophal T. is 58 years old and the mother of four children. One of her children is a teacher, one is employed in a garment factory, one is a secretary in a government department, and the fourth attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Noun

texts.en: Mrs. Noun C. is a villager in Ang Kunh village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. C. Loas, is a construction worker. Even though they have two careers, they still earn too little income to support the family. Therefore, Mrs. C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan. She is 31 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom attend the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en: Mrs. Socheat N. lives in Roluos village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Khun Cheng, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. They are facing problems because they do not have enough money to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticides, or to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow on the field. In order to solve these problems, Mrs. Socheat N. decided to ask for a loan for these purposes. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. She is a 36-year-old mother of four, one of whom is employed in garment factory, while two others attend the local school and the fourth is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticides, and hire a laborer

loans.name: Phoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Phoeun N. is a villager in Ang Kunh village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Lam Nhum, sells water. Mrs. N. is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding, in order to improve the family's living conditions. She is 49 years old and the mother of eight children, two of whom are employed in garment factory while two others help their parents work. Three children are enrolled in the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Orn

texts.en: Mrs. Orn N. was born in 1970, and she now lives in Dork Por village in Takeo province. She is a coconut seller. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more coconuts to resell. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Un Phun, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. N. has five children, two of whom sell coconuts while two others attend the local school and the remaining one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts to resell

loans.name: Sarith

texts.en: Mr. Sarith P. is a villager in Krang Roung village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Chab Chanthy, owns a small restaurant to sell noodle soup. In her business, she usually pays a lot of money for a motor taxi to go buy goods and ingredients. Therefore, Mr. P. decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings to buy a motorbike for his wife’s business and reduce their expenses. He is 39 years old and the father of four children, two of whom are waiters in the restaurant while the others are enrolled in the local school. His wife is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his wife’s business

loans.name: Khann

texts.en: Mr. Khann K. is a farmer in Lvae village in Takeo province. He owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. He faces an obstacle because his field is infertile and he does not have enough money to hire laborers to work the field. In order to solve this problem, he decided to ask for a loan for these purposes. His wife, Mrs. Keo Nan, helps on the farm. Mr. K. is 45 years old and the father of two children who are both employed in a garment factory. His wife is shown with him in the picture.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work on the field

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 60-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Ali has been working a lathe for thirty years. He has requested a loan of $1000 USD from A. Majmoua to purchase tools for his work. This is his fourth loan cycle and he has always repaid his loans on time.

His previous loans helped him to improve his business. Ali decided to start his business because he was in need of cash. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Mhamad

texts.en:
Mhamad is a 50-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Mhamad has owned a grocery store for five years. He also sells vegetables. He requested a loan of $500 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his store, such as vegetables and cigarettes. 

This is Mhamad's second loan cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him to diversify his products and improve his business. Mhamad is special in his work because he is open until late in the evening. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he lacked cash. In the future, he plans to expand his business and lower his prices.

loans.use: Mhamad will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 68-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Youssef has owned a grocery store for five years. He also sells vegetables. He requested a loan of $800 US dollars from A. Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his store and repair his car. 

This is his third loan cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him to diversify his merchandise and improve his business. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Youssef first started his business, he lacked cash. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Youssef will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his store and repair his car.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon, with her husband and their four children. Mona has owned a gift shop for six years. She sells perfumes, make-up, toys and accessories. Mona has requested a loan of $1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for her shop, but especially to purchase gifts for Valentine’s Day. 

This is her second loan cycle and she has always paid on time.

Her previous loan helped her to improve her business. Mona is special in her work because she offers many choices to her clients and has diversity in her collection. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her business, she didn’t believe in her work and never thought that her business would succeed. She decided to start her business because she had bought the shop and she wanted to help supplement her family's income. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: Mona will use the loan to purchase merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Sona

texts.fr: Sona  B. est une jeune femme qui mène ses petites activités en vendant de la glace. Elle dispose d'un réfrigérateur et chaque soir elle y met une quarantaine de sachets de  d'un litre d'eau en vue de leur congélation au bout de vingt heures environ. La boulangerie du coin est abonnée chez elle pour la fourniture journalière de vingt-cinq glaces. C'est par cette activité que Sona parvient à subvenir à ses besoins et à épargner petit à petit. Elle voudrait ainsi l’extension de  son activité afin de pouvoir assurer une distribution plus large, ceci par l'acquisition d'un deuxième réfrigérateur
texts.en:
Sona B. is a young woman who runs a small business selling ice. She has a refrigerator into which, every evening, she puts some 40 one-liter bags of water, which freeze in about 20 hours. The corner bakery is a customer of hers, to whom she supplies 25 blocks of ice each day. It is through this business activity that Sona is able to support herself and make small savings. She would like to grow her business and distribute her ice more extensively. For this she needs a second refrigerator.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell ice

loans.name: Mounir

texts.en:
Mounir is a 35 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Mounir has a metA. business and has been in this business since he was young. 

Mounir requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase gold for his business. This is his third loan and he has always paid his loans off on time. His previous loans helped him improve his family situation.

loans.use: Mounir will use the loan to purchase gold for his business.

loans.name: Mouwafak

texts.en:
Mouwafak is a 55-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Mouwafak has been working as a men's clothing salesman for twenty years. Mouwafak has requested a loan of 800 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase clothes for his shop. Mouwafak has been a micro-credit client for eight years now and has always repaid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his business and his family's financial situation. His clients are his family members, friends, neighbors, and others. Mouwafak decided on doing this business because he always wanted to sell clothes. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for his shop

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 31-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Ali has been working as a taxi driver for three years. Ali requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car and purchase a refrigerator and an oven for his house.

This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. Ali is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his family members, friends, neighbors and others. He decided on doing his business because of their lack of cash and his family's financial situation. In the future, he plans to purchase a new car.

loans.use: to do some maintenance work on his car and purchase a refrigerator and an oven

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: Jamal is a 27-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Jamal has been working as a scrap metal dealer for twelve years. He requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his work and also to paint his house. This is his second loan and he has always repaid on time. Jamal is special in his work because he is trustful and he likes his work a lot. His clients can be anybody.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his work and paint his house

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.en:
Mhammad is a 40-year-old man who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon with his wife and their seven children. He has been repairing cars and selling spare parts for twenty-five years. Mhammad learned this business when he was young. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and others.

Mhammad is requesting a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase new tools and merchandise for his garage. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. In the future, Mhammad plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase new tools and merchandise for his garage

loans.name: Jounied

texts.en:
Jounied is a 21-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon. He has been working as a plumber since 2007. Jounied feels he is unique because he is honest and does good work. His clients are his friends and neighbors.

When he first started his business, he didn't have enough cash, but he decided to go ahead with the business because he wanted to increase his family's income. Jounied requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase tools for his business. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. In the future, Jounied plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase plumbing tools for his business

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en: Ayman is a 20-year-old married man, working as a floor tile polisher, and living in Aley in Mount Lebanon. He learned his profession from his father, since he used to help his father when he was young. Today, Ayman wants to borrow US$ 1,000 in order to buy new tools and to perform maintenance on the floor tile polishing machine.

loans.use: Buy new tools and have his machine serviced

loans.name: Vieru

texts.en:
Mr. S. lives in Causeni district. The main activity of this borrower is raising animals and especially cows, grown to produce milk, and pigs for meat. Since 1999 he has private ownership of 2.18 hectares of agricultural land and 0.4 hectares of vineyard. The borrower is the owner of the animals which he keeps in the household.

The business location is in Causeni town. The business was launched in 1994. This is the second loan borrowed from MicroInvest and the purpose of the loan is to purchase two pigs and building materials for pig-sty reconstruction. Future plans of this client are to grow more grape vines and also to increase the number of sales in this district. He is very experienced; he has worked in this field for more than 10 years.

loans.use: purchasing two pigs and building materials for pig-sty reconstruction

loans.name: Demian

texts.en:
Demian D. lives in Cimislia district, Suric village. She is a very responsible and optimistic person. D. wishes to develop her business, consisting of cattle raising, in her village because there is a very high demand for milk from the villagers and especially from customers who come from enclosed towns.

D. is helped by her brother Alexander who lives in the same village and he also borrowed a loan from MicroInvest with the purpose of increasing the number of cattle, together with his sister. D. and Alexander are now faced with many problems because their parents are ill and they want to help them, however it is difficult for them. They find their way out in succeeding in business, so we hope that their capabilities and services provided by MicroInvest will help them improve the business.

loans.use: to increase the number of cattle

loans.name: Joumana

texts.en:
Joumana is a 34-year-old woman who lives in Bourj el Barajneh in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with her husband and their two children. Joumana has been tattooing women for a year. Joumana thinks she is unique because she likes her work and does it well. Her clients can be anybody. Thanks to her friends and husband, she decided on starting this business.

She requested a loan of 700 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase a needle for her work and to pay for tattoo training. This is the first time that Joumana has requested a loan. In the future, she plans on improving her business.

loans.use: Purchase supplies and training for her tattoo business

loans.name: Nojoud

texts.en:
Nojoud is a 35-year-old woman who lives in Bourj el Barajneh in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with her husband and their two children. Nojoud has been working and selling accessories in a cosmetic shop for three years. Nojoud decided on working in this business to make and save some money. Her clients are friends and neighbors.

Nojoud requested a loan of 600 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase accessories for her shop. This is the first time that Nojoud has requested a loan. In the future, she plans to expand her business and increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase accessories for her shop

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alexandru

texts.en:
Alexandru D. lives in Cimislia district, Suric village; he is a very responsible and optimistic person, and he has 3 children and a wife whom he has to support.

Alexandru wishes to develop his business. This business consists of cattle-raising in his village because there is a very high demand for milk from villagers and especially from customers who come from enclosed towns. Alexandru is helped by his sister Dorina who lives in the same village. She also borrowed a loan from MicroInvest with the purpose of increasing the number of cattle, together with her brother.

Dorina and Alexandru are currently faced with many problems because their parents are ill and they want to help them. They find their way to do that is to succeed in business, so we hope that their capabilities and services provided by MicroInvest will help them improve the business.

loans.use: to increase the number of cattle

loans.name: Los Reyes Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "LOS REYES"  REPRESENTADOS POR LA SEÑORA EMILENE ESTA COMPUESTO POR 12 INTEGRANTES LOS CUALES SE DEDICAN A ACTIVIDADES DE COMERCIO DE DIFERENTES PRODUCTOS COMO COSMÉTICOS, ABARROTES, ROPA, ZAPATOS, COMIDA, Y OTROS SE DEDICAN A ACTIVIDADES COMO LA REPOSTERÍA, SERVICIO DE NIÑERAS Y AL TRANSPORTE PÚBLICO DE PASAJEROS. DENTRO DEL ÁMBITO COMERCIAL LA COMPETENCIA ES DE TODOS LOS DÍAS Y PARA PODER COMPETIR SE DEBE CONTAR CON PRODUCTOS DE CALIDAD Y A BAJO PRECIO ES ESTO LO QUE MANTIENEN EN PIE LOS PUESTOS DE VENTA. EL FINANCIAMIENTO ESTA DESTINADO AL INCREMENTO DE INSUMOS Y MATERIALES PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SUS PRODUCTOS Y PODER INCREMENTAR SUS INGRESOS Y MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE SUS FAMILIAS. A PESAR DE QUE LOS SOCIOS (AS) CURSAN SU PRIMER CICLO EN LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL ELLOS (AS) CUENTAN CON EXPERIENCIA EN GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS Y SABEN COMO ADMINISTRAR LOS FONDOS A OTORGAR, ASÍ COMO LA RESPONSABILIDAD Y PUNTUALIDAD QUE SE REQUIERE PARA CUMPLIR CON SUS OBLIGACIONES.
texts.en:
The "Los Reyes" group is represented by Ms. Emilene and comprised of twelve members who sell different products like cosmetics, groceries, clothing, shoes and food, and others who work at different activities like baking pastries, child care and public transportation. Within the commercial sphere they must compete daily and in order to compete they must be able to depend upon high-quality, low-cost products. This is what keeps their sales stands running. The loan will be used to increase supplies and materials to improve their products and be able to increase their earnings and better the quality of life of their families. Even though this is their first loan with FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL, they rely on a supportive group experience, knowledge of managing loaned funds, and also their responsibility and punctuality to fulfill their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational Expenses

loans.name: Delfi Aleman Uno Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "DELFI ALEMÁN UNO" ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA CARMEN Y COMPUESTO POR 15 MIEMBROS LOS CUALES VAN CURSANDO JUNTOS SU CUARTO CICLO EN LOS CUALES DEMOSTRARON RESPONSABILIDAD Y HONESTIDAD EN SU PAGOS Y UN TRABAJO EN EQUIPO EJEMPLAR POR LO QUE CUENTAN CON MUCHA EXPERIENCIA EN GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS Y CON LA CONFIANZA DE LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL. EN SU MAYORÍA ESTE GRUPO SE DEDICA AL COMERCIO DE PRODUCTOS COMO SER  VERDURA, COMIDA, ROPA, PAN, FRUTA Y A SERVICIO DE COCINA, CONSTRUCCIÓN Y CONFECCIÓN DE PRENDAS DE VESTIR. EN EL COMERCIO EXISTE BASTANTE COMPETENCIA, PERO LAS SOCIAS TIENEN BASTANTE EXPERIENCIA PARA SABE COMO MANEJAR CUALQUIER ADVERSIDAD. EL DESTINO DEL CRÉDITO ES PARA LA COMPRA DE INSUMOS, MATERIALES Y HERRAMIENTAS PARA MEJORAR SUS PRODUCTOS E INCREMENTAR SUS INGRESOS PARA SUSTENTAR A SUS FAMILIAS Y MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
The Delfi Alemán Uno Group is represented by Ms. Carmen and comprised of fifteen members who have completed their fourth loan term together and demonstrated responsibility and honesty in their payments, and exemplary teamwork that those with a lot of experience in supportive groups can count on. They also have the trust of the Fundación Agrocapital. The majority of this group sells products like vegetables, food, clothing, bread, and fruit, or works in kitchen service, construction, and the sewing of clothing. There is plenty of competition in business, but these associates have plenty of experience to know how to overcome any obstacle. This loan is for buying supplies, materials, and tools to improve their products and to increase their earnings to support their families and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational Expenses

loans.name: Parfenie

texts.en:
Parfenie C. lives in Cimislia district, Sagaidac village. Since 2000, Parfenie was involved in sheep and goat-raising because he had worked before at a sheepfold as a shepherd from the village and was paid by the sheep owners. Now he wants to create his own sheepfold in order to have his sheep to have milk that Parfenie wants to sell to customers in the region.

The purpose of the loan is to buy 10 sheep and building materials for sheepfold construction. Business is in a period of release, and this is why the borrower needs this loan to develop his business. This is the first loan he has borrowed from MicroInvest. His future plan is to increase the number of sheep and also to raise cattle. He wishes to expand his business due to its capabilities and the opportunity given by MicroInvest.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep and building materials for sheepfold construction

loans.name: Danaya (La Confiance). Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est un regroupement de quatre femmes du quartier Darsalam de la ville de Koutiala(troisième région adminstrative de la république du Mali). Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans, mariées et mères d’au moins 6 enfants. Elles mènent  comme activité principale la vente de bois de chauffe. Elles ont de l’expérience dans la vente de bois de chauffe car elles sont équipées de charrêtes, d’ânes  et  ont de conducteurs.
Dans le souci d’augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y’a de cela tout juste un mois. Ces femmes sont à leur premier  prêt. 
Le prêt  sera utilisé pour achéter du bois de chauffe dans les villages de Belesso, Sirakélé, Tiesso etc auprès des paysans.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 55 000 FCFA de bénéfice chacune. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, et faire face aux charges courantes de la famille. Dans l’avenir, le groupe compte obtenir  un prêt élévé pour pouvoir se procurer d’un chargement de bois  de camion rémorque .
texts.en:
The group Danaya is composed of four women of the Darsalam district of the city of Koutiala (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are married mothers who average 40 years of age and six children. Their principal work involves selling firewood. They are experienced in it because they drive donkeys with carts. Concerned about expanding their businesses, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso just a month ago. They are on their first loan, which will be used to buy firewood in the villages of Belesso, Sirakélé, Tiesso, etc. from small-scale farmers.

With this loan, they each intend to realize an average profit of 55,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay the loan interest and to address common family expenses. In the future, the group plans to obtain a larger loan to procure a trailer truck-load of firewood.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Kotognontala (L’Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kotognontala est un regroupement de femmes de Sogomougou Koutiala. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans, mariées et mères d’au moins 4 enfants. Elles mènent  une même activité (la vente d’articles divers.)
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit  de l’institution de Soro Yiriwaso il y’a six ans. Ces femmes sont à leur onzième prêt de groupe, après avoir correctement remboursé tous les dix premiers. 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter divers articles,  produits cosmétiques, miroir, lampe à pétrole,  jeux pour enfants etc. 
Elles s’approvisionnent auprès des grossistes de la ville de Koutiala, Bamako (capitale du Mali), Bobo (au Burkina Faso) et Lomé (capitale de la république du Togo). Elles vendent les articles dans le grand marché de Koutiala  et dans les foires des villages environnants à une clientèle riche et variée, au comptant en détail et à crédit.
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala comptent réaliser un bénéfice de 200 000 FCFA chacune au cours de  ce cycle.  
En dehors du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elles ambitionnent ouvrir une boutique de quincaillerie dans la ville de Koutiala.
texts.en:
The group Kotognontala is composed of married women from Sogomougou Koutiala who are mothers averaging 43 years of age and four children. They all do the same kind of work (the sale of various goods.) To expand their businesses, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program six year ago and are on their eleventh group loan, since they correctly repaid the first ten loans.

This loan will be used to buy various goods: cosmetics, mirrors, kerosene lamps, children’s games, etc. Supplies are gotten from wholesalers of the cities of Koutiala, Bamako (capital of Mali), Bobo (in Burkina Faso), and Lomé (capital of the Republic of Togo). The goods are sold retail at the grand marketplace of Koutiala and at the fairs of surrounding villages to customers who are rich and varied, cash or credit accepted.

The group members each intend to realize a profit of 200,000 francs CFA during this cycle. Besides repaying the loan, they use a portion of the revenues to address common family expenses. Their ambition is to open a hardware store in Koutiala.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Bittechi (C’Est Pour Tout De Suite) Group

texts.fr:
Les (8) huit femmes du groupe Bittechi sont des femmes mariées âgées de 30 ans avec en moyenne 6 enfants. Elles vivent  dans de familles conjugales élargies traditionnelles dans le village de Solomanebougou Commune rurale de Marka-coungo, préfecture de Dioïla dans la Région  de  Koulikoro (République du Mali). 
 Unies par des liens de parenté et de voisinage, ces femmes font essentiellement  l’achat et la vente de condiments alimentaires.
Pour développer leur commerce et générer plus d’intérêts elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur troisième prêt. Tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Auprès des maraîchers de Solomanebougou et environs elles comptent acheter, une grande quantité de feuilles d’oignon, 100 kg de beurre de karité et 80 kg de noix de néré pour les revendre au comptant et en détail sur le marché de Marka-coungo à une clientèle locale et des revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Ces femmes du groupe Bittechi comptent réaliser un bénéfice de 25 000 FCFA par personne à la fin du cycle.
texts.en:
The eight women of the group Bittechi are married and average 30 years of age and six children. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Solomanebougou, a rural community of Marka-Coungo (Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region) in the Republic of Mali. United by ties of parentage and community, these women essentially do commerce in condiments.

To develop their commerce and to attract more customers, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third loan. All the preceding ones have been correctly repaid. From out of the market gardens of Solomanebougou and surrounding areas, they plan to buy a large quantity of onion leaves, 100 kg of karité butter, and 80 kg of néré nuts for resale in cash in the Marka-Coungo marketplace. The customers are local and include retailers from large cities.

The group members plan to realize a profit of 25,000 francs CFA per person at the end of the cycle.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Giann Carlos

texts.es:
El microempresario Giann Carlos Siú tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero y se dedica desde hace 2 años a atender una pulpería que es de su propiedad y  con la cual obtiene los ingresos para sustentar sus necesidades y a la vez ayudar económicamente a su mama quien ya es una adulta mayor.

El señor Siú ofrece una variedad de productos tales como granos básicos  (arroz, frijoles, azúcar etc) productos carnicos (carne de res, carne  de pollo)  jabón, aceite entre otros. Sin embargo al igual que otros microempresarios necesita financiamiento para poder comprar mayor cantidad de productos y tener un poco mas de utilidad que le permita mejorar su nivel de vida. Esta solicitando comprar  lo siguiente:


1 Docena de  vasos con café presto grande le cuesta US$ 3 dólares cada vaso con café, 2 cajas de leche la lechera a US$ 45 dólares cada caja, 3 cajas de sopa maruchan a US$ 10 dólares cada caja, 2 cajones de huevos de gallina a US$ 37 dólares cada cajón, 2 quintales de arroz americano a US$ 60 dólares cada quintal, 2 quintales de azúcar  a US$ 30 dólares cada quintal y 3 bolsones de papel higiénico a US$ 30 dólares cada bolsón.
texts.en:
Giann Carlos Siú, a small businessperson, is 24 and single. He has been the proprietor of a small store for 2 years, which gives him the income for his necessities as well as helping his mother out economically. Señor Siú offers a variety of products such as basic grains (rice, beans, sugar, etc.), meat products (beef, chicken), soap, and oil among other things. Just like other small businesspersons, he needs financing to buy larger quantities of products, useful for improving his quality of life. He is requesting a loan to purchase the following: 1 dz. large cups of instant coffee, US$3 per cup; 2 cases of Milkmaid milk, US$45 per case; 3 cases of Maruchan soup, US$10 per case; 2 crates of chicken eggs, US$37 per crate; 200 Kg. American rice, US$60 per 100 Kg.; 200 Kg. sugar, US$30 per 100 Kg.; and 3 bags of hygienic tissue, US$30 per bag.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy instant coffee, milk, soup, eggs, rice, and toilet tissue

loans.name: Danaya (La Confiance) Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont toutes  mariées et ont en moyenne de 24 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent  dans de familles conjugales élargies traditionnelles avec leurs coépouses, frères et sœurs, et enfants dans le village de Yolla sous préfecture de Fana, Région  de  Koulikoro (République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues par les relations de voisinage. Dans l’intention de pouvoir acheter beaucoup de lait et servir plus de clients, elles ont décidé d’adhérer le programme crédit de  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur dixième prêt. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ces femmes veulent acheter avec ce prêt, 500 litres de lait auprès des éleveurs de Yolla et environs pour les revendre(frais, caillé et ses dérivés : crèmes…)au comptant et en détail dans la ville de Fana. 
Elles comptent réaliser  15 000 FCFA de bénéfice qui sera utilisé pour aider les époux à subvenir aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The group Danaya is composed of women, all married, who average 24 years of age and two children. They live in extended traditional families with their co-wives, brothers, sisters, and children in the village of Yolla (Fana sub-prefecture, Koulikoro region) in the Republic of Mali. They know one another by community ties.

Intending to be able to buy a lot of milk and to serve their customers better, they decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their tenth loan, and all the preceding ones have been correctly repaid. With this loan, the women want to buy 500 liters of milk from livestock farmers of Yolla and surrounding areas for retail sale (fresh milk, curdled milk, and milk products, such as cream). Sales are made in Fana at the retail level and in cash.

The group members plan to realize a profit of 15,000 francs CFA to help their husbands cover family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk

loans.name: Deme (Soutien) Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Démè sont toutes mariées et ont une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans et de 2 enfants. Elles vivent  dans de familles conjugales élargies traditionnelles avec leurs coépouses, sœurs, et enfants dans le village de Solomanebougou Commune rurale de Marka-coungo, préfecture de Dioïla (Région  de  Koulikoro en République du Mali)
Elles se sont connues par les relations de mariages et font comme activité l’achat et la vente de condimentaires alimentaires. 
Dans le souci d’améliorer leur commerce ces femmes du groupe Démè ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur troisième prêt. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt, 100 boites de concentrée de tomate, 200 paquets de 60 morceaux de cube maggi dans le marché de Marka-coungo auprès des forains. Elles effectuent leurs ventes dans le marché de Solomanebougou au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle constituée en général de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice de 20 000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour aider les époux à subvenir aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The women of the group Démè are all married and average 25 years of age and two children. They live in traditional extended families with their co-wives, sisters, and children in the village of Solomanebougou, a rural community of Marka-Coungo, Dioïla prefecture (Koulikoro region, in the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through family ties and work buying and selling condiments.

Concerned about improving their commerce, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third loan. All the preceding ones have been correctly repaid. With this loan, they intend to buy 100 cans of tomato paste and 200 packets of 60-count Maggi cubes (bouillon cubes) at the Marka-Coungo marketplace from vendors. Sales are made at the Solomanebougou marketplace at the retail level, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed generally of women.

They plan to realize a profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used to help their husbands cover family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments for resale

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is fifty-one years old. She is married with two children. One of them has completed senior high school and is waiting for the results to enter the tertiary, preferably the university, next year. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items such as rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, biscuits, etc. in the local market.

Sabina wants to use the loan to buy bulk stocks of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted spices, washing soaps and powders, etc., especially in the current season to avoid price hikes due to the food crisis. Sabina hopes to make good income from the expanded business to finance her children’s education to provide them with life opportunities better than what she had.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her shop

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djantoyerela est constitué des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et de 6 enfants. Elles vivent  dans de familles conjugales élargies traditionnelles avec leurs coépouses, sœurs, et enfants dans le village de Yolla sous préfecture de Fana, Région  de  Koulikoro, (République du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues par les relations de mariages. Pour améliorer leur commerce elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur dixième prêt. Tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt, 50 boites de concentrée tomate, 350 kg d’oignon, 100 kg de sel de cuisine et une quantité importante de petits autres condiments alimentaires. Tous les achats se feront dans la ville de Fana auprès des commerçants grossistes pour ensuite être  revendus en détail  au comptant et à crédit dans le village de Yolla à une clientèle locale et aux habitants des villages voisins. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice de 25 000 FCFA  chacune à la fin du cycle. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour soutenir les frais de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The group Djantoyerela is composed of married women who average 34 years of age and six children. The live in traditional extended families with their co-wives, sisters, and children in the village of Yolla (Fana sub-prefecture, Koulikoro region) in the Republic of Mali. The women know one another through family ties.

To improve their commerce, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their tenth loan. All the preceding ones have been correctly repaid. With this loan, they intend to buy 50 cans of tomato paste, 350 kg of onions, 100 kg of salt, and a sizable quantity of minor condiments. All purchases will be made in Fana from wholesale merchants and then sold retail, cash or credit accepted, in the village of Yolla, to customers who are local or who live in neighboring villages.

They each plan to realize a profit of 25,000 francs CFA at the end of the cycle. These profits will be used to cover the health care costs of the children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments for resale

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is twenty-eight years old. She is single. Comfort lives alone in a rented apartment in a suburb of Accra. She sells porridge and maize in her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed popularly as breakfast by many Ghanaians. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and taken with sugar, milk and bread.

With a large customer base, Comfort wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials such as bags of maize, millet, sugar, and milk to increase production. She also wants to upgrade her maize sales. She hopes to raise good income to build her own shop before she gets into a marriage.

loans.use: To buy millet and maize to produce porridge for sale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence A. is forty years old. She is a single parent and has two children. They are both in school. She is a food vendor and sells “kenkey”. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish or soup. She has many customers because kenkey is enjoyed by many Ghanaians as breakfast, lunch and supper. Florence sells on the street in the mornings and evenings. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She hopes to raise her income to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and fish

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Djekafo sont tous des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 24 ans et de 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans de familles conjugales élargies traditionnelles dans le village de Yolla sous préfecture de Fana, Région  de  Koulikoro (République du Mali). 
C’est à travers  les activités commerciales que ces femmes se sont connues et font l’achat et la vente de céréales.
Dans le souci de développer leur activité, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur dixième prêt. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles veulent acheter, 3 tonnes de maïs et 2 tonnes de sorgho. Les achats seront effectués dans le village de Yolla auprès des paysans pour être revendu à Fana au comptant en gros et en détail aux revendeurs. Avec cette liquidité elles payeront des condiments alimentaires de retour qui seront revendus aux ménagères  du village de Yolla. 
Elles comptent obtenir 35 000 FCFA de bénéfice  chacune qui sera utilisé pour subvenir aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the group Djekafo are all married women who average 24 years of age and three children. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Yolla (Fana sub-prefecture, Koulikoro region) in the Republic of Mali. It is through working in commerce that these women know one another buying and selling grain.

Concerned about developing their business, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their tenth loan. All the preceding ones have been correctly repaid. With this loan, they intend to buy 3 tonnes of corn and 2 tonnes of sorghum. Purchases will be made in Yolla from small-scale farmers and then sold in cash, wholesale and retail, in Fana. With cash in hand, the group members will buy some condiments on the return trip and sell them to housewives in Yolla.

They each plan to realize a profit of 35,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys A. is 51 years old. She is divorced and has three children. One is still in school while the rest have completed senior high school and have been working for a while. Gladys lives with her children in a rented apartment in a suburb of Accra. She is a retailer of charcoal and fries yam and fish for her local community. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all the traditional Ghanaian homes. Gladys obtains her supply of charcoal from the villages and retails them to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of charcoal, yam, fish, and pepper to increase her stock and earn the proceeds she needs to get her own store.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal, etc

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther Q. is a married woman with three children. Some have completed junior high school and one has completed senior high school. She is a forty year old business woman. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a suburb of Accra. Esther started trading twelve years ago and she enjoys selling goods. She trades in clothing materials. Esther believes in hard work and dedication. She has gained lots of marketing experience, making her one of the successful traders in Abeka market. She believes the loan would give her the capital to purchase more stock of clothing materials to serve her customers. She procures her fabrics from the textile depots around her community. Esther says she wants to sponsor her children in school to make it to the tertiary level.

loans.use: To procure textile fabrics

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguiya est composé de (4) quatre femmes qui sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et de 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans de familles conjugales élargies traditionnelles avec leurs coépouses, sœurs, et enfants dans le village de Solomanebougou commune rurale de Marka-coungo, préfecture de Dioïla  Région  de  Koulikoro en (République du Mali). Par des relations de voisinage et de mariage ces femmes se sont connues et font le commerce de condiments alimentaires.
Dans le but d’améliorer leur commerce et de mieux servir les clients, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur troisième prêt. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles comptent acheter 200kg d’oignon, 300kg de sel de cuisine et une grande quantité de condiments de tous genres. Tous ces produits seront achetés auprès des paysans producteurs dans le village de Solomanebougou et environ excepté le sel (acheté à Fana auprès de commerçants grossistes) pour être revendu à Solomanebougou et à Marka-coungo. Si tout se passe comme prévu, elles comptent obtenir  20 000 FCFA de bénéfice qui sera utilisé pour entretenir les enfants.
texts.en:
The group Djiguiya is composed of four women, all married, who average 31 years of age and five children. They live in traditional extended families with their co-wives, sisters, and children in the village of Solomanebougou, a rural community of Marka-Coungo (Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region) in the Republic of Mali. The women know one another through ties of community and family and do commerce in condiments.

With the goal of improving their commerce and to serve their customers better, the group members decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution SoroYiriwaso. They are on their third loan. All the preceding ones have been correctly repaid. With this loan, they intend to buy 200 kg of onions, 300 kg of salt, and a large quantity of condiments of all types. All these goods will be purchased from rural producers in the village of Solomanebougou and surrounding areas, except for the salt (purchased in Fana from wholesale merchants). The goods are to be sold in Solomanebougou and in Marka-Coungo.

If all goes as planned, they intend to obtain 20,000 francs CFA in profits that will be used to care for the children

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Zuharla

texts.en:
Married with three children, among them beautiful twins who are currently schooling. Zuharla S. is a 39 year old trader. She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidote to minimizing poverty and for that matter she is very serious with her business. She trades in cereals like maize. 

Zuharla started this business when she moved from the northern region. Zuharla has remained in this business for the past four years now.  Through this Zuharla has been very resourceful for her family. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of maize to serve her customers throughout the season. Especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. She believes with the loan she can buy more bags of maize grains from the farmers, avoiding middlemen who retail to her at a higher price.

Zuharla belongs to a village bank called ‘Agnes’. She also hope to receive GH¢400 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to support her husband in taking care of their home.

loans.use: To buy a larger supply of maize

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes K. is a 51 year old mother of six children who are currently in school. Some are in the senior high while others are in the junior high school. She is very supportive to her husband in taking care of the kids in school. Agnes lives with the family in a rented apartment. She trades in sewing accessories and has been doing this for the past twenty years. She sells items like lining materials, sewing thread, and school uniforms. She wants to use the loan to buy more sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to increase savings to support the kids in school.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and sewing accessories

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena O. is 30 years old. She is married and a mother of three, with twins. Currently all the kids are in school. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her livelihood.  She has been selling yams for six years to support her family.

She treks to farming communities like Kintampo in the Brong Ahafo region to buy her stock of yam from the yam farmers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy yams in bulk to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school. Helena belongs to a village bank called ‘Agnes’. She also hope to receive GH¢500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more and to support her husband in taking care of the home.

loans.use: To buy yams in bulk

loans.name: Sindiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sindiya est composé de (6) femmes  toutes mariées qui  ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et de 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans de familles conjugales élargies traditionnelles  dans le village de Solomanebougou Commune rurale de Marka-coungo, préfecture de Dioïla, Région  de  Koulikoro, (République du Mali). Elles se sont connues par les relations de mariages. Dans l’objectif d’avoir plus de stocks et fournir assez de clients elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur troisième prêt. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec les paysans producteurs de  Solomanebougou et environs ayant une autorisation de coupe, ces femmes se proposent d’acheter,  4 tonnes de charbon de bois (40 sacs de 100kg) pour ensuite les revendre en détail et en gros sur le marché de Marka-coungo à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs et de population locale.
Elles comptent obtenir 40 000 FCFA de bénéfice qui sera utilisé pour aider les époux à subvenir aux dépenses familiales.
NB : Magnini D. est absente de la photo de groupe pour des raisons de maladies.
texts.en:
The Sindiya group is composed of 6 women, all married, who have an average age of 30 and, on average, 3 children. They live in extended traditional families with the village of Solomanebougou, in the Marka-coungo district, prefecture of Dioïla, Koulikoro region, (Republic of Mali). They are acquainted with each other because they are in-laws. With the goal of having more stock so they can serve more customers, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed.

From the farmers of Solomanebougou and surroundings who have an authorization to cut wood, these women intend to buy 4 tons of charcoal (40 sacks of 100 kg) which they will sell retail and also wholesale at the market of Marka-coungo to a clientele constituted of retailers and of local people.

They expect to make 40,000 F CFA of profit which will be used to help their husbands support their families. Note: Magnini D. is absent from the group photo because of illness.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of charcoal for re-sale

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia B. A. is 29 years old. She is married and the mother of two kids. Currently one child is in primary school and the last born is still breastfeeding. Olivia lives at Abofour a suburb of Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She lives in a rented apartment in the community with her husband and the children. She met her husband when on a trek to purchase food stuff at Kintampo in the Brong Ahafo region and later they got married.

She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her livelihood. She has been selling yams for ten years to support her family. Yam is one of the favorite staple foods that supply carbohydrates in the local diet. She takes delivery of stock from farmers who provide her with direct supply. This enables her to avoid middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy yams in bulk to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school.

Olivia belongs to a village bank called ‘Agnes’. She also hopes to receive GH¢500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to support the husband in taking care of the home.

loans.use: To buy yams in bulk

loans.name: Philip

texts.en: Philip A. is 38 years old. He is married with two kids, both in the junior high school. He is a retailer of ply wood, ceiling bottoms, nails, and sells under a shed in his local area. He buys his supplies in bulk from Asamankese in the Eastern Region, about 300kms away from where he lives with his family. Philip says he sells to the carpenters and the wood workers in his community. He is handicapped by low working capital since building material prices have gone up. He therefore needs the loan to remain in business. He wants to use the loan to buy a chainsaw machine. He believes this will enable him to make good income for his business. He needs to save enough money to pay for his children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy plywood, nail, etc.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is 36 years old. She is divorced and has one kid. The child is currently in the basic school. She is a petty trader who trades in used clothes. Selling of used clothing has a very big market in Ghana as brand new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore selling of used clothing has created a market for many women like Doris. She sells in the market square in her locality and also treks to nearby markets to sell. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her save for her child’s education and also to rent a store to trade in.

loans.use: To buy second hand textiles

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace K. is 41 years old. She is married and the mother of seven children. Currently two of them are in the senior high school while the rest are in the primary. Grace lives with her husband in his rented apartment with the children. It has been her dream to give her kids a better education.

She has been a food vendor for twenty years now in Abofour community market where she lives with her family. She sells rice with stew, which is mostly purchased by the traders. Her food is very moderate and also tastes good attracting lots of customers to buy from her table. In addition to that she also prepares and sells pastries also at the road side.  

Grace wants the loan to buy more bags of raw materials like rice, meat, charcoal, flour, and margarine, among others. She is convinced the loan would help her increased her stock, and in the event of a price hike she would be better resourced to cook food and fried pastries. Grace says the proceeds will be used to supports her kids in their education. She says she would be grateful for your assistance. Grace belongs to a village bank called ‘Okyeso Nyame’ which means Almighty God. She also hope to receive GH¢1000 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs like rice, cooking oil, charcoal, spices and meats, etc.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys A. is 48 years old. She is married and has given birth to five children. Currently, all of her children are in the basic school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a suburb of Accra. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, and skimmed powdered milk in her neighborhood. She sells in both wholesale and retail. With the loan, she wants to increase her market size to make enough savings to purchase a van to help distribute stock to her customers. She hopes to raise more income to support her children in school.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Married with five children who are currently schooling, Adwoa K. is a 38 year old trader. She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidote to minimizing poverty and she is very serious in her business. She trades in yam and cassava. Adwoa lives with her husband who is a driver and she married 16 years ago in the village.

Adwoa started this business with her mother and has remained in this business for five years having inherited it from her mother. At the time she said she did not realized the importance of education but she sees it now. And she has been a great resource for her family in providing a better education for them. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of yam and cassava. Adwoa believes this will help her to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country.

Adwoa belongs to a village bank called ‘Sarah’. She also hope to receive GH¢500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy bulk supplies of cassava and tubers of yam

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La señora Rosa A. es propietaria de una estancia para bebes, hermosa labor a la que se dedica  desde hace 4 años, su esposo es maestro de una secundaria en una conocida escuela de la ciudad. Ahora tienen el proyecto de ampliar la guardería, es por ello que están solicitando este crédito para seguir como una buena opción para las madres  y darles el apoyo en un lugar más amplio y cómodo.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa A. owns her own daycare. She has been in this beautiful line of work for 4 years. Her husband is a teacher in a well-known middle school in the city. She now has plans to expand the nursery, which is why she is requesting this loan. She wants to keep being a good option for mothers, giving them support in a more spacious and comfortable setting.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Nursery expansion

texts.es:
El señor julio trabaja para una maquiladora en el área de soldadura con una antigüedad de 2 años, su esposa trabaja para una fabrica y su hijo el mayor también labora para una empresa conocida dentro de la ciudad. 
Ellos demostrando que el esfuerzo, la constancia y la unión familiar es la base de todo, han salido adelante, y ahora están solicitando este crédito para la impermeabilización del techo de su casa ya que con tanta lluvia se ha ido deteriorando.
texts.en:
Mr. Julio R. has been working in the welding department of an assembly plant for 2 years. His wife works for a factory, while their eldest son works for a well-known company in the city.

They have gotten ahead in life, demonstrating that effort, perseverance and family unity are the foundation for everything. They are now requesting this loan in order to waterproof the roof of their house because it has deteriorated with the rain.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa Y. is 65 years old and she is married and living together with the husband. She has 11 children, four are currently in the community elementary school and the others are fully independent. She sells food stuff like bags of maize and beans in the local market of Abofour where she lives. Hawa says she enjoys selling because that is where she derives her source of livelihood. She has been selling for the past twelve years, with lots of experience that helps to win customers. 

Hawa Y. is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide her kids with quality education for their future career. With the loan, she wants to purchase increased stock of maize and beans to satisfy her customers’ needs. She says prices of commodities in the market have become very expensive. Therefore she requests the loan to trek to the farming communities so that she can avoid middlemen who retail to them at a high price. 

Hawa belongs to a village bank called ‘Paul’. She also hopes to receive GH¢800 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to support her husband in taking care of the home.

loans.use: To purchase bulk stock of beans and maize.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: El señor Juan Antonio labora para una maquiladora de ladrillo, su esposa y el atienden su negocio propio de abarrotes, se dividen el tiempo para atender  la tiendita , ellos están solicitando este crédito para  invertir en mercancía y asi atraer a mas clientela.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio works for a brick manufacturer. He and his wife also run their own grocery store, and each takes turns staffing the small shop. They are seeking a loan to buy merchandise for their store in order to attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es:
Maria Leticia se inicio en los negocios cuando tenía 20 años de edad.  Ella estudio corte y confección y cuando empezó su negocio solo tenia un capital de Q.500.00, con ese dinero compro telas para hacer trabajos de costuras para las personas que Vivian cerca de su casa.

Ahora esta casada, tienes 2 hijos, y además de su negocio de fabricar cortinas y sabanas vende oro, dándolo al crédito a sus clientes.

Sus hijos están estudiando, y su deseo es darles todo lo que ellos necesitan para completar sus estudios.

Este préstamo lo necesita para invertir en la compra de telas, ya que cuenta con varios pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Leticia started her first business when she was 20 years old. She studied dressmaking, and when she started her business she only had capital of Q.500.00. With this money she bought fabric to sew items for the people in her neighbourhood. She is now married and has two children, and in addition to her business making curtains and sheets she also sells gold, offering credit to her customers. Her children are studying, and she wishes to give them everything that they need to complete their studies. She will use this loan to buy fabric, as she has several orders from customers.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for sewing orders

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
Benjamín L. vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos en la calle Nueva America de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz, la actividad que el realiza es la compra de obras de arte de pintores famosos las cuales las restaura y las vende a mayor precio de esta manera genera sus ingresos y puede mantener a su familia, trabaja con museos y personas que coleccionan pinturas coloniales, el crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital ya que las obras de arte son caras.

No es cliente de Impro, pero por la actividad califica para obtener un crédito
texts.en:
Benjamín L. lives with his wife and two children in the city of La Paz. He buys paintings from famous painters, then restores the works of art and sells them for a profit. This is how he earns enough money to maintain his family. He works with museums and people who collect colonial art. The loan that he is requesting will be used as business capital because the paintings are expensive.

He does not have a history with Impro, but his business activity qualifies him to request a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase business capital

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario C. vive con su esposa y su hijo en la calle 7 de agosto de la zona de Tacagua de La ciudad de La Paz se dedica a la confección de traje de caballeros, con esta actividad el mantiene a su familia, no percibe ningún otro ingresos mas, el crédito que solicita es para comprar material para atender a sus clientes y de esta manera mantener su fuente de trabajo.

El señor fue cliente de Impro y pago muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo credito.
texts.en:
Mario C. lives with his wife and son in the city of La Paz. He makes men’s suits for a living. Hhe supports his family with this business, but it is his sole source of income. He needs this loan in order to purchase fabric so that he can better serve his customers and, in so doing, keep his job. Mr. C. was a previous client of Impro. He made his payments on time, which means he can request a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel Q. es comerciante de carne de res y tiene una tienda de abarrotes, trabaja con su esposa e hijos. Toda la familia colabora para que el negocio pueda generar recursos económicos para la manutención de la familia, tiene su casa propia ubicado en la zona Villa Ingenio ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de mercadería, de esa forma podrá surtir con diferentes productos para satisfacer a su clientela.
 
Es el sexto crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró con nuestra institución le permite acceder a otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Miguel Q. is a beef vendor and runs a general store. He works alongside his wife and children. The whole family collaborates so that the business can generate financial resources to cover the household expenses. He has his own house, which is located in the Villa Ingenio area of the city of El Alto.

The loan will be used to purchase merchandise so that he can restock his shop with a variety of products to meet customer demand.

This is his sixth loan with Impro. His excellent repayment history with the institute qualifies him to request another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca se dedica a la elaboración de cómales, venta de leña para cocinas y a la siembra de maíz y fríjol.  Ella tiene un hijo.  Por el momento no cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposo, debido que a que el se encuentra en el extranjero y no tiene trabajo todavía.  El sueño de ella es salir adelante con su hijo.

Necesita su préstamo para comprar materiales y comprar leña, en esta época es cuando mas venden los comales, y ya tiene varios pedidos de sus clientes. Ella esta agradecida con Dios porque tiene trabajo porque le puede dar a su hijo todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Rebeca works making 'cómales' (flat earthenware pans for cooking tortilla), selling firewood for cooking, and growing corn and beans. She has one son. She does not currently receive any economic support from her husband, as he is outside the country and has not yet found work. Her dream is to build a better life for her and her son. She is seeking a loan to buy raw material for making cómales and to buy firewood. At this time of year cómales are in high demand, and she already has several orders from her customers. Rebeca is grateful to God because she has work and is able to provide her son with everything he needs.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making cómales, and to buy firewood and corn

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.es: Rosalinda se dedica a la compra y venta de cómales por mayor, también ella los fabrica. Ella  También se dedican a la siembra de maíz y frijol, y luego lo venden por quintal o por libra.  Ella necesita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra mas cómales ya que tiene demasiados pedidos de sus clientes.  Ella viaja para vender sus productos y esta es una buena temporada porque aprovecha para comprarlos por mayor y almacenarlos para tener en existencia.  Su sueño es crecer y mejorar su  negocio, ya que tiene dos hijos que tiene que mantener, y por eso quiere mejorar su situación economica para que su familia este bien.
texts.en:
Rosalinda works buying and selling 'cómales' (flat earthenware pans for cooking tortilla) in bulk, and she also manufactures cómales. Additionally she grows corn and beans, which she later sells by the quintal (approximately 100 pounds) or by the pound. She is seeking a loan to buy more cómales, as she already has many orders from her customers. She travels to sell her products, and now is a good time of year for her to buy in bulk and build up her stock of merchandise. Her dream is to grow and improve her business, as she now has two children to support, and for this reason she wants to improve her economic situation so that her family is well provided for.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Agne Luis

texts.es:
El Joven de Nombre Agne Luis Berríos R. tiene la edad de 29 años, su estado civil es casado, este Joven tiene 2 hijas sus edades son las siguientes una niña de 7 años que cursa el 1 grado de primaria su hija menor de 2 años y todavía no estudia, su compañera de vida labora en la empresa Arnecom, sus propósitos son de poseer un excelente negocio ya que hay mucho personas que desean entrar a este negocio pero no saben llevara cabo la buena administración, sus sueños son de sacar adelante a su familia para sobrellevar la situación que cada día es mas difícil ya que tiene la responsabilidad de ofrecerles a sus hijas lo que necesitan, sus deseos son de poseer una casa propia ya que en la que habitan actualmente es de su suegra y le dejaría la casa de patrimonio a sus hijas para que no tengan dificultades para el día de mañana.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general como: shorts, camisas, ropa interior y pantalones, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 3 años, el Joven Agne inicia con otro tipo de negocio ya que trabaja en una librería por lo que con lo poco que le quedaba de su salario quería obtener otra fuente de ingreso por lo que pensó en la comprar mas mercadería ya que así empezaría esta nueva fuente de ingresos por lo que decide invertir una parte de su capital en su nuevo negocio por lo que empezó distribuyendo su mercadería los fines de semanas ya que su horario de trabajo es de lunes a viernes por lo que sus clientes empezaron a ser sus amistades y mas tarde consigue a otros amigos quienes le solicitaban encargo de sus productos y con el apoyo de su esposa quien le ayudo a distribuir la mercadería a sus amistades por lo que consiguieron la venta al crédito y al contado y así obtener un poco mas de ingresos, por lo que el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de ropa de mejor calidad y también le gustaría realizar la compra de cosméticos y le gustaría que la Fundación León 2000 como las organizaciones amigas le brinden ayuda.
texts.en:
Agne Luis Berríos R. is 29 years old and married. He has two daughters, a seven year old who is in the first grade of primary school and a two year old. His wife works for a company called Arnecom. His goals are to run an excellent business, as there are many people who wish to enter into his field of work but who don't know much about good management. His dreams are to build a better life for his family and overcome their current situation, which is more challenging each day as he is responsible for providing his daughters with everything they need. He also dreams of owning his own home, as his family currently lives with his mother-in-law. He would then be able to leave the house to his daughters in the future. He works selling a range of goods including shorts, shirts, underwear and trousers. He has run this business for three years. He started out in a different line of work in a bookstore, however his salary was very low and he wanted another source of income. He decided to invest some of his capital in a new business, and started out selling his merchandise on the weekends, as he worked in the bookstore during the week. His customers became his friends, and later he made more friends who placed orders for his products. His wife assisted him in distributing merchandise, making sales both on credit and for cash. In such a way he has been able to bring in a little more income. The loan is for working capital, which he will use to buy better quality clothing. He would also like to purchase cosmetics. He appreciates the help offered by Fundación León 2000 and its partners.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yomaira Paola

texts.es:
Yomaira es socia del Banco Comunal Lila.
Yomaira es soltera, tiene 22 años y vive con sus padres, Yomaira junto a sus padres tienen una pequeña panadería en su casa en donde elaboran panes típicos, como la chapla, wawa, sus productos los comercializan en el mercado central y también en la puerta del horno. Además Yomaira esta estudiando enfermería en la universidad.
Yomaira necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina y manteca.
Yomaira sueña con terminar su carrera y ser profesional y tener otro negocio.
texts.en:
Yomaira is a member of the Lila community bank. Yomaira is single, 22 years old and lives with her parents. Yomaira and her parents own a small bakery which they run from their home and bake typical breads such as "chapla" and "wawa". They sell their goods in the main market as well as fresh from the oven. Yomaira is also studying nursing at university. Yomaira needs a loan of 2,000 soles to buy flour and butter. Yomaira dreams of finishing her studies so that she can be a nurse as well as open another business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour and butter for her bakery.

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es:
En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino el señor Carlos B. se dedica a atender su negocio de pulpería el cual posee en su casa de habitación donde es visitado por los clientes y donde se ha desarrollado en la comercialización de dichos productos.

Es importante destacar que él es un caballero casado y con la responsabilidad de mantener su hogar compuesto por sus tres hijos. La razón por la cual hoy en día él ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito y de esta forma salir adelante en su negocio de pulpería que tiene la necesidad de mejorar.
texts.en:
In the town of Ciudad Sandino, Carlos B. attends to his convenience store which he runs from his home. His customers come to him and he sells a variety of goods. It is noteworthy that he is a married man and is responsible for supporting his household made up of his three sons. He has approached Ceprodel to ask for a loan so that he can better his store which needs improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods for his convenience store.

loans.name: Yovany

texts.es:
Yovany es socia del Banco Comunal Lila.
Yovany es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 2 hijas, Yovany es panificadora se dedica a elaborar panes típicos de la zona como wawa, panes al huevo, en un horno alquilado, sus panes los vende de manera ambulatoriamente y también a través de pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.
Yovany necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina, mantequilla.
Los sueños de Yovany son terminar de construir su casa, brindarles toda las comodidades a sus hijas y que sus hijas sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Yovany is a member of the Lila Microfinance Institute. Yovany is a 35-year-old mother with 2 children and a live-in partner. She is a baker who makes regional breads, such as wawa bread (wheat bread eaten to celebrate the day of the dead) and egg bread, in a rented oven. She sells her bread as a street vendor, as well as by order. Yovany needs a loan of 1,400.00 PEN, which will be invested in purchasing flour and butter. Yovany dreams of finishing construction on her house, offering her daughter all the comforts available, and watching them become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour and butter

loans.name: Reginalda

texts.es: Reginalda se dedica a la elaboración de cómales, y a la siembra de tomate, también vende leña para cocinar. Tiene 9 hijos, 5 de ellos están con ella los otros cuatro ya están casados, viven en la misma casa las esposas de sus hijos, y le ayudan a la elaboración de los cómales.
