También vende maíz y fríjol, y por necesidad se dedica a todo tipo de negocio que le salga. Necesita su Préstamo para poder comprar mas material para los cómales y semilla de tomate, y su deseo es poder mejorar en su situación económica familiar, ella es muy trabajadora y confía en que con este capital podrá tener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Reginalda makes clay griddles, grows tomatoes, and sells cooking wood for a living. She has 9 children, 5 of whom live with her. The other 4 are already married, but they and their spouses in live her house, so they help her to make the clay griddles. She also sells corn and beans, and does any type of business that she can out of necessity. She needs a loan in order to purchase tomato seeds and more materials to make the griddles. Her wish is to be able to improve her family’s financial situation. She is a very hard-working woman, and she trusts that she will increase her profits with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make clay griddles, and invest in tomato and corn crops

loans.name: Alejandro Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano es socio del Banco Comunal Lila.
Mariano es casado, tiene 54 años y 2 hijos, Mariano vende jugo de naranja que el mismo prepara en una carretilla de manera ambulatoria en una avenida concurrida, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Mariano brinda servicio de preparación de comida para diferentes eventos, compromisos.
Mariano necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de naranjas y compra de una maquina de hacer jugo.
Los sueños de Mariano son tener un terreno, construir su casa y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mariano is a member of the Lila Microfinance Institute. Mariano is a 54-year-old married father with 2 children. He sells orange juice which he prepares daily from his cart as a street vendor on a busy avenue. He also offers catering services for different types of events.

Mariano needs a loan of 1,600.00 PEN, which will be invested in purchasing oranges and a juicer.

Mariano dreams of purchasing a plot of land, building a house, and improving his business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase oranges and a juicer

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia es socia del Banco Comunal Lila.
Aurelia es casada, tiene 34 años y 7 hijos, Aurelia vende leña en su casa que adquiere de los productores que le traen a su domicilio. Además Aurelia los días sábados y domingos viaja a las ferias en donde vende ropa.
Aurelia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña, chompas, faldas, mandiles.
Los sueños de Aurelia son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Aurelia is a member of Communal Bank Lila. Aurelia is married, is 34 years old, and has 7 children. Aurelia sells firewood in her home, which she acquires from producers who bring it to her residence. Additionally, on Saturdays and Sundays Aurelia travels to regional markets where she sells clothing. Aurelia needs a loan of 2000 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of firewood, sweaters, skirts, and aprons. Aurelia’s dream is that her children finish their studies and hopes to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase firewood, sweaters, skirts, and aprons.

loans.name: Luis Andres

texts.es:
Luis Andrés Cáceres M. tiene la edad de 33 años su estado civil es casado, Luis tiene 3 hijos sus edades son de las siguientes su hijo mayor de 14 años cursa el 2 año de secundaria su otro hijo de 13 años cursa el 1 año de secundaria y su hijo menor de 10 años cursa el 6 grado de primaria, su compañera de vida labora por cuenta propia, sus propósitos son de darle mas inversión a su negocio por lo que sus principales clientes son los niños, los deseos de Don Luis de garantizar a sus hijos una estabilidad económica ya que la situación que tenemos recientemente esta muy difícil pero el ha  sido una persona quien ha luchado para ganarse el pande cada día de cualquier manera, los sueños de Don Luis son de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia ya que no le gustaría que sus hijo pasen necesidades y así no tendrían problemas económicos y sus hijos obtendrían una mejor educación ya que le gustaría que sus hijos estudien en el extranjero por lo que la enseñanza es muy buena y sus hijos aprovecharían la oportunidad de estudiar.

La actividad económica de Don Luis es un servicio de video juegos, la ubicación de su negocio en donde fueron los billares 3 ½ al este, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 3 años, Don Luis da inicio por que no tenia trabajo y al verse en la penosa posición de que su esposa estaba pagando las deudas de la casa por lo que el decide establecer un negocio que le brindara ingresos para su familia por lo que decide establecer un servicio de video juegos para sus vecinos que en su mayoría son de niños por lo que esto fue una gran ventaja ya que sus niños jugaban por lo que el aprendió mucho mas rápido el manejo de sus videos juegos y lo que sus clientes solicitaban por lo que empezó en busca de los televisores y lo consiguió con la ayuda de su familia quien lo poyo en esta idea y dio inicio con 2 televisores por lo que sus clientes tenían que esperar que el tiempo se acabara para empezar a jugar por lo que con las pocas ganancias obtenidas logra comprar 2 televisores mas y darle solución a la fuerte demandad que poseía y es así como logra quedarse con este negocio que además le gusto, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo es invertirlo en la compra de equipos y discos para brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luis Andrés Cáceres M. is 33 years old and is married. Luis has three children. His eldest son is 14 years old and is a sophmore in high school, his other son is 13 years old and a freshmen, and his youngest son is 10 and in the sixth grade. His partner is self-employed. His goals are to invest more in his business (most of his customers are children.) Don Luis wants to guarantee economic stability for his children as the recent situation is very difficult. He is a person who has always worked hard to earn a living, doing whatever is necessary to earn his daily bread. Don Luis's dreams are to improve his family's quality of life because he doesn't want to see his children go without necessities. In this way they wouldn't have economic problems and his children would be able to get a better education. He would like his children to study abroad since education is very good and his children would take advantage of the opportunity to study. Don Luis earns a living by providing video game service. It's located where the billiards were 3 1/2 to the east. He's been in business for three years. Don Luis started this because he was out of work and found himself in the shameful position of his wife paying the bills. This is the reason he decided to establish a business that will generate income for his family. He decided to establish video game service for his neighbors, who are mostly children. It was very helpful that his children played [video games]. This helped him learn how to operate video games much faster as well as learning what his customers were asking for. This began as a search for TVs and he got it with the help of his family who supported him and his idea. He began with two TVs, so his customers had to wait until time was up before they could begin playing. With the little bit he has earned, he has been able to buy two more TVs and supply the huge demand. In this way that he has been able to stay in this business that he also enjoys. The funding is for working capital to invest in buying equipment and discs to provide better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase discs and equipement

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther es socia del Banco Comunal Lila.
Esther es viuda, tiene 48 años y 2 hijos, Esther tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende especerías, verduras picadas que ella misma prepara desde muy temprano, también vende verduras. 
Esther necesita un préstamo de 400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de comino, ajo, hongos.
Los sueños de Esther son que sus hijos sean profesionales y que su negocio surja mas.
texts.en:
Esther is a member of the Lila Municipal Bank. Esther is widowed, 48 years old, and has two children. Esther has a stand in the 12 de abril market where she sells spices, chopped vegetables that she herself prepares very early, and also vegetables. Esther needs a loan of 400 soles ($125 USD) that will be invested in purchasing cumin, garlic, and mushrooms. Esther's dreams are that her children be professionals and that her business be further developed.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cumin, garlic, and mushrooms.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es socia del Banco Comunal Lila.
Luisa es casada, tiene 57 años y 6 hijos, Luisa tiene un puesto en el mercado Magdalena en donD. venD. comida, prepara desayunos, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. sus hijos.
Luisa necesita un préstamo D. 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, fideo, azúcar, sal.
Los sueños D. Luisa son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of Banco Comunal Lila. She's 57 years-old, married, and has 6 children. Everyday, Luisa (with the help of her children) operates a stand in the Magdalena market where she sells food and prepares breakfasts. Luisa is requesting a loan of 800 soles ($250 dollars) which she will use to buy rice, noodles, sugar, and salt. Luisa longs to improve her business, with the hope that her children will grow up to enjoy professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, noodles, sugar, and salt

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Lila.
Juana es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 5 hijos, Juana tiene una tienda en una casa alquilada, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos en sus ratos libres.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, fideos, arroz.
Los sueños de Juana son que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliar su negocios, tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the town bank Lila. Juana lives with a common law partner, is 39 years old, and has five children. Juana has a store in a rented house where she sells groceries, vegetables, and fruits. She does this with the help of her children when they have free time. Juana needs a loan of 800 soles that will be invested in the purchase of sugar, noodles, and rice. Juana's dreams are for her children to be professionals and to expand their businesses and have their own homes.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, noodles and rice.

loans.name: Hector Rafael

texts.es:
Héctor Rafael Chamarro Gutiérrez tiene la edad de 20 años, su estado civil es casado este joven Héctor tiene 1 hijo de la edad de 5 años y cursa el 2 grado de primaria, su compañera de vida labora no trabaja, sus propósitos son de mantener su clientela ya que ellos son los que hacen posible que su negocio continúe adelante y para brindarles a ellos la atención necesaria, sus sueños son de consolidar su negocio al punto de tener mayor cobertura ya que sus clientes buscan la mejor tecnología que se les pueda ofrecer y además no todos cumplen con las necesidades que sus clientes piden, sus deseos son de ampliar mas el ciber por que tiene muy pocos equipos y sus clientes se retiran por falta de equipo por lo que no tiene el espacio suficiente para la instalación de mas equipos y así conseguiría  mas ingresos para su familia y podría pagar las deudas contraídas con la institución.

La actividad económica de Héctor es de servicios de ciber, la ubicación de su negocio es de Dilectus ½ cuadra al norte, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 3 años, Héctor da inicio a este negocio por un sueño que quería se cumpliera ya que cuando empezó su mayor sueño era independizarse son su propio negocio y empezó a relacionarse con amigos que ya tenían cierta experiencia con este tipo de negocio y un amigo le brindo la oportunidad de trabajar en su ciber mientras el guardaba lo que podía de sus ganancias y poco a poco fue trabajando hasta lograr comprar una computadora y la otra la consigue por amigo quien se la vendió en un precio favorable por lo que mas tarde decide realizar otra compra de computadora obteniendo así 3 computadoras y trabajaba con 2 computadoras por lo que al empezar le fue muy difícil ya que la compra de cada una era muy elevada pero al ver los frutos de su ciber que fueron muy pocos consiguió otra computadora y se hicieron 3 computadoras mas por lo que mas tarde decide realizar un financiamiento para saldar las cuentas pendientes y desde entonces  empieza a trabajar con Fundación León 2000 por lo que ahora pide un financiamiento para capital de trabajo ya que quiere cambiar los accesorios del ciber, mejoras para sus equipos y la capacidad de la resolución de sus programas por lo que le gustaría que su financiamiento pudiera lograrse por medio de la Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones que contribuyen para su causa.
texts.en:
Héctor Rafael Chamarro Gutiérrez is 20 years old and married. Young Hectór has a 5-year old son who attends primary school in the 2nd grade. His wife does domestic work but does not have a job. His goals are to maintain his customer base, since they make his success and growth possible, and to offer them essential services. His dreams are to strengthen his business to the point of having better coverage, since his customers seek the best technology offered and, furthermore, not all their needs are met. His wishes are to increase his Internet capabilities because he has limited equipment, and his customers leave for lack of equipment. He does not have sufficient space for the installation of more equipment with which he could bring in a better income for his family and pay his contracted debts with the institution.

Héctor works in Internet services. The location of his business is a half block north of Dilectus. He has run his business for three years. Héctor started his business because it was his dream, along with his bigger dream to become independent with his business. He started off by making acquaintances with others who have experience in the business. One of his friends offered him the opportunity to work in his Internet café while saving what he could of his pay, and little by little he earned enough to buy a computer. He then bought another computer from a friend at a good price because, to obtain three computers later on, he would sell him another. Starting off with two computers was very difficult because the cost of each computer was high, but seeing that the profits from his Internet café were very low, he acquired another computer to make three computers. He decided to look into loan options to pay off outstanding accounts. Since this time he has worked with the Fundación León 2000. Now he is requesting a loan to invest in his business. He would like to add Internet accessories and improve his equipment and the resolution of his programs. He would be pleased to work with the Fundación León 2000, and the organizations that contribute to its cause, to be able to make this investment.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Investment

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carmen Gabriela

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Lila.
Carmen es soltera, tiene 20 años y vive con sus padres, Carmen vende ropa de bebe en las ferias de la región, actividad que realiza junto a su mama, la ropa los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Carmen además esta preparándose para ingresar a la universidad desea estudiar Derecho.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de uniformes para la campaña escolar.
Los sueños de Carmen son ayudar a sus padres, estudiar cocina y ser profesional.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Communal Bank Lila. Carmen is single, is 20 years old, and lives with her parents. Carmen sells baby clothing at regional markets, an activity that she carries out with her mother. She acquires the clothing in the city of Lima. Carmen is also getting ready to being University and wishes to study Law. Carmen needs a loan of 800 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of uniforms for the school year. Carmen’s dreams are to help her parents, study cooking, and to become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase uniforms for the school year.

loans.name: Luz Marleni

texts.es:
Luz es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.
Luz es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 4 hijos, Luz vende artículos de limpieza, como escobas, ambientadores, sus ventas los realiza al por mayor a las tiendas y al crédito, diariamente se dedica a la cobranza.
Luz necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de escobas.
Los sueños de Luz son comprar una casa y establecerse en una tienda.
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the Communal Bank Buena Suerte (‘Good Luck’). Luz lives with her partner, is 28 years old, and has 4 children. Luz sells cleaning supplies, such as brooms and air freshners. Her sales are carried out wholesale to stores and on credit, and she daily dedicates herself to the collection payments. Luz needs a loan of 2,000 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of brooms. Luz’ dreams are to purchase a house and to become established in a store.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase brooms.

loans.name: Nancy Reyna

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.
Nancy es casada, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Nancy tiene un molino de granos en su casa en donde brinda servicios de molido, también Nancy compra cereales de las feriantes que le llevan a su domicilio, los cuales los procesa y los vende en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, cebada, arveja.
Los sueños de Nancy son tener una ferretería y comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Community Bank "Buena Suerte" (meaning Good Luck).

Nancy is married, she is 39 years old and she has 2 children. Nancy owns a grain mill in her home where she provides milling services. Nancy also purchases cereals from vendors that come to her home, and then processes them and sells them in the different markets in the city.

Nancy requires a loan in the amount of 3000 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of wheat, grain, and sweet pees. Nancy's dream is to set up a hardware store and to purchase a car.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wheat, grain, and sweet peas.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.
Alicia es casada, tiene 52 años y 2 hijos, Alicia tiene un puesto en el mercado Magdalena en donde vende abarrotes, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Alicia tiene un pequeño taller en su casa en donde realiza confecciones y composturas de prendas.
Alicia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de aceite, azúcar, menestras.
Alicia sueña con mejorar su casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the Buena Suerte Communal Bank. She is married, has 2 children, and is 52 years old. Alicia has a stall in the Magdalena market where she sells groceries, a daily activity. Alicia also has a small workshop in her house where makes and repairs clothing. Alicia needs a loan of 1000 soles which will be invested in the purchase of oil, sugar, and legumes. She dreams of improving her home and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase oil, sugar, and legumes for resale

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es:
Zonia es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.
Zonia es viuda, tiene 62 años y 7 hijos, Zonia venD. cosméticos por catálogos D. 2 líneas diferentes, también venD. lencería por catálogos, ropa variada que adquiere en la ciudad D. Lima, sus ventas son al crédito. Además Zonia tiene un taller D. confecciones D. prendas D. vestir en su casa.
Zonia necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cremas, perfumes y telas para la campaña escolar.
Los sueños D. Zonia son que sus 2 ultimas hijas culminen sus estudios, mejorar sus negocios y seguir apoyando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Zonia is a partner of the "Banco Comunal Buena Suerte" (Community Bank of 'Good Fortune'). Zonia is a widow, 62 years old and has seven children. Zonia sells cosmetics from catalogs of two different lines; she also sells lingerie from catalogs and various clothing that she gets from the city of Lima. Also, Zonia has a tailoring and dressmaking studio in her home. Zonia needs a loan of 3000 soles (monetary unit of Peru) that will be invested in lotions, perfumes and fabrics for her school-age line of products. Zonia's dream is to have her two last children finish their studies, improve her business and continue to support her children.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lotions, perfume and fabrics.

loans.name: Sandra Alina

texts.es:
Sandra es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.
Sandra es casada, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Sandra vende cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos, familiares, sus ventas son al crédito. Además Sandra junto a su esposo venden peces ornamentales, accesorios de peceras, entre otros productos. Sandra en sus tiempos libres hace peluches.
Sandra necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas para peluches.
Los sueños de Sandra son salir adelante y seguir ahorrando para el estudio superior de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the communal bank "Buena Suerte" (Good Luck). Sandra is married and has two children. She is 42 years old. Sandra sells cosmetic products through catalogues. She offers her products to friends and family members. Her customers pay her when they receive the product and sometime they make payments for the products. Sandra and her husband also sell ornamental fish, accessories for fish tanks and other related products. In her free time Sandra makes stuffed animals. Sandra needs a loan of 1,250 Soles which will be invested in the purchase of fabric to make stuffed animals. Sandra's dreams are to work hard, to get ahead, and to continue saving money for her children's high school and university educations.

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics to make stuffed animals

loans.name: Juan Filiberto

texts.es:
Juan Filiberto C. M. tiene la edad de 61 años, su estado civil es soltero, Don Juan tiene 8 hijos, sus hijos tienen las edades de 30 años y trabaja por cuenta propia su otro hijo de 26 años de edad no estudia su hijo de 24 años de edad trabaja por cuenta propia su hija de 21 años cursa el 2 año de su carrera su otro hijo de 20 años cursa el 3 año de su carrera su hija de 17 años cursa el 5 año de secundaria y su otra hija de15 años cursa 4 grado de secundaria y su hijo menor de 10 años de edad cursa el 4 grado de primaria, su compañera de vida labora como cuenta propia, su propósito es mantener el curso de su negocio, y si en su poder esta, incrementar mas su clientela para invertir en su tramo ofreciéndole al publico variedades de productos y de esta manera incrementar sus ventas e ingreso para su familia, su sueño es que sus hijos puedan mantenerse por si solos para que puedan enfrentar las situaciones que se les presente sus deseos son de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia por lo que la situación es en país esta cada ves mas difícil pero tiene que cumplir con la responsabilidad de llevar el pan de cada día a su familia.

La actividad económica es la venta de granos básicos como: arroz, aceite, frijoles, azúcar y sopas, la ubicación de su negocio es el Mercado Central, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 12 años, Don Filiberto inicio esta actividad por su esposa ya que se dio con el objetivo de apoyar a su esposa con los gastos de la familia por lo que decide establecer su negocio es el mercado por lo que fue muy difícil ya que tenia que conseguir el local para su negocio y fue por medio de un amigo que logro por lo cual este le facilito el lugar y dio inicio a este negocio poco a poco por lo que decide vender productos como: arroz y frijoles ya que no contaba con dinero suficiente para abastecerse con  mas mercadería y con lo que recogía de sus ganancias  y mas tarde ya ofrece los productos de arroz, aceite, frijoles, azúcar y avena por lo que al paso del tiempo fue logrando cada uno de sus objetivos, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que necesita realizar la compra de mas productos para la variedad de clientes que necesitan de los granos básicos.
texts.en:
Juan Filiberto C. M. is 61 years old and he is single. Don Juan has 8 children. One of his children is 30 years old and works for himself, another is 26 years old and he does not go to school, another is 24 years old and he works for himself. His 21 year old daughter is in her second year of university studies, and his 20 year old son is in his third year of university studies. His 17 year-old is in the fifth year of secondary school, and his 15 year-old daughter is in her fourth year of secondary school. Don Juan's youngest son is 10 years old and is in fourth grade. His wife also works for herself.

Juan's objective is to continue to grow his business and to expand his customer base. He would like to invest in increasing his inventory so that he can offer his customers a greater variety of products. His goal is to increase his sales and income so that he can better provide for his family. His dream is that his children will be able to support themselves so that they can effectively deal with all situations that life throws at them. He also dreams of a better quality of life for his family, in spite of the fact that the economic situation in his country continues to decline. However, no matter how hard the economic situation is, Juan must meet his responsibility to put food on the table for his family each and every day.

Don Juan works by selling food staples like rice, oil, beans, sugar and soups. His business is located in the Central Market and he has owned his business for the past 12 years. Don Juan started his business for his wife with the objective that he would be able to help her to support the family. He decided to establish his business in the market even though it was very difficult to get the space. A friend was able to help him to secure the space and little by little he began to sell products like rice and beans, since he did not have enough money to stock his space with more merchandise. As he began saving up his profits, his was able to buy and sell more products like oil, sugar and oatmeal. As time has gone by, Juan has been able to achieve his goal of making money to support his family. The financing that Juan is requesting is so that he can invest capital in his business since he needs to buy more products for the his customers that need basic grains.

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for Business

loans.name: Hugo Danilo

texts.es: El Sr. Hugo tiene la edad de 56 años, se dedica a la carpintería desde hace doce años, negocio que inicio con ahorro de su trabajo anterior, que era la construcción, un trabajo cansado pero se gana bien, , don Hugo reside en Memorial Sandino, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 12 y 14 años de edad, que estudian la primaria en el colegio del barrio, sus planes es poder terminar de construir su casa ya que es la mitad de piedra y tabla es un poco insegura, con esta solicitud va invertir en materiales de construcción para construir las paredes de concreto y poder ofrecer una casa digna a su familia, esta es su cuarta solicitud en Afodenic y han sido de muchos beneficios para su familia ya que ha podido poco a poco  lograr sus metas, lo cual espera seguir trabajando para cada día mejorar las condiciones de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Hugo is 56 years old. He has worked in carpentry for twelve years. He started his business with savings from his former job, which was in construction, a job which was exhausting but paid well. Mr. Hugo lives in Memorial Sandino with his wife and two children, who are 12 and 14 years old and attend the local primary school. Their plan is to try to finish the construction of their house, which is already half built out of stone. Lumber is not very strong, so with this loan Mr. Hugo will invest in construction materials so that he can build concrete walls and be able to offer his family a dignified place to live. This is his fourth loan from Afodenic, and the loans have greatly benefited his family because little by little they have been able to achieve their goals. He hopes to continue working so that each day he can improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for his home

loans.name: Delia Sabina

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.
Delia es viuda, tiene 64 años y 3 hijos, Delia compra y vende cuy, viaja a las ferias de la región en donde compra cuy y también compra de las feriantes que le llevan a su domicilio, Delia vende los cuy en 3 presentaciones, vivo, beneficiado y ya preparado, dependiendo del pedido de sus clientes.
Delia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cuy.
Los sueños de Delia son que su salud se mejore, ampliar su negocio y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the Banco Comunal Buena Suerte (Communal Bank of Good Luck). She is a widow who is 64 years old and has three children. Delia buys and sells guinea pigs. She travels to the local markets where she buys guinea pig from the vendors and then takes it to her home to prepare. Delia sells the guinea pig in three different ways: live, as raw meat, or cooked, depending on what her clients request. Delia needs a loan of 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of guinea pig. Delia's dreams are that her health will improve, her business will grow, and she will be able to continue onward.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the sale of guinea pig

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es: Maria Angélica a la edad de 8 años, siendo una niña tuvo la iniciativa de ayudar a su abuela a la preparación de comida, que era el negocio que ella tenia, luego la ayudo a vender en el mercado la  variedad de comida que la abuela preparaba, después de un tiempo Angélica colaboraba a despachar la comida en bolsitas a las personas compradoras en el mercado local de Sumpango, al pasar varios años la abuela le dio la oportunidad de compartir las ventas dándole tres días a la semana para que vendiera la comida, esto  le ayudo a tener experiencia en las ventas de las comidas.  Con el tiempo su abuela ya no pudo continuar con el negocio de venta de comida y le dejo el negocio a Angélica, lo cual le dio la oportunidad de cambiar los tipos de comidas para obtener mas ganancias y es así como Angélica se hizo responsable por el negocio.  Ahora ella trabaja por su propia cuenta, y por eso necesita un préstamo para comprar mercadería por cantidades grandes  a un precio cómodo, y lograr de esta manera mejores ganancias.  Su deseo es ampliar su negocio para ser de apoyo a su familia y colaborar en las necesidades como lo es el sustento diario.
texts.en:
Maria Angélica, as a little girl, took the initiative at the age of eight to help her grandmother in the preparation of food, which was her grandmother's business. Later she helped her grandmother at the market sell the variety of food that she prepared. After a time, Angélica worked with her grandmother to sell the food in little bags to the shoppers in the local market of Sumpango. After several years, her grandmother gave her the opportunity to share the sales giving her three days each week to sell the food, which helped her gain experience in food sales. Eventually, her grandmother was not able to continue with the business of food sales and left the business to Angélica, which gave her the opportunity to take responsibility for the business and change the types of food sold to obtain more earnings. Now she works on her own budget, which is why she needs a loan to buy merchandise in large quantities at an agreeable price, and in this way make greater earnings. Her desire is to increase her business to support her family and help meet the daily needs of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for her business in food sales.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa Trabajemos en quechua.
Paulina es viuda, tiene 37 años y 5 hijos, Paulina vive en la selva ayacuchana, en la localidad de Monterrico en donde tiene una tienda de abarrotes en general, Paulina viaja cada 15 días a Ayacucho a realizar sus compras.
Paulina necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas.
Los sueños de Paulina son equipar con todo los artefactos su casa y mejora su negocio.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Llamkasum Communal Bank, which means "Let´s Work" in Quechua. Paulina is a widow, 37 years old and has 5 children. She lives in the forest zone of Ayacucho, in a place called Monterrico, where she has a general store. Paulina travels every 15 days to Ayacucho to make purchases. She needs a loan for 600 soles which will be used to buy soft drinks. Paulina dreams of equipping her home with all types of appliances and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks.

loans.name: Katty

texts.es:
Katy es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa Trabajemos en quechua.
Katy es soltera, tiene 19 años y 1 hijo, Katy vive en la selva ayacuchana en la localidad de Monterrico, tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras y además es un pequeño bar .
Katy necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de verduras.
Los sueños de Katy son comprar un terreno y comprar una lavadora.
texts.en:
Katy is a member of the Llamkasum communal bank, which works in the quechua language. Katy is single, 19 years old and has a son. Katy lives in the Ayacuchana jungle in the municipality of Monterrico, where she has a store in her house in which she sells groceries, vegetables and also functions as a small bar. Katy needs a loan of 600 Soles which will be invested in the purchase of vegetables. Katy's dreams are to purchase land and a washing machine.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Ricardo Rodolfo

texts.es: Don Ricardo tiene 23 años de edad, habita en  memorial sandino, su esposa le tiene una hija de 1 años de edad, el joven Ricardo tiene dos años de laborar como técnico de bodega y facturador de pedidos, lo cual inicio como ayudante de bodega, y por su experiencia lo promovieron, lo cual es un logro no solo en lo personal si no que económicamente le subieron su salario que es de mucho ya que sus metas es poder tener su casa propia para su familia, con sus ahorro tiene una parte de materiales comprados, y con esta solicitud de préstamo en Afodenic va invertir en mas materiales de construcción para hacer la sala de su casa. Sus planes es poder tener estabilidad económica y social, laborar, para poder seguir ahorrando y con los préstamos terminar de hacer su casa.
texts.en:
Don Ricardo is 23 years old, lives in Memorial Sandino and has a 1-year old daughter with his wife. Young Ricardo has 2 years experience working as warehouse technician and order billing. He started off as warehouse assistant and because of his experience, he was promoted, something that is not only a personal accomplishment, but also a financial one. His pay was increased, which is big since his goal is to have a home for his family. With his savings he’s been able to purchase part of the building materials, and with this loan from Afodenic he will invest in more so he can build the living room for his home. His plans are to have economic and social stability, and to work so he can keep saving and with his loans, finish building his home.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials to build the living room for his home

loans.name: Lidia Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa Trabajemos en quechua.
Sonia es casada, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Sonia vende ropa como buzos de polar que vende al por mayor y reparte a las tiendas, puestos de mercados, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Tacna, sus ventas también lo realiza en otros departamentos. Además Sonia tiene cabinas de Internet en su casa y esta administrado por su hija.
Sonia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantallas de computadora.
Los sueños de Sonia son construir su casa de material noble e implementar una tienda de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Llamkasum communal bank, which works in the Quechua language. Sonia is married, 36 years old and has 4 children. Sonia sells clothign such as track suits that she sells at the wholesale level and distributes to stores and booths in markets. She acquires her products in the city of Tacna and sells in other areas. Sonia also has Internet booths in her house and these are managed by her daughter. Sonia needs a loan of 1500 Soles, which will be invested in the purchase of computer monitors. Sonia's dreams are to build a sturdy house and set up a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of computer monitors

loans.name: Lucrecia Clementina

texts.es:
Lucrecia Clementina Q. tiene la edad de 48 años, su estado civil es soltera, el estado civil de Doña Lucrecia es soltera, Doña Lucrecia tiene 2 hijos sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 18 años cursa el 1 año de su carrera y su hijo menor de 15 años cursa el 4 año de secundaria, sus propósitos son de seguir manteniendo la fuente de trabajo y así seguir la educación necesaria a sus hijos, sus deseos son de proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda para que sus hijos puedan disfrutar de las condiciones necesarias además el día de mañana podrán vivir con sus familias futuras y así puedan conservar su casa para las generaciones futuras, sus sueños son que sus hijos puedan finalizar sus estudios para que sean unos profesionales y aprovechen la oportunidad de estudiar ya que no todos los jóvenes pueden hacerlo por que sus padres no poseen el dinero suficiente.

La actividad económica a la que Doña Lucrecia se dedica es la venta de refrescos naturales, chancho con yuca, artículos desechables y bolsas plásticas, la ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 10 años, Doña Lucrecia dio inicio a su negocio por su necesidad ya que no contaba con un trabajo y su compañero de vida había dejado de trabajar y no tenían ningún ingreso para la familia, además sus niños estaban pequeños y ella no permitiría que ellos sufrieran hambre por no tener el pan de cada día, por lo tanto Doña Lucrecia se lleno de valor y decidió emprender este negocio en el que hasta hoy le ha ido bien, aun sin la ayuda de su esposo, Doña Lucrecia se siente una persona independiente y capaz de mantener su hogar, la utilización que le dará Doña Lucrecia al financiamiento, es para capital de trabajo y de esta manera invertir en el negocio comprando mas mercadería que sus clientes le están solicitando como: vasos, cucharas, platos , bolsas, entre otro tipo de inventario.
texts.en:
Lucrecia Clementina Q. is 48 years old, and her marital status is single. Doña Lucrecia has 2 sons; her eldest son is 18 and is in his first year of college and her youngest son is 15 and in the 4th year of secondary school. Her goal is to maintain her source of income so that her sons may continue their studies. Her wish is to make improvements to her home so they can enjoy proper living conditions, as well as live there with their own families so the house can be handed down to future generations. Her dream is that her sons complete their education so they can become professionals and take advantage of the opportunity they have to study, something not all young people are able to do so, since their parents don’t have enough money. Doña Lucrecia’s business is selling natural sodas, chancho (pork) with yucca, disposable items & plastic bags. The business is mobile, and she’s had it for 10 years. Doña Lucrecia began her business out of need, since she did not have a job, her domestic partner had stopped working, and they did not have any income. Her children were young and she would not allow them to go hungry for lack of daily bread, so Doña Lucrecia filled with courage and decided to start this business that, to this day, has done so well. Despite having no help from her husband, Doña Lucrecia feels herself to be an independent person, capable of maintaining her home. Doña Lucrecia will use this loan as working capital, investing in her business by purchasing merchandise her customers have been requesting, such as cups, spoons, plates, bags, and other types of inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa Trabajemos en quechua.
Claudia es casada, tiene 34 años y 4 hijos, Claudia es panificadora, elabora panes típicos de la zona como chapla, actividad que realiza en un horno alquilado, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado Santa Clara de manera ambulatoria.
Claudia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina por sacos.
Los sueños de Claudia son sacar adelante a sus hijos que sean profesionales, tener una buena casa y agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Claudia is a member of the Communal Bank Llamkasum, which means "Let's Work" in Quechua. She is 34 years old, married, and has 4 children. Claudia is a bread baker who makes bread typical to the area, such as chapla. She bakes in a rented oven, and sells in the Santa Clara market. Claudia needs a loan of 1050 soles which she will use to purchase sacks of flour. Claudia dreams of helping her children get ahead so they become professionals, having a good home, and growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of flour

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: Don Leonardo es guarda de seguridad desde hace tres años, también recibe una pensión debido a un accidente laborar, su esposa es ama de casa sus dos hijos son mayor de edad, y viven independiente, el sr. Leonardo tiene 48 años de edad, reside en el Jonathan González ayuda a dos nietos que tiene, con mucho esfuerzo y la oportunidad que    Afodenic le apoyado con brindarle prestamos a ido terminando su casa, con este préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción para poder poner el techo a su porche a si como las puerta que son inseguras. Sus metas personales es poder cambiar de trabajo para ganar más y apoyar  a su familia con los ingresos.
texts.en:
Leonardo has been a security guard for three years. He also receives a pension due to a workplace accident. His wife is a homemaker, and his two children are grown and live independently. Leonardo is 48 years old. He lives in Jonathan González and helps his two grandchildren. With great effort and the opportunity and support that AFODENIC has provided to him through loans, he has been finishing his house. With this loan he wants to purchase construction materials to put a roof over his porch and replace doors which are unsafe. His personal goals are to change jobs to earn more and to support his family with his income.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to put a roof on his porch and replace doors

loans.name: Maria Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa Trabajemos en quechua.
Carmela es casada, tiene 78 años y 6 hijos, Carmela vive en el distrito D. Chiara en donD. tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, además Carmela se dedica a la crianza D. ganado vacuno lechero, los quesos y leche lo venD. en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Carmela necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, fideo.
Los sueños D. Carmela son tener mas ganado, ampliar su establo y darles todo lo mejora a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Carmela is a member of the Llamkasum communal bank, which works in the Quechua language. Carmela is married, 78 years old and has 6 children. Carmela lives in the Chiara districet where she has a grocery store. In addition, Carmela works raising cows and sells their milk and cheese in the Ayacucho. Carmela needs a loan of 1500 Soles, which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar and noodles. Carmela's dreams are to have more cattle, expand her barn and improve the lives of her grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar and noodles

loans.name: Dina Mercedes

texts.es:
Dina es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa Trabajemos en quechua.
Dina es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Dina junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de materiales de construcción como agregados, ladrillos, sus ventas lo realiza en su local y también llevan a domicilio para lo cual cuenta con una movilidad. 
Dina necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago para la compra de un carro pequeño.
Los sueños de Dina son comprar mas carros, ampliar su casa y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dina is a member of the Banco Comunal Llamkasum, which means “Let’s work together” in Quechua.

Dina lives with her husband, is 31 years old and has two children. Dina, together with her husband, sells construction materials such as aggregates and bricks. She sells out of her shop and also has a delivery service for which a vehicle is important.

Dina needs a loan of 2100 soles, which she will invest in part of the cost of a small cart.

Dina dreams to buy more carts, expand her house and educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Part of the cost of a small cart

loans.name: Gustavo Antonio

texts.es: Don Gustavo tiene 53 años de edad, reside en batahola norte trabaja junto con su esposa administrando un pequeño comedor de comida que vende al crédito y al contado, tiene una hija de 17 años de edad, que estudia, este negocio lo inicio cuando tomo mucha experiencia en su trabajo anterior que era en un casino,  ahorro y se puso a trabajar para tener sus propio negocio como ganancias, con este préstamo lo va invertir para comprar materia prima y poder elaborar ricos y variados platillos, y así poder captar clientes y dar un mejor servicios a su clientela. Sus planes a corto plazo es poder remodelar su casa.
texts.en:
Don Gustavo is 53 years old, lives in Batahola Norte (a neighborhood of Managua). He works together with his wife managing a small dining facility with food sold by credit and with cash. He has a 17 year old daughter who studies. This business began when he got a lot of experience at his last job at a casino. He saved up and worked to have his own profitable business. With this loan he will invest in premium material and be able to improve the delicious food and various plates, this way he can pick up more customers and give better services to his clientele. His short term planes are to remodel his house.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat and vegetables to improve his food

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
La sra. Alba Luz reside en villa reconciliación, casada y con tres hijos uno casado, uno que esta trabajando y el mas pequeño estudia, su esposo es mecánico automotriz, ella vende fritanga por las tardes y ropa desde hace trece años ha logrado mantener su negocio que inicio con dinero propio con la venta de ropa, con este crédito va invertir en la compra de mesa y sillas plásticas para atender al cliente en mejores condiciones, y poder ir creciendo con el apoyo que Afodenic le ha otorgado ya que este es su octavo crédito y espera seguir beneficiándose 
Para lograr sus metas, y poder gozar junto con su familia los logros.
texts.en:
Alba Luz lives in Villa Reconciliación, is married and has three children: one is married, one is working and the youngest studies. Her husband is an auto mechanic. For the past three years she has sold fritanga (fried snacks) in the afternoons and clothing. She has managed to keep up the business, which she started with her own money from the sale of clothing. With this loan she is going to invest in a plastic table and chairs to have better conditions in which to serve her customers. With the help of Afodenic she will be able to keep growing. This is her eighth loan and she hopes to continue to do well, reach her goals and enjoy her achievements with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a plastic table and chairs to provide better service at her business.

loans.name: William Alberto

texts.es: Don William  a sus 37 años de edad, ha logrado tener su propio negocio una tienda de venta de ropa y zapatos desde hace doce años, que inicio con ahorro y créditos de Afodenic, con estos préstamos ha podido hacer su negocio, ahora viaja  a los departamentos. Reside en villa reconciliación, su esposa le tiene tres hijos de 8,12 y 17 años de edad, que estudian, ella se desempeña como cajera para ayudar a su esposo  con los gastos y poder terminar de hacer las mejora de su vivienda, con esta solicitud va invertir en materiales de construcción para poner cerámica a su casa ya que es de suelo. Y así poder lograr tener en mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Don William, at 37 years old, has managed to have his own business, a store selling clothing and shoes, for two years. He started it with his savings and loans from Afodenic. With these loans he has been able to grow the business; he now does business in other areas. He lives in the Villa Reconciliación and with his wife he has three children of 8, 12 and 17 years of age that are students. His wife works as a cashier to help her husband with the household expenses and to be able to complete the improvements to their house. With this loan they will purchase construction materials to be able to put ceramic floors in their house, since it currently is a dirt floor, to allow the family to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of construction materials to put down ceramic flooring in his house

loans.name: Flor  De Maria

texts.es:
Doña Flor de María Dávila Roja tiene la edad de 51 años, su estado civil es soltera y el numero de hijo que tiene son 2,el menor de ellos tiene 12 años de edad y esta en primer año de secundaria y el mayor tiene 21 años y esta en el 2 año universitario, Doña Flor de María Dávila es viuda, pues su esposo murió hace aproximadamente 9 años y desde entonces ella tuvo que tomar la responsabilidad de su hogar, sus propósitos en este año es mantener su actividad económica ya que es la única fuente de ingreso para su familia sus deseos son de engrandecer mas su negocio surtiendo con artículos que sus clientes necesitan sus sueños son que sus hijo logren ser personas de bien para la sociedad para enfrentar las situaciones que se le presenten para que el día de mañana sepan que hacer ante un problema.

La actividad económica de Doña Flor es una ferretería, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 8 años, Doña Flor inicia este negocio cuando a su hermano se le dio la idea de que junto a Doña Flor instalaran un negocio de ventas de hierro, angulares, plycem y otros productos ferreteros, todo iba muy bien pero su hermano tuvo una enfermedad que no le permitió seguirle ayudando a Doña Flor, por lo tanto Doña Flor no dejo caer el negocio y siguió con esta ferretería, que hasta hoy le ha servido en la manutención de su familia y algunas veces ayuda a su hermano, quien le dio la mano en momentos difíciles, ya que por su enfermedad el no puede trabajar. Doña Flor necesita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo y para poder comprar más materiales que le permitan surtir su negocio y ofrecerles a sus clientes variedades de productos tales como: hierro, pinturas, alambres de amarres, clavos, bisagras, cemento, cintas métricas, lijas zinc y muchos otros productos que ella necesita abastecer.
texts.en:
Flor de María Dávila Roja, 51, is a widow and mother of two children, ages 12 and 21. The older is a college student and the younger is in middle school. Her husband died 9 years ago and she had to support her family by herself. Her new year resolution is to make her business grow, since she is the only bread-winner in the household. She hopes to raise her two children to be productive men who are able to overcome life's obstacles. Flor runs a small hardware store out of her home. She opened the store 8 years ago, at her brother's suggestion and encouragement. Her brother helped her a few years, but he became ill and had to stop working. Flor did not let the business fall apart, and it has provided her with a steady income for her family, including her brother. Flor is requesting a loan as work capital, to purchase more materials to restock her store and to be able to offer her customers a wider variety of products: paint, iron rods, wire, nails, cement, measuring tapes, sandpaper and many more.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marddy Elieth

texts.es: La Sra. Marddy  tiene un negocio de alquiler de cuartos, lo cual es rentable ya que muchas familias Nicaragüenses no tienen una vivienda donde vivir y alquilan cuarto, es triste la situación, pero hay que subsistir es por eso nace la idea de hacer cuarto para alquilar, desde hace trece años brinda este servicio que sastiface al cliente como a sus ingresos, tiene 34 años de edad, reside en laureles norte y con una hija de 13 años de que espera brindarle sus estudio y sea una joven profesional. Esta es la primera solicitud de crédito en Afodenic que espera invertir en infraestructura en embaldosar su casa como las paredes para una mejor presentación y bienestar de su familia. Sus planes a futuro es seguir haciendo mejoras a su casa y poder seguir ofreciendo sus servicios a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marddy has a business renting rooms, which is profitable since many Nicaraguan families don't have a house in which to live and thus rent rooms, which is sad, but they have to have somewhere to live, from where the idea of renting rooms was born. She has been providing this service for three years. She is 34 years old, lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood with her 13 year old daughter, for whom she hopes to provide an education and would like to see become a professional. This is her first loan with Afodenic, which she hopes to invest in infrastructure, tiling the floor of her house as well the walls for a better appearance and the well-being of her family. Her future plan is to continue making improvements to house and to continue providing services to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials to tile the floor in her house, which is currently a dirt floor

loans.name: Eliab Ramon

texts.es: El joven Eliab tiene 25 años de edad, reside en la Primavera en la ciudad de managua, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 3 y 6 años de edad, el mas grande va  a clase, su esposa lo apoya en su negocio que es la fabricación de bolis,  negocio que inicio con su papa con fondos propios desde hace nueve años, esta solicitando un préstamo para dar la prima de una camioneta para facilitar la distribución de bolis a las diferentes pulperías y comercios. Con esta inversión será de mucho beneficios para su familia y en el ámbito laboral ya que podrán vender a más mercado ya que se le facilitara el acarreo de distribución. Sus. Sus planes es comercializar sus productos a norte del país, poder hacer la casa para mi familia.
texts.en:
Eliab is 25 years old and lives in the Primavera neighbood in Managua. He and his wife have two children that are 3 and 6 years old and the oldest goes to school. His wife helps him with his business, which is the manufacture of frozen popsicles, a business that he started nine years ago with his father, with their own funds. He is requesting a loan to make the down payment on a pickup truck to distribute the popsicles to various grocery stores and businesses. This investment will provide many benefits for his family and his business, since they will be able to sell to more businesses with the facilitated transport. His plans are to market his products in the north of the country and to build a house for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a pickup truck to facilatate the delivery of his popsicles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase goods.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch P., 34,  lives in Prey Mean village in Takeo province. She cultivates rice in a plot of land she owns. Her husband, Mr. Chhoem Sophal, retails chicken. He facing some difficulties in his business because he does not have his own motorbike to travel to purchase chicken for sale. Thus, Mrs. Touch P. decided to ask for a loan, to add to her savings, to buy a motorbike for her husband’s business. She has four children who are attending the local school. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to add to her saving to buy a motorbike for her husband’s chicken retail business.

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en: Mrs. Roeun N., 38, lives in Pong Ror village in Takeo province.  She is a mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school. She raises and breeds ducks for a living. Her husband, Mr. Nuon Torn, cultivates rice on a piece of land they own. In this farm, he faces some difficulties because the soil is infertile and the field is also far from irrigation system,  affecting productivity of his crops. In order to solve these problems, Mrs. Roeun N. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and a pump machine to water the field thereby  making the crops more productive.  Her husband is presented with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pump machine in order to water the field to make the crops more productive.

loans.name: Srey Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Mom Y., 18, mother of a 2-year old child,  lives in Prey Me Long Thboung village in Takeo province. She owns a mall grocery store, which is going well.  She wants to expand her business and is asking for a to buy more grocery items for her store. She hopes to increase income and improve her family living conditions. Her husband, Mr. Mun La, a construction worker, makes a small income to support the family. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for sale in her store.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sorn N., 44, lives in Si Sla village in Takeo province. She is a mother of six children, two of whom are construction workers while the others are attending the local school. She and her husband, Mr. Heng Hoeng, cultivate rice on a plot of land they own. They are facing some difficulties in their farm because they do not have enough farmhand and inputs to cultivate rice during the dry season. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Sorn N. is asking for a loan enable them  to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field, buy fertilizer and pesticides to make the farm more productive. Her husband is with her in the photo.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field and buy fertilizer and  pesticides to increase productivity of the farm.

loans.name: Mabb

texts.en: Mr. Mabb T. lives in Pong Ror village in Takeo province. He is a fisherman. His wife, Mrs. Loem Rim, cultivates rice on a piece of land they own. In this farm, she needs fertilizer and pump machine to increase its productivity.  Thus, Mr. Mabb T. asking for a loan for these purposes. He hopes to increase income and improve their living conditions with this loan. His wife is with him in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pump machine increase productivity of their farm.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en: Mrs. Yim S., 38, lives in Kror Bak village in Takeo province. She is a mother of six children, two of whom stay at home to help her in her chores, while the two are attending the local school and the remaining two are too young to work or study. She is a duck breeder. Her husband, Mr. Yorng Mos, cultivates rice on a plot of land they own. The farm has poor yield because the soil is infertile. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Yim S. is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizer to make the farm more productive. Her husband is with her in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to make her farm more productive.

loans.name: Noem

texts.en: Mrs. Noem M.,41, lives in Roung village in Takeo province. She cultivates rice on a piece of land she owns. Her husband, Mr. Chhil Sao, is a laborer. Even though they try to work hard, they still earn less income to provide a better life for their family living and they usually pay much money to travel to the local market, work place and so on. In order to reduce Mrs. Noem M.’s expenses, she is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike for her family's use. She has four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, two are attending the local school and one stays at home. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her family' use

loans.name: Thorng

texts.en:
K. is a Cambodian who lives in Banteay Meanchey Province. She was born in 1960 and is a mother who has given birth to three children; all three of them are single. She is also a good housewife who cooks delicious foods for the family.

K. currently sells a variety of groceries out of her home. K. is married to Mr. Ly, 38, and he earns income by raising pigs from home. K. has been planning to establish a suitable investment for her husband. Right now, she is applying for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to drive as a taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to drive as a taxi

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheap K. is 38 years old and is the mother of three children attending local school. Her husband, Mr. Chiem Van is on the right in the photo. They live in Prey Me Long Thboung village in the Takeo province.

Mrs. Pheap K. and her husband are farmers who own a piece of land and cultivate rice. On this plantation, they earn very little income to support their family living.

Mr. Chiem Van would like to buy raw material to make candies to start a new business. Mrs. Pheap K. is requesting a loan for this purpose. They hope to increase their income and improve their living conditions with the help of this loan.

loans.use: To buy raw material to make candies to start a new business.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim L. is 50 years old and is the mother of three children: one is employed in a garment factory, a second is a fisherman, and the third is attending the local school. She lives in Pong Ror village in the Takeo province with her husband, Mr. Nut Torn shown on the right in the photo.

Mrs. Sim L. and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. On this plantation, they earn very little income to provide for a good living.

Mrs. Sim L. is asking for a loan to help her save towards building a house for her family to live.

loans.use: To build a house for her family to live

loans.name: Mrs. Seam Saom Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Ten people living in Preak Treing village in the Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes.

Mrs. Seam S., the 27 year-old village bank president is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Phen Pav is a fisherman. He has a small problem where he does not have enough fish nets for his fishing business.

Mrs. Seam S. is asking for a loan to buy fish nets for her husband's business. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

Three members in this group have loans that are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fish nets for the fishing business.

loans.name: Toek

texts.en:
S. is 52 years old and resides in Kandal Province in Cambodia where he makes a living catching fish to sell retail at the market. He earns average of US$ 3 per day. He is married with five children: three are single and two are married. His wife, Touch, age 42, is a local mat maker, and she can earn approximately US$ 3 a day to help with the family's expenses.

S.'s business is running very well but recently he can't catch many fish because his fishing implements frequently are broken. Therefore he decided to ask for a loan as capital to buy more fishing implements such as nets and traps. Any remainder of loan will be used to buy raw materials for his wife's mat-braiding business.

loans.use: To buy more fishing implements like nets and traps

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Mrs. Yon O. is 44 years old and is the mother of six children: one is employed in a garment factory, another four are attending the local school, and the youngest is too young to work or study.

Mrs. Yon O. lives in Ksom village in the Kandal province with her husband, Mr. Huon Phal pictured on the right in the photo. He is a motor taxi driver.

Mrs. Yon O. is a farmer and owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. On this plantation, she makes very little and does not have enough money to grow rice. She is asking for a loan for plowing, to buy fertilizer and pesticides, and to hire laborers to work in the field.

loans.use: To plow, to buy fertilizer and pesticides, and to hire laborers to work in the field.

loans.name: Mr. Yon Mouk Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Yon M. is 46 years old and is the father of four children; two are employed in a garment factory with the others attending a local school. Mr. Yon M. is the village bank president selected by the members. The village bank consists of twenty members, and is located in Preak Traeng village in the Kandal province. The members plan to use the loan for different purposes.

Mr. Yon M. and his wife, Mrs. Yon Savon are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. On this plantation, they earn very little rice revenue to supP. their family members. To improve their standard of living, Mr. Yon M. is asking for a loan to buy piglets to start a pig breeding business. He hopes to increase his income and improve their living conditions.

Three members in this group have loans that are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product, because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy piglets to start a pig breeding business.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan S. L., 42, is married and lives with her husband in Bati district, Takeo province. She sells medicines from her home and is able to make $4 per day, while her husband is a rice and vegetable farmer earning about $2 a day. The couple has three children, all of whom are married. Mrs. Chan is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more medicines for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine for sale.

loans.name: Seak

texts.en:
Mr. Seak H. is 56 years old and is the father of five children; three are security workers while the others are enrolled in the local school. His wife, Mrs. Penh Kong, pictured with him, is a housewife. Mr. Seak H. lives in Ksom village in the Kandal province and is a teacher in the local school.

Mr. Seak H. is also a farmer and owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. On this plantation, he faces a challenge as the field is infertile. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. He will use the remainder of the money to purchase fuel, to water the field so his crop is more productive.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, and purchase fuel to water the field so the crop is more productive.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea P. is 35 years old and lives in Bati district, Takeo province. She is a true entrepreneur who operates a tailoring shop from her home to earn a living and is able to make US$6 per day. She has been divorced from her husband for years and lives with three of her children and her mother. One of her children is a garment factory worker and two are in school. To earn more money, Mrs. Chea P. is asking a loan of US$250 to breed ducks for eggs. (Chea is pictured with her son and her mother)

loans.use: To breed ducks for eggs.

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
Mrs. Ren S. is 45 years old and lives in Boeung village in the Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Pauk Pao, on the left in the photo, is a construction worker. As his place of work is far from home, he usually pays money for a motor taxi to get to work.

Mrs. Ren S. is asking for a loan to buy a motorbike to reduce their expenses. Together they have four children; three of whom are attending local school with the youngest child too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to go to work

loans.name: Se

texts.en: Se S. is 27 years old and stays at home at Bati district, Takeo province with her husband, pictured here. Since 2005, she has raised pigs to earn a living and is able to make about US$2 a day. Her husband runs a business selling ice-cream in the village, making on average, about US$25 in revenue per day. The couple has one young child. Se S. would like to take out a loan to purchase a big box to store ice-cream for sale. This will allow her husband to increase the number of ice-creams he can store and sell each day.

loans.use: To purchase a big box to store ice-cream.

loans.name: Noy

texts.en:
Mrs. Noy M. is a 66 year old widow. She lives in Ampao Prey Muoy village in the Kandal province.

Mrs. Noy M. is a fruit seller. She would like to expand and purchase more fruits to re-sell as her business is doing well. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to re-sell.

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeun C. is 40 years old and is a widow with two children; one is a blacksmith and the other is attending the local school. Mrs. Oeun C. lives with her children in Sambuo village in the Kandal province.

Mrs. Oeun C. is a farmer who owns a 0.5 field of land to cultivate rice. On this plantation, the field is far from the irrigation system and the soil is infertile.

Mrs. Oeun C. is asking for a loan for a pump machine and fertilizer. She will use the rest of the loan to buy fuel to support the pump and to water the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine, fertilizer, and fuel

loans.name: Tum

texts.en: Tum R. is 49 years and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She grows rice and makes around US$1 each day. Her husband is a village chief and wedding chef. On average, he makes approximately US$2.50 per day. Currently, the couple lives with five of their eight children. Two children are construction workers building houses and three others are students. Mrs Tum R. is asking for a loan to rent farmland to grow beans and rice.

loans.use: To rent farmland to grow beans and rice.

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en:
S. is a 37-year-old resident of Kandal Province, Cambodia. He currently catches fish to sell retail in the market and makes an average of $3 each day. In the business, he is relying on fishing around Tunle Sap Lake and the other ponds in the area of his community. He is married to Thon, 41, who makes a living braiding mats from home to sell for a profit. The couple are the parents of three children; all of them are still attending school.

Fishing is S.'s main source of stable income for the family's living expenses. In order to make the business more successful, he is asking for a loan to buy more fishing implements to supply his business.

loans.use: To buy more fishing implements for  his business

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Mrs. Long V. is 39 years old and is a widow with three children attending the local school. Mrs. Long V. lives in Chorng Prey Bey village in the Kandal province.

Mrs. Long V. is a pig breeder and also owns a rice mill. She is requesting a loan to build a rice mill house for her rice mill business. She hopes to increase her income and improve the living conditions for her family with this loan.

loans.use: To build a rice mill house for her business.

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Say K., 43, is married and lives with her husband in Bati district, Takeo province. She cooks and sells a variety of food in front of a nearby garment factory, earning about US$2 a day. Her husband, Kem Hean, 45, is a construction foreman and makes approximately US$5 per day. The couple has three children, two of whom are employed and one who is in school. Say K. is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase cows for resale. This will enable her to earn additional income to raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase cows.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. Phon N. is a 63 year old widow with three children; one sells Bro Houk in the local market and the others are too young to work or study. She lives in Lvea Kandal village in the Kandal province.

Mrs. Phon N. is a farmer and owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. On this plantation, she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and fuel in order to water the field.

She is asking for a loan to help solve these problems.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and fuel in order to water the field.

loans.name: Pai

texts.en: Pai K., 57, lives in Bati district with her husband and sells coconuts in front of a nearby garment factory and makes about $1 profit each day. Her husband operates a motor-taxi and is makes about $5 each day. The couple has six children. All of the children are employed and share their income to help raise their family's standard of living. Mrs. Pai K. is requesting a loan to purchase a motorbike and trailer for her husband to expand his motor-taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and trailer.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Heang B. is 30 years old and lives with her mother in Bati district, Takeo province. She is a true entrepreneur who runs a weaving business from her home and grows vegetables to sell in the local market, earning approximately $3 profit each day. Heang is requesting a loan to purchase more silk to weave more scarves.

loans.use: To purchase silk.

loans.name: Mrs. Chan Ngel Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people living in Run village in the Takeo province comprise this village bank loan. They will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Chan N. is the village bank president.

Mrs. Chan N. is 28 years old and is the mother of four children; three are attending the local school and the other is too young to work or study. She is also a farmer and owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Pheim Oun is a motor taxi driver. Mrs. Chan N. is requesting a loan to buy timbers to build a house for her family to live in.

One member in this group has a loan that is an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy timbers to build a house for her family to live in.

loans.name: You

texts.en: You C., 60, pictured here with her oldest daughter, is a widowed farmer who lives with three of her children in the Bati district, Takeo province. She grows vegetables and weaves mats to sell at the local market, earning about $1.3 profit each day. She is also supported by three of her children who work as tailors. Mrs. You C. would like to request a loan of $1,200 to purchase cloth to expand her tailoring business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth to expand tailoring business.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan S. is 36 years old and lives with her husband in Bati district, Takeo province. She weaves scarves in her home and sells them in the market, earning approximately $2 profit each day, while her husband Sek Kosal, 30, is a soldier who earns $40 in salary every month. The couple has two young children, one of whom is in school. Mrs. Chan S. is requesting a loan to purchase more silk with which to weave scarves.

loans.use: To purchase silk.

loans.name: Mrs. Lina Pov Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people living in Run village in Takeo province comprise this village bank, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Lina P., the 27-year-old village bank president, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Chuon Channy, is a furniture maker. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Lina P. decided to ask for a loan to buy wood to make more cabinets to sell. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. She has two children who are too young to work or study.
