For this purpose, Gulnora and her family are requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni. They will use the loan to improve their quality of life. Let’s help this family to remain strong and united.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Karimjon

texts.en:
Karimjon is 34 years old and married with two children. He is a farmer who grows grain. He has farmed since he was nine years old. This is the only profession he knows; he loves his work. For Karimjon, there is nothing better than being in touch with nature and watching the crops of his labor grow year after year. In addition, Karimjon raises cattle. His family helps him with his business.

Now he wants to borrow money to purchase seeds and fertilizer in order to grow more grain. This is the second loan Karimjon has requested from IMON International. He promises to repay the current loan without any violations as he has done in the past.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. loans.use: To purchase seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru:
Сафарали Эрматов мужчина 26 лет , женат , отец двоих детей.Жена домохозяйка, сам работает в колхозе трактористом.В хозяйстве имеет 15 коз и 10 баранов.Сафарали уже третий год кридитуется в Микроинвесте.
Сафарали каждый вечер пригоняет скот с пастбищ кишлака,он доволен кредитами и говорит что займы ему помогают в его скотоводчестве.
texts.en:
Safarali E. is a man of 26 years, married and is a father of two children. His wife is a housewife and he works as a tractor operator on a farm. He owns fifteen goats and ten sheep. Safarali has been taking out loans from MicroInvest for three years. He shepherds the cattle from the village pastures every evening. He is very happy with the loans and says that they really help him with his animal husbandry business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Animal husbandry

loans.name: Kumriniso

texts.en:
Kumriniso K. is a married mother with three children. Her parents and her grandparents taught her about animals, and that knowledge has allowed her to grow a business raising cattle. She keeps the cattle near her home. Kumriniso's work in animal sales generates a good income for her family. Currently she has 4 cows and 2 sheep. She would like to increase little by little the variety of her animals and therefore she is seeking a loan of $800 USD.

Kumriniso’s dream is for her children to receive a good education.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. Its history includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and many famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets like Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Umriniso

texts.en:
Umriniso K. is 39 years old. She is married and has two children. She is a very active woman. Twenty years ago she started her business of raising cattle. She now has 2 sheep and 3 cows. She sells the animals after fattening them. She sells the animals to the local market and to local restaurants. With the income she generates she provides a better quality of life for her children. Her children are her main responsibility. Her son and daughter (pictured) help her with the business.

Despite recent success, since her business is still quite small, it doesn't generate enough income for the whole family. Umriniso would like to request a loan so she can expand her business and thereby increase her family's income. She will use the profit generated from the business to repay the loan on time. She is asking for a loan of $800 USD for the term of 12 months. She will use the loan to buy more young cattle, which she will sell when they are fully grown. The well being of Umriniso’s family and her business are in your hands.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Hidoyat

texts.en:
Hidoyat and her husband believe that education is the most important inheritance they can give their children. They are both very responsible parents, and they work very hard in agriculture and farming so that they can give their children the opportunity to finish school. That is an opportunity they never had due to poor finances. This happy mother has been working in agriculture since getting married and, with the unconditional help of her husband, she buys and sells cattle in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. Even so, she now finds herself with more bills than she can afford. Therefore, she would like a loan in order to buy more cattle and increase their capital. Hidoyat and her family are waiting for your quick response.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Yakub

texts.en:
Yakub S. is 51 years old. He is married and has 5 children. Yakub is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children. Today his children are working adults thanks to his example. Only his younger son is still under his care. Yakub has great experience cattle breeding; he has worked with cattle since 1988. Over time, he has increased his sales. Now he needs assistance investing in his business. The business has been going well and he would like it to continue to grow. Yakub applied for a loan of $800 USD to buy young cattle. He and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them in continuing this business and helping them give their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Nurali

texts.ru: Нурали мужчина 39 лет , отец четверых детей, работает в колхозе по поливу полей.Сам занимается откормом и продажей скота.У него сейчас 30 баранов.Во время мониторинга его скот был на поле.Его кишлак Катарблок расположен вблизи гор, поэтому все люди этого кишлака отправляют свой скот пастись  на поля.Займ Нурали хочет использовать для закупа корма баранов.В начале своей кредитной деятельности Нурали имел всего 8 баранов,и как он говорит благодаря кредитам у него увеличился бизнес втрое больше.Нурали выражает благодарность за финансирование и понимание.
texts.en:
Nurali is a 39-year old father of four. He works in an agricultural cooperative and focuses on raising and selling livestock. Nurali now owns 30 sheep. Because his Katarblok village is situated in the mountains, he, along with other villagers, sends his livestock to graze on flatlands. Nurali intends to use this loan to purchase feed for his sheep. When he first started receiving credit, Nurali only had 8 sheep, and now his business has tripled. He is very grateful for the financing opportunities.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sheep feed

loans.name: Nuriniso

texts.en:
Nuriniso comes from a humble family who worked very hard to get her ahead in life. She is 51 years old, a widow and has three children. For 8 years Nuriniso has dedicated herself to raising and selling cattle, a job that brings economic stability to her family. It is for her family that she works and struggles day in and day out. Her son helps her with the business.

She’s asking for a loan of $1000 USD to invest in her business and buy more cattle. A successful business will allow her to save enough money so she can arrange the marriage of her younger son. Nuriniso is committed to responsibly repaying the loan within 12 months. With your help, Nuriniso can accomplish her dream very soon.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Familia Unida De Inversiones Group

texts.en:
“La Familia Unida de Inversiones” or the Investment Family is a group of 15 entrepreneurs seeking their second loan from Esperanza International.  The group’s past loan has been successfully repaid, and the group hopes to utilize a second loan for further business expansion.  Mercedes is one of the coordinators of the group in Santiago. 

Mercedes, mother of seven (ages: oldest 34, youngest 16), operates two entrepreneurial activities out of her home.  Door-to-door, Mercedes sells jars of a Dominican specialty dessert made of milk, sugar, vanilla, raisins and yams and within her home she operates men’s and women’s clothing and shoes sales.  Mercedes desires to see growth in her business so that she will be able to construct a better home and continue to provide for the physical needs of her spouse and numerous children.  


On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Additional food and clothing purchases to increase current selling capacity

loans.name: Luz Y Esperanza Group

texts.en:
“Luz y Esperanza” or Light and Hope is a group of five entrepreneurs seeking their second loan from Esperanza International. The group’s past loan has been successfully repaid, and the group hopes to utilize a second loan for further business expansion. Germania is the coordinator for this group in Santiago.

Germania, mother of a ten-year-old child, dreams of converting her current beauty salon one day to a complete spa including a massage center. Germania has recently completed her past loan of 8,000 pesos (approximately $230) and is planning to utilize a second loan of 10,000 pesos (approximately $285) to expand her current infrastructure and purchase additional supplies, including shampoos. Germania is driven in her work and desires to continue to provide for her husband and child.

Other members of Germania’s bank run similar entrepreneurial operations including shoes, pillows, and clothing sales.

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Expansion of current infrastructure and purchase of needed supplies

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.en:
“Jehova es mi Pastor” is a group of five entrepreneurs seeking their second loan from Esperanza International. The group’s past loan has been successfully repaid, and the group hopes to utilize a second loan for further business expansion. Lucia is one of the coordinators of the group in Santiago.

Lucia, mother of 3 (ages: 21, 16, 11) sells beauty products for men and women from catalogs. Lucia solicits orders from her catalogs and receives the requested products through mail from the capital, Santo Domingo. Orders are then delivered to the homes of customers. Lucia used her first loan to aid in the purchase of the catalogs and beauty supplies and plans to utilize a second loan to increase her selling capacity of offered products. Lucia desires to see continued growth in product sales so that she may continue to provide for her family and expand her existing business and product offerings.

Other members of Lucia’s bank run similar beauty-based entrepreneurial activities including two beauty salons, and additional catalog-based beauty sales. Such activities have gained the group the reputation and nickname of “the beauties”.

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Increase selling capacity and products on offer

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La Señora Marisol V. tiene la edad de 40 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Marisol tiene 2 hijos con las siguientes edades 1 varón de 17 años de edad y cursa el 5 año de secundaria y una mujer de 4 años de edad y cursa el 3 nivel de preescolar, su compañero de vida labora en la venta de electrodoméstico, sus propósitos son de aumentar su mercadería ya que así lograra  mejorar su negocio por lo que sus clientes tendrán una variedad para escoger productos, sus sueños son de sacar adelante a sus hijos para que tengan un futuro prometedor ya que es importante para Doña Marisol que sus hijos sean unos profesionales, sus deseos son de aumentar el negocio para convertirlo en una tienda donde tendrá mas espacio para recibir a sus clientes y podrá mostrar su mercadería.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general como: ropa interior, camisas, pantalones, shorts y sandalias, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 4 años, Doña Marisol inicio por cuenta propia ya que tenia que hacerse responsabilizarse por los gastos de su casa razón que la impulsa a buscar la manera de trabajar por lo que decide comprar ropa en general pero inicio con poco como: ropa interior, pantalones y camisas y decide visitar a sus vecinos y amigos por lo que además de poseer esta humilde profesión labora como enfermera  en un hospital por lo que no tenia los suficientes ingresos y ha trabajado fuertemente para lograr sus objetivos y para darle a sus hijos lo que ellos necesitan y hasta los momentos ha logrado mantener ambos trabajos a pesar del poco tiempo que tiene ya que los deseos de superación son muy fuertes aunque es algo que solo se logra con sacrificios como lo ha logrado Doña Marisol, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que esta destinado para la compra de mas mercadería por lo que tiene que recurrir a los diferentes departamentos como: Managua, Chinandega  en busca de mercadería mas favorable.
texts.en:
Marisol V. is 40 years old and single. She has two children: a son, 17, who is in his 5th year of secondary school, and a daughter, 4, who is in the 3rd year of preschool. Her partner sells electrical appliances. She wants to increase her inventory so she can improve business and provide a selection of products for her customers to choose from. Her dream is to give her children a good start so they can have a promising future; it is very important to Marisol that her children be professionals. She wants to grow her business and open a store where she'll have more space for her clientele and her merchandise. She's been in business for 4 years, selling everyday products like undergarments, shirts, pants, shorts and sandals. Marisol went into her own business because she needed take responsibility for the household expenses. She searched for the right kind of work and settled on selling clothing in general, but decided to start small by visiting friends and neighbors with items like undergarments, pants, and shirts. In addition to this humble profession, Marisol works in a hospital as a nurse. She has not had sufficient income, and has worked hard to achieve her goals so she can give her children what they need. Thus far she has succeeded in keeping up both careers, despite how little time she has. She has a strong desire to overcome, although she has done so only through great sacrifice. Marisol is seeking a loan for working capital, to buy inventory; she needs to search for better merchandise in different areas such as Managua and Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Evonne Mahle

texts.en:
Evonne is married with three children and lives in Ngomgham, Bamenda, Cameroon. She plans to invest this loan in her "buyam sellam" raw food stuff and her piggery and poultry. More specifically, she will purchase Irish potatoes, beans, maize, three piglets, and 30 fowls. Evonne also plans to contribute 100,000 CFA ($200 USD) of her personal savings towards these purchases.  
 
This is Evonne's fifth loan from GHAPE; she has been a member since 2004. She has been working in her "buyam sellam" business for a number of years now and has since found the items she sells from suppliers; this ensures she gets the best prices on these items. Evonne now has many customers who come to her for all of their vegetables. She allows some people to create tabs with her for their purchases and pay her at the end of the month. Her contribution to her community provides them with these items in closer proximity to their community, cutting down on their travel costs and the time involved in searching for these items.
 
With the profits from this loan, Evonne plans to send her children to school and support them after school. She will also consider adding other food stuffs to her stall. Her profits will also provide her the security of knowing she can afford hospital bills and health costs.  
 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her food stall

loans.name: Celenia Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Celenia tiene 47 años de edad, reside en laureles norte en capital de managua, con dos hijos de 10 y 16 años de edad, que estudian, ella trabaja desde hace muchos años en servicios domésticos para sobresalir adelante con su familia. Para mejorar su vivienda ha recorrido hacer préstamos en Afodenic que ha sido de muchos beneficios para hacer mejoras a su casa,  esta es su quinta solicitud de crédito la cual va invertir en infraestructura, en la reparación del techo ya que esta en mal estado, y necesita estar con su techo reparado para el invierno siguiente para no sufrir mojándose  a si como proteger  a sus hijos, en donde puedan gozar de una casa digna. Sus planes a futuro es poder tener un negocio propio para estar más cerca de sus hijos y poder mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Celenia is 47 years old, lives in Laureles Norte in Managua, the capital, with two children, 10 and 16 years old, who are students. She has worked many years in domestic service to get ahead with her family. To improve their home she has turned to Afodenic for loans, which have helped greatly in making improvements to her house. This is her fifth credit request which she will invest in infrastructure, repairing the roof as it is in poor condition. It needs to be repaired for the next winter so they do not have to put up with getting wet, so she can protect her children, where they can enjoy a decent home. Her plans for the future are to have a business of her own in order to be closer to her children and to improve their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to repair the roof

loans.name: Ndang Charles

texts.en:
Charles is married to Florence, a very supportive wife, and they are blessed with two children. He lives in Kobenyang-Bome, a small rural town about an hour outside of Bamenda, Cameroon. He plans to invest this loan in the purchase of a motorbike. He will be driving the motorbike himself since this is his old line of business. He plans to contribute 280,000 CFA ($560 USD) from his personal savings and from the sale of an old motorbike he has towards this purchase.

This is Charles's second loan; he has been a GHAPE member since 29/03/2007. The motorbike will be used as a taxi in the area. Bikes are one of the most efficient forms of transport in and around Kobenyang. As many of the roads are in shambles, bikes are often able to move through these areas quicker and without suffering as much damage as cars.

With the profit from this loan, Charles plans to take care of his family, ensure that they eat well and buy their medications. He knows very well that he will be able to repay this loan because of the low interest rate and the lengthy repayment period. Moreover, last year Charles was able to make savings that tripled his loan of 40,000 FRS.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of motorbike, fuel, and documents.

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es: El sr. Juan de Dios,  tiene 52 años de edad, su negocio es una pulpería que con mucho esfuerzos  pudo poner con ahorros y créditos desde hade nueve años, reside en laureles sur, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 7 y 14 años de edad,  que estudian la primaria, sus planes es poder comprar un vehiculo para no pagar en taxi cuando va de compra para llenar inventario de la pulpería, por  que lo de mas los camiones repartidores pasan, con este préstamo va  reforzar en productos enlatados como insumos diarios, y espera poder dar un mejor servicios a sus clientes, ya que gracias a estos préstamo de Afodenic puede hacer crecer su negocio. Que espera mas adelante hacer más grande, a si como ayudar a sus hijos puedan terminar el ciclo de estudio.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan de Dios is 52 years old. His business is running a local store which, with much effort, he was able to build up with savings and loans over the last nine years. He lives in Laureles Sur and he and his wife have 2 children, 7 and 14 years old, who are primary school students. His plan is to be able to buy a vehicle in order avoid paying for a taxi when he goes shopping to fill the inventory of the store because he is not on the route of most of the delivery trucks. With this loan he is going to increase the daily supplies he carries, like canned goods. He hopes to provide better service to his customers and thanks to this loan from Afodenic be able to make his business grow. He hopes later to make it larger, and help his children complete primary school.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy canned goods to supply his store.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es: El señor Emiliano Sánchez Hernández tiene la edad de 58 años, habita en el barrio San Juan  ubicado en la Concepción, junto a su esposa, la cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que ella es comerciante, al igual sus hijos le apoyan. Don Emiliano desde hace treinta cinco años trabaja sus tierras las cuales producen cítricos y café mayor sueños de él es lograr establecer mas cultivos para poder dejarle partes iguales a sus hijos. El inicio como agricultor ya que sus padres le inculcaron trabajar de esa manera .Solicita un financiamiento para poder comprar insumos y poder aplicarle al cultivo. Para obtener una buena producción y vender mejor al mercado
texts.en:
Mr. Emiliano Sánchez Hernández is 48 years old and lives in the San Juan neighborhood located in Concepción with his wife who helps him with the living expenses since she is s shop keeper. His sons also help him. For thirty years Don Emiliano has worked his land which produces citrus and coffee. His greatest dream is to be able to establish more crops to that he can leave equal parts to his children. He started farming when his parents taught him to work in this way. He is requesting financing to be able to buy supplies to apply to his crops in order to get a good yield and sell more in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy agricultural supplies to increase production

loans.name: Fransisco Matilde

texts.es:
Don Francisco Matilde Hernández S. tiene la edad de 37 años, su estado civil es casado y el numero de hijos que tiene son 7, el varón de 18 años cursa el sexto grado de primaria, el varón de 16 también cursa el sexto grado de primaria, la niña de 14 años cursa el primer año de secundaria, la niña de 12 años cursa el sexto grado de primaria, la niña de 10 años cursa el quinto grado de primaria, la niña de 8 años cursa el tercer grado de primaria y el niño menor que tiene 7 años de edad cursa el segundo grado, de primaria, su compañera de vida es ama de casa y le ayuda en el cuido del negocio, los propósitos de Don Francisco Hernández son ampliar su negocio y ser la mejor pulpería de su sector para abastecer a muchos clientes y de esta manera lograr mas ingresos que sustenten el bienestar de su familia, sus deseos son que sus hijos puedan salir adelante con la ayuda de el y su esposa, pero sobretodo de Dios, además desea que Dios le de salud para poder trabajar y terminar de encaminar a sus hijos en la vida, su sueño es salir de la pobreza y emprender variedades de negocios en el que sus hijos sean unos profesionales y puedan desempeñar sus carreras en estos, también construir una buena casa y tener una vejez feliz

La actividad económica en la que se desempeña Don Francisco es la venta de leña y una pulpería, actividad a la que se dedica desde hace 9 años y que con mucha lucha ha podido mantener, ya que el es el único que trabaja porque su esposa se mantiene al cuidado de los niños, es de saber que Don Francisco ha tenido dificultades económicas pero como buen comerciante ha sabido hacerle frente a dichas situaciones, en su pulpería el vende productos tales como: jabón, pan, pastas, galletas, cepillos, productos higiénicos, granos básicos, y otros productos mas que con frecuencia la población cercana a su pulpería, le llega a comprar, con la ayuda de su esposa Don Francisco ha podido sacar adelante su negocio, mientras su esposa atiende el negocio, Don Francisco vende la leña, algunas veces en su misma casa de habitación y otras veces el las va a distribuir a sus clientes, Don Francisco necesita el financiamiento para invertir en el capital de trabajo, pues el desea comprar mayor cantidad de productos para surtir su negocio y facilitar a los pobladores aledaños a su negocio los artículos que ellos deseen.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco Matilde Hernández S. is 37 years old, married, and has 7 children. His 18 year old son is in sixth grade of primary school, his 16 year old son is also in sixth grade of primary school, his 14 years old daughter is in first year of secondary school, his 12 years old daughter is in sixth grade of primary school, his 10 year old daughter is in fifth grade of primary school, his 8 years old daughter is in third grade of primary school, and the youngest 7 year old son is in second grade of primary school. His wife is a housewife and helps with the business. Francisco plans to expand his business and be the best grocery store in his area in order to meet his customer’s needs and in this way generate more income to support his family. His wishes include his children becoming successful with the help of him and his spouse, but above all with God’s help. In addition he wishes that God gives him good health to be able to work and finish guiding his children throughout life. His dream is rising out of poverty and starting various businesses in which his children can be professionals and can have their careers through these businesses. He also wishes to build a good house and have happy golden years. Francisco sells firewood and has his grocery store, businesses he has had for 9 years and with great effort has maintained. He is the only one that works because his wife takes care of the children. Francisco has had some economic difficulties but like any good businessman he has known how to confront these situations. In his store he sells products such as: Soap, bread, pasta, cookies, brushes, hygiene products, basic grains, and other products his neighborhood customers need that the come to buy from him. With the help of his wife Francisco has been able to be successful in his business. While his wife attends to the business Francisco sells firewood, sometimes from his home, other times he goes and delivers it to his customers. Francisco needs financing to have working capital for his business, as he wishes to buy a large quantity of products to stock his business and meet his customer’s needs.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy large quantities to stock his store

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es: El señor Julio Alberto V. M. tiene la edad de 49 años, habita en el barrio Los Ríos ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa, la cual trabaja como comerciante de frutas para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar. Ellos tienen una hija a su cargo la cual estudia su primaria. Los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida. El desde hace veintidós años se dedica a la agricultura, el inicio con sus propios esfuerzos, los planes hacia su futuro es incrementar la producción para garantizarle bienestar a sus familia ya que obtendrá mas ingresos. El solicita financiamiento ya que sus cultivos carecen de fertilizantes y se están debilitando poco a poco. Lo cual espera tener una producción buena en frutos para vender mejor precio al M.
texts.en:
Mr. Julio Alberto V. M. is 49 years old and lives in the neighborhood of "Los Rios" in Ticuantepe with his wife, who works selling fruit to cover house expenses. They have a daughter who is studying in elementary school. They plan to improve their living conditions. He has been working in agriculture for 22 years, starting by his own efforts. He plans to increase production in order to guarantee the well-being of his family by getting more income. He asks for financing because his crops lack fertilizer and they are weakening little by little. He hopes this will result in good production of fruit to sell at a better price at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer in order to improve production

loans.name: Oscar Augusto

texts.es: El señor Oscar Agusto M. tiene la edad de 40 años, habita en La Concepción , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como conserje en una casa privada , para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar . Los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida ya que con sus propios esfuerzos han logrado establecer piña. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a cultivar sus tierras la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento. Lo cual espera con este crédito poder comprar fertilizantes, para mejorar los cultivos y poder vender a buen precio en el M. la cosecha.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar Agusto M. is 40 years old and lives in La Concepción with his wife, who works as a caretaker in a private household in order to help him with household expenses. They plan to improve their living conditions and they have started to grow pineapple with their own efforts. For 10 years he has been cultivating his land, and finances are the largest hardship. He hopes to buy fertilizar with this loan, in order to improve his crops and to be able to sell at good prices in the market when the harvest comes.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy feritlizers to improve production

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA ANA RUTH V. D. A.  D. 36 AÑOS D. EDAD,   TIENE UN  PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO EN  ILOPANGO.    ELLA SE DEDICA A  LA ELABORACION D.  PAN DULCE Y PAN FRANCES. AMBOS CONSIDERADOS PARTE DEL MENU QUE A DIARIO SABOREAN LOS SALVADOREÑOS. 

 ESTA COSTUMBRE SE DELEITA GENERALMENTE POR LAS MAÑANAS Y LAS TARDES;  SIN EMBARGO  PARA LA PRODUCCION D. ESTOS PRODUCTOS SE REQUIERE D. MAQUINARIA D. ALTO COSTO; RAZON POR LA QUE DOÑA RUTH  LA QUE  HA SOLICITADO CREDITO A  INTEGRAL.

DOÑA RUTH CON SU EXPERENCIA CREDITICIA Y LABORAL EN LA PANIFICACION  DESEA  ADQUIRIR UN HORNO CON MAYOR CAPACIDAD PARA HACER MAS PAN, PRODUCTO D. GRAN DEMANDA EN EL PAIS. Y POR LO TANTO OBTENER MAS GANANCIAS Y MEJORAR ASI EL NIVEL D. VIDA D. SUS DOS PEQUEÑOS HIJOS. ADEMAS D. APOYAR ECONOMICAMENTE A SU ESPOSO QUIEN SE DEDICA AL NEGOCIO AMBULANTE.
texts.en:
Ana Ruth V. D. A. is 36 years old. She has a small business in Ilopango making sweet rolls and French bread, both of which are considered part of the daily menu of Salvadoreans. She generally enjoys doing this in the mornings and the afternoons. However, producing these goods requires an expensive machine, which is the reason that Doña Ruth has requested a loan from Integral. Doña Ruth, with her credit history and experience making baked goods, would like to buy an oven with greater capacity so she can make more bread, which is a product in great demand in the country. This way she can make more earnings and improve the quality of life of her two small children as well as financially help her husband, who is a traveling salesman.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy an oven.

loans.name: Petronila De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Petronila R. tiene la edad de 60 años,  habita en el barrio los Ríos ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, ella es madre soltera tiene hijos pero todos están casado y le apoyan con los gastos del hogar .Ella desde hace quince años trabaja en  agricultura y comerciante ya que su esposo se dedicaba a los cultivos. La mayor necesidad ha sido la falta de financiamiento ya que los cultivos carecen de fertilizantes. Doña Petronila lleva un ciclo trabajando con nosotros y con la ayuda de nuestro asesor agrónomo a  recuperado el cultivos el cual esta vez vendió a un mejor precio y esta contenta. Con esta solicitud va invertir en los insumos agrícolas para abonar los cultivos y poder seguir adelante con sus objetivos de poder trabajar siempre las tierras, ya que es su sustento para su familia.
texts.en:
Petronila R. is 60 years old. She lives in the Los Ríos neighborhood located in the town of Ticuantepe. She is a single mother whose children are all married and help her with household expenses. For the past 15 years she has worked in agriculture and sales while her husband worked at farming. Her greatest need has been for financing, as her crops need fertilizers. Doña Petronila had a previous loan and with the help of our agricultural advisor her crops recovered. She is selling at a better price and is pleased. With this request, she will invest in agricultural supplies to fertilize her crops and keep going toward her objective of being able to always work her land, which is the family´s livelihood.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy agricultural supplies to improve production.

loans.name: Adelita

texts.es:
Doña Adelita  Gutiérrez  D. L. resiD. en el municipio  D. Soyapango,  uno D. los municipios mas poblados del departamento D. San Salvador. Ella  tiene una  pequeña tienda en al que  venD. productos perecederos como refrescos, golosinas, dulce y  otra serie D. artículos comestibles y no comestibles; a través D.  esta actividad comercial ha sacado adelante a su familia.

A sus 45 años y con un nivel académico D. secundaria,  doña Adelita busca mejorar su calidad D. vida, por lo que por segunda ocasión a solicitado a integral un micro crédito para incrementar la variedad D. artículos en su tienda, lo que le permitiría incrementar las ganancias D. su  negocio y tener un aporte económico mas sólido para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Adelita Gutiérrez D. L. resides in the town of Soyapango, one of the most populated towns in San Salvador. She owns a small shop where she sells perishable products such as refreshments, candy, sweets and other types of edible and non-edible items. Through this commercial activity, her family has gotten ahead. At 45 years of age and with a secondary school education, Adelita is looking to improve her quality of life. As a result, for the second time, she is requesting a microloan in order to increase the variety of articles in her store which will allow her to increase her business' earnings and have a more solid economic contribution for her family and her.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock.

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es:
Maria Josefa tiene un negocio de venta de productos de consumo diario en su casa, también vende tortillas y se dedica a la crianza de pollos.  Tiene cuatro hijos, todos estudian y su esposo le ayuda en sus negocios.

El préstamo lo necesita porque quiere ampliar su negocio de crianza de pollos, aprovechando que cuenta con un terreno más grande, ya que es su casa no tiene mas espacio.  

Su sueño es tener mucho éxito en sus negocios para bienestar de sus hijos y familia.
texts.en:
Maria Josefa has a business selling everyday products from her home. She also sells tortillas and raises chickens. She has four children, who are students, and her husband helps her with the business.

She needs this loan to grow her business raising chickens, taking advantage of a larger plot of land, since her house has little additional space.

Her dream is to be very successful in these businesses to support her children and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her businesses raising chickens and selling everyday products

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Juana Mercedes B. tiene la edad de 49 años, habita en el barrio San Ignacio ubicado en la concepción junto a su esposo el cual se desempeña como guarda de seguridad para poder apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen a su cargo un hijos el cual estudia actualmente . Los planes hacia un futuro es comprar más terreno para así poder darles la herencia a sus hijos que en total son cuatro. Ella inicio trabajando con sus padres los cuales le inculcaron trabajar sus propias tierras, los planes hacia un futuro es logar establecer una manzana de pitahaya,  Ella solicita financiamiento  para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de piña. Para sacara una buena producción y vender a mejor precio. Para cubrir las necesidades personales ya que es su fuente de subsistir. Gracias a  estos prestamos de Afodenic a podido salir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana Mercedes B. is 49 years old and lives with her husband in the San Ignacio neighborhood, located in La Concepción. Her husband works as a security guard to be able to provide for his family. They have one child in their care who is in school. Their plans for the future is to buy land so that they will be able to leave an inheritance for their children. They have four children all together. Juana began working with her parents who taught her how to work her own land. She would like to start a plot of "Pitahaya" (Dragon Fruit). She is asking a loan to be able to maintain her crop of pineapple and to be able to have a good harvest and to sell it at the best price possible. This crop is her main source of income and it allows her to provide for her family. Thanks to the loans given through Afodenic she has been able to get ahead in her business. (Translated by Alexis of San Roque School).

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy agricultural products to improve production

loans.name: Maria Clemencia

texts.es: Maria Clemencia es soltera pero una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora.  Desde hace 10 años vende verduras en el mercado municipal, sus principales ventas son de tomate, cebollas, papas y zanahorias.  Necesitas su préstamo porque quiere vender mas productos como es fríjol, maíz y concentrado para animales, ya que sus clientes se lo piden.   En su casa con su familia también se dedica a la crianza de marranos.  Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande, y aumentar sus ganancias y ventas.
texts.en:
Maria Clemencia is a single, hard-working and very responsible woman. She has sold vegetables in the municipal market for the last 10 years. Her principal sales are of tomatoes, onions, potatoes and carrots.

She needs this loan to sell more products like beans, corn, and animal feed, as these are the products her customers request.

At her home, she also raises pigs with her family. Her dream is to have a bigger business, and to grow her earnings and sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business selling vegetables and offer more products

loans.name: José Andrés

texts.es:
A SUS 58 AÑOS Y CON CUATRO PERSONAS A SU CARGO, DON JOSE ANDRES E. HERNANDEZ, UN HOMBRE CON BASTA EXPERIENCIA EN EL OFICIO DE LAS ESTRUCTURAS METALICAS, DESEA INCREMENTAR  LA MATERIA PRIMA DE SU TALLER Y CONTAR CON UN EQUIPO ADECUADO PARA FABRICAR PUERTAS, BALCONES Y BARROTES. 

MOTIVO POR EL QUE SOLICITA A INTEGRAL UN PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR LAS HERRAMIENTAS NECESARIAS  Y  DESARROLLAR SU TRABAJO EFECTIVAMENTE.

SU  TALLER DE ESTRUCTURAS METALICAS ESTA UBICADO EN SOYAPANGO,  LUGAR DONDE ES SU MISMA CASA DE HABITACION.  

DON JOSE DESEA BRINDARLES UNA MEJOR VIDA A SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
At 58 years and with four people under him, Don Jose Andres E. Hernandez is a man with plenty of experience in the field of metal structures.

He would like to increase the amount of raw materials in his shop and to rely on a competent team to make doors, balconies, and bars. With this loan, he would like to buy necessary tools and to effectively develop his business. His metal shop is located in Soyapango, where his home is located as well.

Don Jose would like to offer his family a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials and a compressor

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
Ana Francisca García vive en el departamento de Soyapango, en la zona central del país. Desde hace ya varios años atrás, Ana Francisca es madre soltera y vive con su hija la cual es empleada en un hospital de la capital. A pesar de contar solo con un nivel de educación primario, Ana ha mantenido a su hija, montando su propio negocio en casa, una tienda de productos de primera necesidad.
Ana solicita un préstamo para comprar nuevos insumos y poder renovar su mercadería, a fin de 
impulsar el crecimiento de su negocio y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Francisca García lives in the Soyapango area, in the central zone of the country. For many years, Ana Francisca has been a single mother living with her daughter, who is an employee of a hospital in the capital.

Although she only has completed a primary level of education, Ana has supported her daughter and launched her own business at home, a store for everyday products.

Ana seeks this loan to buy new ingredients and to be able to renew her merchandise, to drive growth in her business and the quality of life of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Resources for her store

loans.name: Yojana Karina

texts.es: Yojana Karina es soltera, y su negocio es hacer y vender tortillas en su casa y también entrega pedidos a otros negocios de venta de comida.  También se dedica a hacer tejidos a mano como lo son servilletas y manteles.  El préstamo lo necesita para comprar maíz y leña, ya que estos materiales han subido mucho de precio, y quiere comprarlos por mayor o por volumen para obtener un mejor precio y así tener más ganancias.  Ella por las tardes estudia y su deseo es superarse en la vida continuando con sus estudios
texts.en:
Yojana Karina is single, and her business is to make and sell tortillas in her home and to also deliver orders to other food sales companies. She also hand-makes textiles like napkins and tablecloths.

She seeks this loan to buy corn and firewood, as the prices for these items have risen substantially, and she wants to buy these wholesale or in bulk to obtain a better price and thus increase her earnings.

She studies in the afternoons and her desire is to excel in her life continuing with her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials for her business making tortillas

loans.name: Rita Lorena

texts.es: Doña Rita es una señora que se ha esforzado para tener su propio negocio elabora repostería y bocadillos desde hace dieciséis años que inicio vendiendo repostería para criar a sus hijos, resise en batahola norte con cuatro hijos que están casados y que le ayudan económicamente. Con esta solicitud desea cambiar el techo de su casa, ya que esta en mal estado y espera estar preparada para estas lluvia de mayo para estos necesita comprar materiales de construcción. Sus planes es poder buscar nuevos clientes y incrementar el volumen de ventas para obtener mejores ingresos. Su objetivo a futuro es poder remodelar su casa
texts.en:
Rita is a woman who has worked hard to have her own business making pastries and sandwiches. Sixteen years ago, she started selling pastries in order to care for her children. She lives in Batahola Norte with her four children who are married and who help her financially. With this loan, she would like to change the roof of her house, which is in poor condition. She hopes to be prepared for the May rains, so she needs to buy construction materials. She also plans to look for new clients and increase the volume of her sales to earn more profit. Her future goal is to remodel her house.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina A., a 29-year-old trader, is the married mother of two children, one an infant and the other a six-year-old student. She has been selling large quantities of vegetables such as onions, tomatoes and peppers for the past 10 years at the Abofour community market, and the income from this business has enabled her to finance her husband’s renting of a retail store.

Augustina is now requesting a loan to purchase an increased stock of tomatoes, onions, and peppers to expand her business. She hopes to increase her income and savings to support the children’s education to give them a future filled with hope. Her picture was taken when she was going to the market.

loans.use: To increase her stock of onions, tomatoes and peppers.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: Carmen Rosa vende comida rápida en la escuela de su comunidad a los niños estudiantes.  También tiene una 	venta de comida en el mercado de la localidad.  Ella tiene 3 hijos y todos están estudiando el mayor tiene 17 años de edad y esta estudiando para maestro.  Ella necesita el préstamo para compara mas productos como aguas gaseosas, verduras, arroz y fríjol.  Su sueño es hacer mas grande su negocio y tener mas ingresos para sacar adelante a sus hijos con una buena educación, ella no cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposo, su familia ha salida adelante gracias a Dios y a su esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa sells fast food to students at her local school. She also sells food in her community market. She has 3 children who are all in school. The eldest is 17 years old and is studying to become a teacher. She needs this loan in order to purchase more products, such as soft drinks, vegetables, rice and beans. Her dream is to expand her business and increase profits so that she can help her children get ahead with a good education. She does not have financial support from her husband. Her family has been able to move forward thanks to God, her efforts, and her job.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods for fast food business

loans.name: Efrosinia

texts.en: Efrosinia is very hard-working person. Her whole life living in her village has been working in agriculture, namely with vegetables and seeds. She is the mother of three children that she has to support. The business location is in Cantemir district, Costangalia village. She likes the job she does and her future plan is to increase the family budget because her husband has not been able to work after he suffered an accident last year, so Ms. C. is the head of the family and the future of her family depends on her, so she decided to ask for a loan. The purpose of the loan is to increase working capital because she faces some problems. Her field is infertile and she does not have enough money to buy fuel to irrigate the field.

loans.use: increase working capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth K., the 30-year-old married mother of a child currently in school, lives with her son in Abofour, a community in the Ashanti region of Ghana. A very skilled and talented hair dresser, Elizabeth has owned and operated a beauty salon for the past four years, adding beauty and style to the hair of her customers.

She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service, and therefore is requesting a loan to buy larger quantities of hair products such as weavons, pomade, shampoo, activators etc. to provide quality service to her customers. She hopes to thereby increase income and savings, eventually including the sale of grocery products in her business.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products such as weavons, pomade, shampoo, activators etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more products for her tortilla and fast food businesses

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A., a 31-year-old married mother of two children, both in school, lives in Abofour, a busy farming community and suburb of Offinso, located in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

For the past seven years Elizabeth has being selling gari and beans with ripe plantain in Abofour’s community market. Gari and beans are enjoyed by many Ghanaians because they are both affordable and high in protein, and the success of her business is attributable both to her good customer relations and the tasty meals she cooks.

Elizabeth is requesting the loan to buy foodstuffs including gari, plantain, and beans as well as charcoal. It is her dream to develop the business to its full potential in order to ensure her children’s ongoing education.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs such as gari, plantains and beans.

loans.name: Diana Aimee

texts.es:
Diana Aimee R. vive en el municipio de Soyapango en el departamento de San Salvador.
El ánimo y espíritu para superarse lo recibe diariamente en los ojos de su hijita Marcela, de tan solo ocho años de edad. Marcela cursa el cuarto grado y recién empieza a aprender aritmética.
Diana Aimee ha luchado por años dándole a Marcela una vida  digna, abriendo un pequeño negocio de artesanías en el mercado de Soyapango, donde vende artículos de barro y decoración ornamental. Con este puesto de artesanías, Diana Aimee ha logrado costearse  educación superior, y está cerca de graduarse en contaduría pública en la Universidad Don Bosco.
Diana solicita un préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio y cubrir sus múltiples gastos, y a la vez, le permita graduarse de la universidad y convertirse en el ejemplo que su hijita merece.
texts.en:
Diana Aimee R. lives in San Salvador area in the municipality of Soyapango. Everyday, she finds the courage and spirit to improve her life when she looks into the eyes of her young daughter, Marcela, who is only eight years old. Marcela is in the fourth grade and she just started learning arithmetic. Diana Aimee has fought for years to give Marcela a good life, by opening a small handicrafts business in the Soyapango market, where she sells clay products and ornamental decorations. With this handicrafts business, Diana Aimee has been able to pay the costs of her higher education and is about to graduate with a degree in public accounting from the Don Bosco University. Diana is requesting a loan to reinvest in her business and cover her various expenses and, at the same time, allow her to graduate from the university and become the example her little daughter deserves.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clay handicrafts

loans.name: Kantuta Group

texts.es: El grupo "Kantuta " esta representado por la señora Sonia e integrada por 13 personas que residen en la provincia D. Sacaba y gozan D. confianza como grupo. Una mayoría D. las socias se dedica al comercio D. productos como ropa, verduras, azúcar, arroz, comida y los varones se dedican a actividades como el servicio público D. transporte y a la construcción D. viviendas. A los integrantes del grupo no les molesta la competencia ya que gozan con muchos años D. experiencia en su negocio. El crédito esta destinado a la compra D. materiales e insumos para incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad D. vida y la D. sus familias. Los socios van cumpliendo su segundo ciclo por lo que cuentan con experiencia para el manejo D. fondos y también para cumplir a tiempo con sus obligaciones
texts.en:
The group "Kantuta" is represented by Sonia and maD. up of 13 people who live in the Sacaba province and have confidence as a group. The majority of the members are dedicated to selling products like clothing, vegetables, surgar, rice, and the others are dedicated to activities like public transportation services and building homes. The competency doesn't bother the members since they come with many years of experience in their business. The loan is destined to buying more materials and supplies to increase their incomes and improve their quality of life and that of their families. The members are completing their second cycle, for which they count on their experience to drive the funds and also to complete all of their obligations on time.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Tamara Liseth

texts.es: La joven Tamara tiene 20 años de edad, reside en el barrio Isaías Gómez, madre soltera con una niña de 2 meses, pues para poder darle los alimentos a su hija y subsistir independientemente de su mama, trabaja con ella en el negocio de fritanga, que inicio desde hace cuatro años, lo cual ahora son socias, y con esta solicitud que esta haciendo es para comprar mesa, sillas y una cocina industrial para elaborar los ricos platillos, y poder dar un mejor servicios a su clientela, gracias a Afodenic va a poder lograr esta inversión que espera en un futuro crecer mas en su negocio para poder obtener mejores ganancias para ayudar a su bebe que no le falte nada. Ya que su papa no le brinda ni el amor ni el cuidado alimenticio pero espera demostrar ser una madre honorable y trabajadora para su hija, ya que también tiene el apoyo de su mama.
texts.en:
Ms. Tamara C., a 20-year-old single mother with a 2-month-old daughter, lives in the Isaías Gómez neighborhood. In order to provide for her child and not depend on her mother, she works alongside her mother selling fried food. Her mother started the business four years ago, and now they are partners. She will use this loan to buy tables, chairs and an industrial stove in order to prepare delicious dishes and provide better customer service. Thanks to Afodenic, she will be able to make this investment, which she hopes will make her business grow in the future so that she can earn bigger profits. She wants to give her baby what she needs since her baby’s father gives her neither love nor support. She hopes to be able to demonstrate to her daughter what an honorable and hard-working mother she is. Thankfully, she also has her mother’s support.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plastic tables and chairs

loans.name: Sirenitas Group

texts.es: El grupo " SIRENITAS" esta representado por la señora Ana Luisa y conformado por doce miembros los cuales se dedican exclusivamente a la venta y comercialización D. pescado en el mercado. Dentro del ámbito del la venta del pescado existe mucha competencia pero el consumo D. este producto tienen mucha demanda por lo que logran terminar la venta del todo el producto en el día procurando siempre tener un producto fresco al día siguiente. El financiamiento esta destinado a incrementar su producto debido a la gran demanda en el mercado  y así poder incrementar sus ingresos para poder darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad D. vida. Los socios (as) tienen experiencia trabajando con grupos solidarios ya que contaban con otros créditos en instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital en la cual van cursando juntos su primer ciclo, los socios (as) cuentan con experiencia para administrar sus fondos y con la responsabilidad para cumplir con sus obligaciones
texts.en:
The Sirenitas group is represented by Ana Luisa and formed of twelve members who are dedicated exclusively to selling fish in the market. In this environment of selling fish exists a lot of competition, but the consumption of this product has a lot of demand so they are able to sell all of the product the day they get it and always have fresh products the next day. The financing is destined to increase their product owing to the large demand in the market and so they can increase their incomes to be able to give their children a better quality of life. The members have experience working with solidarity groups and already have loans with other institutions similar to the Agrocapital Foundation, with which they go together for the first time, the members count on their experience to administer their funds with responsibility to complete their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Rosa Ivania

texts.es: La sra. Rosa una mujer que a sus 42 años de edad, sigue trabajado para obtener un nivel de vida con su familia estable ya que la vida y los costos están caros, ella vende productos de cosméticos y alquila cuartos, reside en laureles norte, con un hijo de 12 años de edad, su esposo es conductor de bus, doña Rosa inicio hace muchos años y tiene su clientela vende al contado y al crédito, los cosméticos, con ahorro que el esposo le dio. Con esta solicitud va a comprar cosméticos y perfúmenes, para ofertar a sus clientes. Sus planes a futuro es poder remodelar los cuartos que alquila para dar un buen servicio y poder elevar el costo.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa L. is a 42-year-old woman who, despite her age, continues to work in order to provide financial stability for her family because the cost of living is so high. She sells cosmetics and rents out rooms for a living. She lives in Laureles Norte with her 12-year-old son and her husband, who is a bus driver. Ms. L. started her business several years ago, and has a solid client-base. She accepts cash and credit payments for her cosmetics, which she purchased with money that her husband had given her. With this loan, she will purchase cosmetics and fragrances to sell them to her customers. Her future plan is to remodel the rooms that she rents out so that she can provide better service and raise the rent.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics and fragrances

loans.name: Anyell

texts.es: La joven Anyell tiene 27 años de edad, reside en villa Venezuela, casada y con una niña, su esposo se desempaña de albañil, ella trabaja de impulsadora en  una empresa  Unilever desde hace tres años, su anhelo  es poder terminar de hacer su casa, y tener mas seguridad `por la delincuencia, este es su tercer quinta solicitud que han sido de mucho beneficio ya que con cada préstamo hace una mejora a su casa, con esta préstamo va comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un muro en la parte frontal lo cual va a comprar piedra, arena, cemento y otros. Sus planes hacia un futuro es poder echar muro a todo alrededor de la casa lo cual va ir poco a poco con el apoyo de préstamo que Afodenic le otorgue.
texts.en:
Anyell is 27 years old and lives in the town of Venezuela. She is married with one daughter. Her husband works as a bricklayer and she has worked as a sales promoter with a company called Unilever for the past three years. She wants to be able to finish her house and for it to be more secure. This is her fifth loan—the loans have been very beneficial because each time she completes a home improvement project. With this loan she is going to buy construction materials to build a wall in front of her home. She will buy rocks, sand, cement and other materials. In the future she plans to extend the wall around her entire home, which she will complete part-by-part with the help of the Afodenic loans.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a fence

loans.name: Adela De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Adela de los Ángeles M. es una dama originaria de la ciudad de León y se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de verduras y frutas ubicado en el mercado La Terminal donde todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana atiende con mucho entusiasmo y entrega por su negocio. 

Las frutas y verduras son vendidas desde temprano y al atardecer cuando las ventas se agotan ella busca su hogar pensando en el trabajo del día siguiente volviéndose esta una rutina para la señora Adela por ser una persona muy trabajadora. 

La razón por la que ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de las verduras y frutas para continuar con su negocio brindando las condiciones necesarias a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adela de los Ángeles M. is originally from the city of Leon and she works hard attending to her business selling fruits and vegetables in the market La Terminal. Every day, very early in the morning, she goes to work with a lot of enthusiasm and devotes herself to her work. The fruits and vegetables are sold from early in the morning until dusk. When she runs out, she returns home thinking about tomorrow's work. She lives in this routine because she's a very hard-working woman. She has come to Ceprodel to benefit from a loan that will allow her to buy more fruits and vegetables. This will allow her to continue her business, providing for the necessities of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
En el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León, la señora Ana Patricia H. se dedica arduamente a su negocio de venta de bebidas como gaseosas y también a la venta de caramelos siendo este su único sustento con el cual beneficia a su familia compuesta por sus dos hijos en edad escolar.

Es importante destacar que ella ha sido una dama muy inteligente y antes de dedicarse a este negocio ella se dedicaba a estudiar pero por el deber de mantener a sus pequeños ingresó a esta actividad. Hoy en día la razón por la que espera en Ceprodel es para que se le brinde un crédito el cual será utilizado en la compra de los productos para así continuar con su respectiva comercialización en el mercado donde ella se desmpeña.
texts.en:
In the market La Terminal in the city of León, Mrs. Ana Patricia H. dedicates herself to her business selling sodas and candy. This is her only means of support for her family, composed of her two school-aged children. It's important emphasize that she is a very intelligent lady and before she started this business, she was a dedicated student. Out of the need to provide for her little ones, she began this business. Nowadays, she puts her hope in Ceprodel to have a loan which will be used to buy products to continue growing her business in the market where she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sodas and candy

loans.name: Francis Lisbeth

texts.es:
En el Mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León la señora Francis C. desde hace 12 años se dedica a su actividad económica de elaboración de productos lácteos como lo son el queso y cuajada siendo comercializados por ella misma en su tramo el cual es muy visitado por sus clientes. 

A través de los años y gracias a sus grandes esfuerzos el negocio de venta de lácteos ha venido mejorando su condición y hoy en día es una de las mejores comerciantes que ofrecen deliciosos quesos y cuajadas. Hoy en día espera que su crédito sea otorgado con el propósito de comprar los lácteos para seguir elaborando las deliciosas cuajadas  y queso del mercado.
texts.en:
In the market La Terminal in the city of León, Mrs. Francis C. has dedicated herself for 12 years to the production of dairy products, such as cheese and curd, sold by Francis herself at a location well-visited by her clients. Through the years, thanks to her great effort, her business selling dairy products has improved. Nowadays, it's one of the best businesses that offer delicious cheeses and curds. She hopes her loan will be granted so that she will be able to buy more milk to continue improving her delicious cheeses and curds.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk

loans.name: Gladis Ernestina

texts.es:
La elaboración de alimentos es una actividad que requiere de mucha dedicación por el motivo de que se deben preparar con alta calidad para lograr la satisfacción del cliente. En el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León, la señora Gladis A. se dedica al negocio de elaboración y venta de comida para ofrecerla todos los días al personal que visita el mercado.

Sus inicios fueron muy difíciles para ella pero a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo ha logrado obtener firmeza en su negocio y esto gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado Ceprodel y una vez más solicita un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de dichos alimentos en su localidad.
texts.en:
The production of food is an activity that requires a lot of dedication because food should be prepared with high quality to satisfy the customer. In the market La Terminal in the city of León, Mrs. Gladis A. dedicates herself to the production and sale of food to offer food every day to the people that visit the market. Her start was difficult for her but over time she has been able to obtain security in her business, thanks to the support that Ceprodel has offered her. Once again, she's requesting a loan to buy more ingredients for the preparation of food in her town.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: La señora Andrea V. O. tiene la edad de 49 años, habita en el barrio el edén Ubicado en el municipio de de Ticuantepe, ella es madre soltera, sus hijos son mayores de edad, y le apoyan con los gastos del hogar, los planes hacia su familia es establecer mas cultivo para obtener mas ganancia y comprar mas tierras y heredar a cada uno de sus hijos. Desde hace quince años trabaja como agricultura y comerciante, ella inicio con el apoyo de su hermana; ella solicita financiamiento para la compra  de fertilizantes y poder vender la cosecha a mejor precio
texts.en:
Mrs. Andrea V. O. is 49 years old and lives in the edén neighborhood. Located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She is a single mother to her grown children and she helps them with household expenses. Her plans for her family’s future are to plant more crops in order to earn more. Then she will purchase more land and divide it among her children. For fifteen years she has worked as a farmer and a businesswoman. She started [her business] with the help of her sister. She is asking for this loan to buy fertilizer in order to sell her harvest at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Jacinta Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Jacinta Gonzales  se dedica a su negocio de venta de bebidas como jugos y gaseosas atendidos en su localidad en el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León. Ella se ha caracterizado por ser una dama muy trabajadora y como toda mujer nicaragüense, siempre se ha preocupado por llevar el sustento a sus hijos los cuales requieren de su apoyo.

Es importante destacar que actualmente el negocio atraviesa una situación y es que requiere del apoyo financiero para su desarrollo por medio de la compra de las bebidas gaseosas. Por esto ella ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel esperando que le sea otorgado y así mejorar su condición en su negocio.
texts.en:
Jacinta Gonzales sells soft drinks, such as juice and soda, at La Terminal Market in the city of León. She is a uniquely hardworking woman and, like all Nicaraguan women, she takes great care in raising her children (all of whom are still dependent on her). It is important to understand that her business is in a situation and needs financial support to develop and purchase soft drinks. She has requested a loan through Ceprodel with the hope that it will be granted and improve her business's situation.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing soft drinks.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Juan Antonio F. es padre de familia  con dos hijos en su deber de mantener y brindarles la alimentación que ellos requieren. Él se dedica hoy en día a la venta de gaseosas en el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León donde es visitado por sus clientes y además ofrece el producto abasteciendo otros negocios al por mayor.

Con mucha necesidad ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito que le permita la compra de gaseosas para su venta y por esto espera que su crédito sea otorgado y así salir adelante en su negocio brindándole de igual manera mejores condiciones de vida a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio F. is the father of a family with two children. He is responsible for maintaining the family and providing all their food. He sells soft drinks at La Terminal Market in the city of León, where he sells to individual customers and also supplies other businesses with wholesale soft drinks. He came to Ceprodel in need of much help, and requested a loan that would allow him to purchase soft drinks for his business. He hopes that the loan will be granted to help him keep his business afloat and, at the same time, improve living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing soft drinks.

loans.name: Magda

texts.es:
En el Mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León, la señora Magda L. J. se dedica a su negocio de venta de gaseosas y jugos comercializados en su propio tramo donde atiende muy amablemente a toda su clientela que visita el mercado para realizar sus compras.

La señora Magda a sus 53 años de edad ha logrado salir adelante en el negocio y esto lo ha llevado a cabo con el apoyo brindado por Ceprodel el cual le ha otorgado créditos que han sido muy bien utilizados para su desarrollo.
Hoy en día la razón por la cual ella espera en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un nuevo crédito y así comprar los productos como bebidas gaseosas y jugos y salir adelante en su negocio
texts.en:
In La Terminal Market in the city of León, Magda L. J. sells commercial sodas and juice in her own area where she gives friendly service to her customers when they come to the market to make purchases. Magda, at fifty-three years old, has succeeded in keeping her business afloat. She has done this with the help of Ceprodel, which has granted her loans in the past -- all of which she has used very well to develop her business. Now she looks to Ceprodel with the hope that she will benefit from a new loan as it enables her to purchase merchandise like soda and juice so that her business will survive.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing soft drinks.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora María Eugenia A. es una dama que se dedica a su actividad de venta de alimentos preparados por ella misma los cuales son vendidos en su propio tramo en el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León donde labora desde hace treinta años.

Su vasta experiencia en la elaboración de los alimentos ha hecho que la señora Eugenia sea catalogada como una excelente cocinera en su sector. Ella ha acudido a Ceprodel hoy en día con el único propósito de ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos. Con el crédito se beneficia grandemente porque logra elaborar los alimentos y de esta manera venderlos.
texts.en:
María Eugenia A. makes and sells prepared foods in her own area in La Terminal Market in the city of León, where she has worked for thirty years. Her vas experience in food preparation comes from being known as a wonderful cook in her area. She has come to Ceprodel with the intention of benefiting from a loan that will allow her to purchase raw materials for making the dishes she sells. This loan will be an enormous help to her in preparing food and selling it.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raw materials for making her prepared foods.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo is 23 years old and lives in Soyapango, a city outside of the capital of San Salvador, El Salvador. He buys and sells corn to distribute in the communities in Soyapango. Together with beans and rice, corn is the most important food in the diet of Salvadorans.

With this loan from Kiva, Pablo hopes to increase his corn sales and produce more tamales in his home. Tamales are especially profitable for him because the insides of this traditional Latin American food consist primarily of corn! Although this is not his first micro-credit (Pablo has had 3 in the past), he hopes that the increase in his business will help him repair his broken-down car.

loans.use: Buy more corn to increase his sales

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El señor Miguel Ángel A. B. tiene la edad de 42 años,  habita en el barrio Pablo Calero ubicado en municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa , la esposa trabaja como comerciante ,para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar . Los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida para que sus hijas tengan una mejor educación. Don Miguel de la edad de diez años trabaja en el campo ya que sus padres le enseñaron  a trabajar la tierra. El también tiene una producción agrícola  y produce unos seis bidones de miel, lo cual negocia obteniendo de esta manera otros ingresos adicionales .con esta solicitud es para comprar insumos agrícolas para la producción, lo cual quiere que su cosecha sea buena para vender en el mercado a buen precio.
texts.en:
Mr. Miguel Angel A. B. is 42 years old and lives in the Pablo Calero neighborhood located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. He lives with his wife, who works in business to help him with the household expenses. His plans for his family are to improve their quality of life and give his daughters a better education. Miguel began working in the fields when he was 10 years old—it was his parents who taught him how to work with the earth. He work in farming and also produces honey, which he sells to bring in extra income. With this loan he will buy farming supplies so his harvest will be good and he can sell it for a good price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Mariela De La Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Mariela O. se dedica a su actividad de venta de especies como lo son salsas de tomate, mostaza, vinagre, salsas dulces, entre otras. A este negocio se dedica desde hace varios años y es importante destacar que sus inicios fueron muy difíciles pero con su gran esfuerzo logró salir adelante y ampliar sus productos.

La razón por la que  hoy en día la señora Mariela ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le servirá para la compra de las especies ya que hoy en día le urge dicha compra para continuar así con el sustento de su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariela O. works selling spices like tomato sauces, mustards, vinegar, sweet sauces, etc. She has worked in this business for the past few years and it is important to note that it was very difficult at first, but with her good effort she was able to move forward and increase her products. The reason Mariela has approached Ceprodel is to benefit from a loan that she will use to purchase more spices. It is important that she buy these spices as an investment to sustain her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy spices

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
La elaboración de tortillas es un digno negocio al que se dedica gran parte de las mujeres en Nicaragua y en este caso la señora María Luisa M. se dedica a realizar unas deliciosas tortillas en la ciudad de León el cual son comercializadas por ella misma y así mantiene a su familia compuesta por sus dos pequeños hijos ya que por ser madre soltera hace el papel de padre y madre a la vez.

El motive por el que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito con el cual comprar la materia prima principal como es el maíz para luego molerlo y así elaborar las tortillas que tanto agradan a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Tortilla making is a good business, and one in which many women in Nicaragua work. María Luisa M. makes delicious tortillas which she markets herself in the city of León. This is how she, as a single mother playing the role of both father and mother at once, supports her two small children. She came to Ceprodel to request a loan with which to buy raw materials -- mainly corn, which she grinds and then uses to make the tortillas that are so pleasing to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing corn

loans.name: Marvin Bernardo

texts.es:
Marvin Bernardo A. es un joven casado y con tres hijos que se dedica a su actividad de servicio de reparacion de bicicletas en el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León donde es muy visitado por ser un buen trabajador y por tener amplia experiencia en el trabajo con las bicicletas.

Como todo negocio en desarrollo, el taller de Marvin requiere de la inversión para la compra de repuestos para venta y a la vez para compra de herramientas de trabajo y es por este motive que él ha acudido a Ceprodel esperando que su crédito le sea otorgado y así mejorar el servicio de reparación de bicicletas en su localidad.
texts.en:
Marvin Bernardo A. is young, married, and has three children. He has a bicycle repair service in La Terminal Market in the city of León, where he has a lot of business, since he is a good worker and has extensive experience working with bikes.
