Since it is a developing businesses, Marvin's repair shop needs funds to purchase spare parts to sell at his shop, and also tools for servicing the bikes. This is why he has looked to Ceprodel, hoping that his loan will be granted and allow him to improve the bicycle repair shop he runs in his town.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing replacement bicycle parts to sell, and tools for his bicycle repair service.

loans.name: Mayela Cayetana

texts.es:
La señora Mayela Cayetana E. labora en el mercado La Terminal de León dedicándose a la venta de dulces como galletas, caramelos, chiches, entre otros.

Ella ha laborado desde hace tres años en este negocio y ha logrado suplir las necesidades que a diario atraviesa su familia. Hoy en día el motivo por el cual una vez más acude a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las especies y así ofertarlas. Es importante destacar que con el crédito que le brinde la institución ella a lo inmediato comprará las especias dando lugar a su venta.
texts.en:
Mayela Cayetana E. works in the La Terminal market in León, selling sweets like cookies, caramels, gum, and other things. She has worked for three years in this business and has been able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Now she has come to Ceprodel once more to request a loan to buy spices so she can sell them. Is it important to point out that she use the loan from this institution to buy spices right away so that she can sell her goods.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets

loans.name: Nubia De Los Santos

texts.es:
La señora Nubia S. con mucho esfuerzo se dedica a laborar en su negocio de venta de agua, jugos y gaseosas teniendo su propio establecimiento en el Mercado la Terminal de la ciudad de León.

ES importante destacar que ella a pesar de su larga edad siempre está deseosa de continuar con su trabajo y ha buscado la manera de seguir adelante mejorando su situación económica. Para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito con el cual compra las bebidas, gaseosas y el agua y de esta manera ofrecerlos en su negocio.
texts.en:
Nubia S. works very hard selling water, juice, and soft drinks. She has her own establishment in the La Terminal Market in the city of León. It is important to point out that, despite the fact that she is older, she wants to continue her work and has looked for a way to advance by improving her economic situation. For that, she has come to Ceprodel to get a loan so she can buy beverages, soft drinks, and water, and sell them at her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drinks

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
En el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León, la señora Rafaela M. desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de productos personales como lo son colas, aretes, peines y cosméticos siendo comercializados en un puesto fijo en el mercado.

Por ser una señora muy trabajadora ha buscado la forma de salir adelante y para esto requiere de la compra de los productos y es por esto que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel esperando ser beneficiada con un crédito para llevar a cabo dicha compra y de esta manera mejorar la condición de su negocio que tanto requiere de su inversión.
texts.en:
Rafaela M. has been selling personal products for 8 years in the La Terminal market in the city of León, such as hair accessories, earrings, and cosmetics, which are sold at a stand at the market. Because she is a very hardworking woman, she has found a way to advance and to do this, she needs to buy products. It is because of this that she has come to Ceprodel, hoping to be granted a loan to make said purchases and thus improve the condition of her business, which requires such an investment.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy personal products

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Pablo Antonio L. Alemán tiene la edad de 37 años, habita en el barrio san caralampio ubicado en la Concepción junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como domestica para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, .Ellos tiene a su cargo tres hijos los cuales estudia su secundaria actualmente,  los planes hacia su familia es salir hacia delante con la producción  para apoyar a sus hijos económicamente en sus estudios , la mayor dificultad que ha tenido que las plagas le afectaron sus cultivos y la falta de financiamiento . Desde hace seis años se dedica a la agricultura. El solicita financiamiento para poder aplicárselo a los cultivos y no seguir perdiendo producción. Ya que es su fuente de subsistencia para su familia. Es por ello que da agracias a Afodenic por el apoyo que brinda mediante el préstamo que será de mucho beneficios para su producción
texts.en:
Mr. Pablo Antonio L. Alemán is a 37-year-old man who lives in the San Caralampio neighborhood, located in La Concepción, with his family. His wife works as a housekeeper, and they have three children who are currently in high school. His family plans include moving forward with crop production so that he can financially support his children’s studies. The biggest problem he faces is that pest insects have affected his crops, and he does not have enough money to deal with the problem. He has been working in agriculture for six years. He is requesting this loan in order to use it for his crops, thus thwarting losses. Agriculture is his family’s source of income. For this reason, he gives thanks to Afodenic for the support it gives him via this loan, which will be of great benefit for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase agricultural supplies to improve crop production

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora María Guadalupe tiene su negocio propio de farmacia y abarrotes en su domicilio, ella tiene el proyecto de crecer con su negocio y por ello le dedica tiempo, esfuerzo y constancia porque sabe que luchando día con día se pueden lograr los objetivos, ella y su esposo están solicitando este crédito para  invertir  en la compra de mas mercancía  para atraer a la clientela que siempre encuentran lo que buscan  y se van satisfechos con la atención de sus propietarios.
texts.en:
María Guadalupe has her own pharmacy and grocery store in her home. She has a project to grow her business, and she dedicates her time, effort and perseverance because she knows that by fighting every day she can achieve her objectives. She and her husband are asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of more merchandise to attract customers so that they always find what they are looking for and leave satisfied with the service they receive.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in merchandise for her business

loans.name: María

texts.es:
La dama María A. es originaria de la ciudad de León y se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de gaseosas, jugos y agua el cual posee en su propio local en el mercado La Terminal. Es importante destacar que Ceprodel le ha apoyado grandemente por la razón de que le ha brindado créditos que los ha utilizado en la compra de refrigeradoras y productos.

Hoy en día el motivo por el cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita la compra de las bebidas. Es importante destacar que su mamá posee también un negocio de venta de comida y ambas se han destacado por ser excelentes comerciantes en su sector.
texts.en:
María A. comes from the city of León and works selling soft drinks, juices, and water at her own stand at the La Terminal market. It is important to point out that Ceprodel has given her great support by granting her loans that she has used to buy refrigerators and products. Now, she has come to Ceprodel because she would like a loan that allows her to purchase drinks. It is important to point out that her mother also has a business that sells food and both of these women are recognized as excellent business owners in their sector.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products

loans.name: María Ignacia

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA MARIA IGNACIA RODRÍGUEZ D. A.   D. 36 AÑOS D. EDAD, TIENE SU PROPIO TALLER D. COSTURA, EN EL QUE SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCIÓN D. UNIFORMES Y PRENDAS D. VESTIR,  A TRAVÉS D. ESTA ACTIVIDAD BRINDA ESTUDIO A SU HIJO MENOR.

DOÑA MARIA  RESID. EL MUNICIPIO D. TONACATEPEQUE, EN EL DEPARTAMENTO D. SAN SALVADOR Y TIENE UN AMPLIO RECORD CREDITICIO CON MAS D. QUINCE INSTITUCIONES FINANACIERAS. 

HOY POR HOY LLEVA EL  TERCER CRÉDITO CON INTEGRAL; EL CUAL HA SIDO SOLICITADO PARA LA COMPRA D. MATERIA PRIMA, YA QUE EL ENCARGO D. LOS UNIFORMES PARA ESTA ÉPOCA DEL AÑO ES D. GRAN DEMANDA.
texts.en:
María Ignacia R. D. A. is 36 years old. She has her own sewing workshop, where she makes uniforms and clothing. This business has helped her make her young son's studies possible. María lives in the San Salvador area in the municipality of Tonacatepeque, and she has an extensive credit history with more than fifteen financial institutions. At this point in time, she has her third loan with Integral, which she has requested so she can buy raw materials since uniforms are in high demand at this time of year.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make uniforms

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora María del Socorro E. tiene la edad de 38 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña María tiene 1 hijo de la edad de 10 años y cursa el 3 grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora como ganadero, sus propósitos son de aumentar mas sus ganancias para sobrellevar la difícil situación del país ya que tiene que responsabilizarse por la manutención de sus hijos, sus sueños son de poseer estabilidad familiar por lo que hay muchos problemas entre ellos y le gustaría que algún día todos pudieran vivir unidos en una misma vivienda, sus deseos son de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia ya que todos dependen de Doña María para realizar los gastos de su vivienda y su esposo le ayuda en lo que puede para que así juntos puedan sufragar los gastos de la familia también en sus deseos esta que su hijo pueda preparase para que sea un hombre que pueda servir con honor a su país.  

La actividad económica a la que Doña María se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general, la ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante, el tiempo que tiene  de poseer este negocio es de 9 años, Doña María dio inicio por motivo propio ya que tenia que buscar la forma de mantener a su familia y decide realizar la compra de ropa ya que no poseía el capital suficiente para comprar los suficientes productos y dio inicio con: ropa interior, pantalones y camisas para jóvenes por lo que recurrió a sus vecinos y amigos y mas por lo que mas tarde decide recurrir a los mercados para ofrecer sus productos ya que es aquí donde obtiene mas afluencias de clientes y cada día luchaba por obtener mas mercadería para mantener este negocio por lo que le gusto como medio de vida y como obtención de sus propósitos y mas tarde decide incrementar mas en su mercadería por lo que sus clientes le promocionaban una alta demanda, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo propuesto para la compra de mas productos como: cosméticos, ropa para niños, camisas para jóvenes, pantalones para caballeros y otro productos por lo que también viaja a Managua en busca de lo mas favorable.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria del Socorro E. is 38 years old. She is married and has one son who is ten year old. Her son is in the third grade and her husband works as a livestock farmer. Her goal is to increase her income and to be able to overcome the difficult economic situation in her country. Her dream is to be able to give her family a more stable life, since there are many problems in her family and she wishes that some day everyone will be able to live in the same home.Her dream is also to improve the quality of life for her family since everyone depends on her to pay for the costs of supporting the family. Her husband helps the family as much as he can. She really wishes the best for her son and hopes that he will become an honorable member of the community. Mrs. Maria's main economic activity is selling general merchandise. She is a traveling salesperson. She has had her business for the past nine years. She decided to start her business because she needed to find a way to provide for her family. She began by selling all types of clothing, but she didn't have the funds to buy enough items to sell, so she started by selling a few clothing items like underwear, jeans, and shirts for teens. She started selling to her neighbors and friends, but then moved on to markets where she was able to find more costumers. Everyday she works hard to obtain more merchandise to sell because she liked making a living this way. Now she wants to increase her inventory of merchandise even more because her clothing is in high demand. She wants this loan to be able to buy cosmetics, children's clothes, shirts for teens, men's jeans and other products that she can sell. She will travel to Managua where she can purchase the items at the lowest cost. (Translated by Elliot and Mariela of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for Business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Margarita De Los Santos

texts.es: La señora Margarita de los Santos C. C. tiene la edad de 37 años , habita en el barrio el edén ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo e hijas , el esposo trabaja para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar , ella trabaja como farmacéutica en el hospital México de Nicaragua , ellos tienen a su cargo tres hijos los cuales estudian , los planes hacia su familia es establecer mas cultivos de piña para darles un mejor apoyo en cuanto a los estudios y salgan hacia delante , la mayor dificultad que ha tenido es la falta de financiamiento , con sus propios esfuerzos a logrado establecer 2 manzanas , de piña las cuales necesitan insumos para que la producción se venda a un buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Margarita de los Santos C. C. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and daughters in the El Eden neighborhood of the Ticuantepe municipality. Her husband works to help her with the household expenses and she works as a pharmacist in the Mexico hospital of Nicaragua. They are raising three children who are in school. Their plan for their family is to cultivate more pineapple to help them better support their children’s education, enabling them to advance. The greatest difficulty has been lack of financing, but through their efforts they have managed to establish two acres of pineapple. They need agricultural supplies to improve their crop to sell at a good price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy agricultural supplies to improve crop production

loans.name: Julia Estela

texts.es: La señora Julia Estela Pérez A. tiene la edad de 45 años habita en el barrio las conchitas ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe,  ella es madre soltera tiene a su cargo tres hijos los cuales le apoyan en su negocio,  cuando ella va de compras, desde hace dos año tiene una pulpería que con mucho esfuerzos a logrado mantener, los planes hacia su familia es incrementar mas su negocio para poder darles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. Ella trabajaba para la compañía de TIP-TOP y con su indemnización logro incrementar un poco su pulpería. Esta vez la demanda es más pero no tiene recursos para poder ampliar de productos de canasta básica. Como granos básicos, y insumos diarios, para ofertar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Julia Estela Pérez A. is 45 years old and lives the Conchitas neighborhood of the Ticuantepe municipality. She is a single mother caring for three children who help her with the business when she goes shopping. Two years ago she established a grocery store that she has managed to maintain with a great deal of effort. Her plan for her family is to build up her business so that she can provide better living conditions for her children. She worked for the TIP-TOP company and with her earnings she was able to establish her store. Now there is a greater demand but she does not have the resources to augment the assortment of products that make up the basic food basket, including basic grains and daily supplies that can be offered to customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains and daily supplies to improve assortment of goods offered.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
El Señor Carlos Alberto Martínez tiene la edad de 42 años, su estado civil es casado, Don Carlos tiene 3 hijos su edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 23 años no estudia trabaja su otro hijo de 17 años no estudia y trabaja y su niña de 10 años cursa el 6 grado de primaria, su compañera de vida no trabaja, sus propósitos son de incrementar su negocio ya que este es su principal fuente de ingresos para la manutención de su  familia, sus deseos son de darle mejoras a su taller ya que necesita equiparlo con las herramientas adecuadas para la elaboración de sus productos, sus sueños son de incrementar su producción ya que esto le ayudaría a que sus clientes conozcan la calidad de su producto por lo que así atraería la atención de las personas que admiran sus productos por lo que también le gustaría que sus hijos puedan hacerse cargo del negocio para que el día de mañana puedan superar cualquier tipo de dificultades logrando a la misma ves la buena administración del establecimiento.

La actividad económica a la que Don Carlos se dedica es la elaboración de ollas de aluminio, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 7 años, Don Carlos da inicio a esta actividad con fondos propios y con el apoyo de ciertos amigos quienes le ayudaron con el propósito de ser clientes exclusivos por lo que inicio hace 7 años por la necesidad de tener una actividad económica que le generara ingresos para la manutención de su familia ya que se encontraba desempleado por lo que decide aplicar los conocimientos en este tipo de trabajo ya que esto lo desarrollo en taller por lo que mas tarde decide buscar ayuda por medio de sus amigos quienes le brindaron el apoyo que necesitaba y poco a poco empieza a buscar los materiales necesarios para la elaboración de los mismos inicio con poca producción fueron un total de 35 ollas y empezó a ofertarlas en los mercados y a sus amigo y su fama la obtiene por sus amigos quienes dieron a conocer el trabajo que realizaba por lo que ahora solicita financiamiento para capital de trabajo ya para la compra de materia prima que es el aluminio y el aceite por lo que no le gustaría diminuir la demanda de su producto.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto Martínez is 42 years old and married. He has three children. The oldest is 23 and he isn’t in school as he works, his other son is 17 years old and he too is not in school but works, and his 10 year old daughter is in 6th grade of primary school. His wife doesn’t work. His goals are to grow his business as this si his family’s primary source of income. His wishes are to improve his shop as he needs to equip it with tools to make his products. His dreams are to increase his production because this would help his customers know the quality of his products which would bring greater attention from those who admire his work. He would also like his children to take over the business on day so they can overcome any difficulty and become good business managers. Carolos makes aluminum pots, and his business is located in his home. He has had this business for 7 years. Carlos began the business with his own savings and with the support of friends who helped him with the business by becoming only his customer. 7 years ago he needed a profession with which he could generate income to support his family as he found himself unemployed. He decided to apply his knowledge in this field ad developed his shop and later decided to look for help through some friends who provided him the necessary support and little by little he began to seek the necessary materials to make his pans. He began with only producing 35 pots and began selling them in the markets and to his friends. His reputation gained him friends who then became familiar with his work. Now he seeks a loan for working capital to buy raw materials, aluminum, and oil, because he wouldn’t like to lose the demand for his product.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy raw materials to make pans

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
V. has been working as a staff member of the Toothpaste Company for the past three years and currently gets a salary of $180 a month.  

He is aged 27 and lives in Kandal Province, Cambodia.  He is married to Mrs. Seth, 27, who is working as a garment worker for a garment factory.  The young couple now cares for one young child, who is enrolled in the primary school. 

The family has been suffering from the pollution surrounding their house for a long time, which is harmful to their health.  Therefore, V. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase another piece of land and also to repair his old house.  The loan will help the family to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase another piece of land and to repair his old house

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana Maria H. vive en el municipio de Soyapango.  A sus 49 años, Ana Maria es  madre soltera de un hijo, quien vive con ella y le ayuda en su trabajo. Tras no contar de ninguna ayuda económica del padre de su hijo, Ana Maria ha salido adelante manejando un puesto de medicamentos naturales en el mercado de su colonia. Sin educación superior, y sin mucho conocimiento sobre medicina, Ana ha investigado y aprendido sobre  los medicamentos naturales, para  poder así administrar mejor su negocio. Actualmente solicita un préstamo, para mejorar su local en el mercado y comprar nueva mercadería, que le permita brindarle a su hijo  una mejor educación y porvenir.
texts.en:
Ana Maria H. lives in the Soyapango municipality. At 49, Ana Maria is the single mother of a son who lives with her and helps her with her work. Although she has not been able to count on any economic support from her son’s father, Ana Maria has done well selling natural medicines at the neighborhood marketplace. Despite lacking a higher education or a lot of knowledge about medicine, Ana has researched and educated herself about natural medicines to better manage her business. She requests a loan to improve her stall at the market and to buy new merchandise. This will improve her business, allowing her to provide a better education and future for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her marketplace stall and buy more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy raw materials for her candy business

loans.name: Jacqueline Georgina

texts.es:
Jacqueline Georgina M. vive en Soyapango, con su esposo e hijas. A sus 45 años, nunca recibió educación, pues  sus padres no contaban con las posibilidades económicas necesarias y tuvo que trabajar desde joven.  Desde hace ya 10 años reside en Ilopango, donde junto a su esposo montaron un humilde bazar en su propia casa.  Como el bazar se encuentra dentro de la residencia, los productos que venden en este, son comprados en su mayoría por los vecinos de su colonia. El sueño de Jacqueline y su familia es extender su negocio para poder llegar a más clientes y vender más.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar nueva mercadería y empezar expandir paso a paso su negocio más allá de su colonia.
texts.en:
Jacqueline Georgia M. lives in Soyapango with her husband and daughters. She is 45 years old and has never had a formal education because her parents did not have the money to send her to school. She has been working since she was young. For the last 10 years she has lived in Ilopanga, where she and her husband started a humble little store that they operate out of their home. Since the store is located inside of their house, the majority of the products that they sell are purchased by people from their neighborhood. Jacqueline and her family's dream is to grow their business and to have more customers. She's asking for a loan to purchase new merchandise and begin expanding, step by step, outside of her neighborhood. (Translated by Nikki and Ryan of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Karimbobo

texts.en:
Karimbobo S. lives with his wife and two children. He is 50 years old. He dedicates himself primarily to the raising of milk-producing cattle, which his wife sells at the local market and in the local community. He also works part-time as a taxi driver, so he can increase the family income. Karimbobo is requesting a loan in order to purchase high-breed cattle, which will increase the supply of milk his herd produces. This will be his third loan from IMON International; his credit history makes him eligible to receive new and larger loans. With your support, Karimbobo will continue to progress.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. Its history includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and many famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets like Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Mamadjon

texts.en:
Mamadjon T. is a 27-year-old, married father of two children. Mamadjon has been in the taxi service business for the past 5 years. In addition, he dedicates himself to raising and selling cattle, work he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in purchasing and selling cattle and a great deal of hard work, he has been able to bring stability to his family. The desire that Mamadjon harbors in his heart is to increase his capital so that he can acquire more animals. As such, he is seeking a loan in the amount of $700 to purchase more animals and to satisfy his customers' demands. In turn, he expects to generate an increase in sales and to therefore improve his family's future prospects. Information about Tajikistan: Tajikistan is well known for the following: (1) its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; (2) the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and (3) its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, and Mavlavi Rumi, to name a few. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. On the other end of the spectrum, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and thus only 7% of the land is arable; accordingly, this confluence of factors has resulted in high levels of unemployment and has forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries (primarily Russia). Even though the people of Tajikistan are working hard to improve the country's agriculture and manufacturing sectors, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON International's History: Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To expand his business and to meet customer demand by purchasing additional cattle

loans.name: Suhrobjon

texts.en:
Suhrobjon A. is a married man with four children. With the desire to generate enough money to send his children to college (so that his children can get ahead in life), he started a business 8 years ago whereby he processes and sells dried apricots. As such, he is very experienced in this line of business, which allows him to attract more and more clients each day. Now, Suhrobjon is seeking a loan in the amount of $825 over a 9-month term. He plans to use the loan proceeds to purchase additional dried apricots, which will be processed and sold in turn. With your help, Suhrobjon will be extremely proud, knowing that (through much effort) his children will be able to attend college and to succeed in life. Information about Tajikistan: Tajikistan is well known for the following: (1) its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; (2) the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and (3) its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, and Mavlavi Rumi, to name a few. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additional dried apricots

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.en:
Azimjon K. is a 33-year-old, married man with two children. Azimjon sells confectioneries such as candies, cookies, pastries, and fruit jellies. He proudly states that he has been in this line of business for approximately 10 years. Azimjon purchases his goods from the neighboring city of Khujand. The income he is able to generate from his business allows him to support his family (he is the sole breadwinner in his family). Now, Azimjon is requesting a loan in the amount of $700 over a 12-month term, the proceeds of which will be used to expand his inventory of goods (i.e., he plans to purchase additional confectionaries). Azimjon thanks everyone for their support, and he promises to repay his loan on time.

Information about Tajikistan: Tajikistan is well known for the following: (1) its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; (2) the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and (3) its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, and Mavlavi Rumi, to name a few. On the other end of the spectrum, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and thus only 7% of the land is arable; accordingly, this confluence of factors has resulted in high levels of unemployment and has forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries (primarily Russia). Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To expand his inventory of goods by purchasing additional confectionaries

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
Shuhrat K. is 31 years old. Due to lack of fees for university studies, Shuhrat was only able to finish high school. After finishing school, he learned various skills, including repairing of cars. At the beginning he worked as an assistant and in time he became experienced in repairing cars. Thanks to his abilities he was able to build his own workshop near his house where he provides his services.

Shuhrat is married and has two children. He is doing his best to ensure his children of the best future. Now he feels the lack of tools and spare parts for repairing cars and for that reason he is requesting 700 USD for a term of 11 months. Shuhrat is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his dreams with this loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing tools and spare parts used to repair trucks

loans.name: Zafarjon

texts.en:
Zafarjon K. is 34 years old. He is married with two children. Six years ago Zafarjon, with his mechanic's skills, started to do work for his neighbors and acquaintances. He learned this skill at another shop, until he had the opportunity to begin his own business. With all faith and enthusiasm, his auto mechanic business started to grow little by little.

Villagers who use trucks for their business always come to have their machines repaired by him. Now, Zafarjon is finding that the tools and spare parts that he has are not enough to work at his job at full speed. For this reason, he is seeking a loan of 700 USD that will be paid back over the course of 11 months. This loan will be used to buy tools and spare parts used to repair autos. With your help, Zafarjon will be able to provide for his children's education and the well-being of his family.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing tools and spare parts used to repair trucks

loans.name: Savridin

texts.en:
Savridin N. is 50 years old. He is married with three children. Savridin is the sole breadwinner for his family and his only income comes from the cultivation and sale of large livestock. He sells his livestock at the local market. Every year, he buys young heifers from the farms in adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his wife and children and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers.

Today, Savridin is thinking about expanding his business, since the income from his present herd isn't enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase an additional young cow. To do this, he needs to invest an additional $900 USD in his business. In order to receive this amount, Savridin has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner organization, IMON International.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Vakkos

texts.en:
Vakkos S. is a very loving father devoted to the needs of his grandchildren, whom he adores. Vakkos is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children. Today his children are working adults, thanks to his example.

Vakkos works raising livestock. Every morning he leaves home to take his animals to pasture in the surrounding area. His desire is to improve the quality of his animals. In order to do this he will need to purchase livestock of better breeds. These animals are very costly. He needs capital of $900 USD. Currently, he does not have that much money, and therefore he is requesting this loan. Vakkos hopes that you trust in his hard work and honesty.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. Its history includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and many famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets like Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Khalilullah

texts.en:
Khalilullah is the son of A. R.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has five children, two of whom are studying at school while the others are still small. He has got a metal shop where he works hard and earns income to cover the necessities for his household and children.

He would like to expand his business, so he is requesting an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani for a term of 12 months and he is confident that after receiving the loan, he can work well and will progress in a good way.

loans.use: causing his business to progress

loans.name: Mam

texts.en:
P., 46, lives in Pursat province, Cambodia where she has owned a plot of land since 1979.  She grows different kinds of crops like rice, vegetables and some fruit trees. 

She is a good mother of four children: two are students and the other two are helping with their parents' work.  She is married to Nhang, age 45, who also sells firewood that depends on carving from the forest.  

In view of the fact that crop growing is P.'s main source of income to sustain her family’s living conditions, and in order to help her meet the hard physical labor demands of cultivating, P. is applying for a loan to buy water buffalo to use for plowing the fields. 

(P.'s husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To buy water buffalo to use for plowing the fields

loans.name: Anorkhon

texts.en:
Anorkhon V. is 50 years old. She is married with three children. She started her own business 7 years ago because her husband’s salary as a teacher was not enough to cover their family expenses. Anorkhon runs a confectionery where she sells candies, cookies and pastries. The income she generates helps her support her family. Recently she married off her daughter.

Anorkhon dreams of educating all of her children with higher education. Today she requests 1500 Somoni for the term of 12 months. She is going to use the loan to purchase more goods for her confectionery. She will continue to use the income from her business to take care of her family and educate her children.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. Its history includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and many famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets like Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others.
