To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase goods for the confectionery

loans.name: Halimdjon

texts.ru:
Абдуалимов Халимджон, 1973 года рождения, женат, имеет 3 детей. Начал свой бизнес с продажи хозтоваров и его стаж в этой деятельности 4 лет. Он торгует на рынке «Панчшер» города Душанбе хозяйственными товарами. В его ассортименте имеются электропечь, электроплита, пылесосы, светильники, ведра. Также в продажи имеются разновидность чайников, посуды, термосы, утюги, кухонные комбайны и т.д. С увеличением спроса на электроплиты и печи, Халимджон  хочет пополнить свой товар, увеличить товарооборот и получить больше доходов. Покупает товар в оптовом рынке Корвон и у поставщиков из Китая. 
Халимджон хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 4000 сомони чтоб закупить электропечи.
texts.en:
Born in 1973, Halimdjon A. is married and has 3 children. He started his business of selling household products four years ago and has a retail outlet at the Panchsher market in Dushanbe. His goods assortment includes electric stoves, vacuum cleaners, lamps and buckets. He also sells tea pots, dishes, thermoses, irons, food processors, etc. He buys his goods at the Korvon wholesale market and from Chinese distributors. Due to an increasing demand for electric stoves, Halimdjon wants to add goods to his inventory, increase turnover and profits. He wants to obtain an $1100 loan to purchase electric stoves.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Electric stoves purchase

loans.name: Shah Tahoos

texts.en: Shah Tahoos is the son of G. M.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and lives in a big family of nine members. He is the only one who works. He works in a car part shop and earns money. Most of the time it is very difficult for him to pay for all the expenses in the house. He wants to take out an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani for the term of 12 months to go ahead and expand his business.

loans.use: buying the essential things for his car parts shop

loans.name: Bit

texts.en: Bit K. is a 27 year old who sells fish in a busy market to earn a living and is able to make about $6 per day. Her husband, pictured here, is a fisherman and always gives his catch to his wife to sell to the market. This couple together has two young children. Mrs. Bit K. is asking for a loan to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly K., 37, lives with his wife and his child in Battambang province. He runs a motor-taxi to earn a living and is able to make about $3 of profit every day. Besides running a moto-taxi, he also sells candy. His wife stays at home doing housework and cooking food for the family members. Ly K. is asking for a loan to invest in his business of selling candy.

loans.use: To invest in his business of selling candy.

loans.name: Sarvarbi

texts.ru:
Назарова Сарварби 1970 года рождения, разведена, имеет 4 детей. Занимается продажей женскими одеждами на рынке «Панджшер» города Душанбе. Предпринимательскую деятельность начала в 2004 году с продажи нижнего белья. С каждым годом она увеличивала наименование товара. В данный момент у нее имеются женские вязаные джемперы, шерстяные и полушерстяные пуловеры, безрукавки, а также разнообразные нижние белья. Товары для продажи привозит с рынка «Корвон» города Душанбе. 
Ассортимент продаваемых ею товаров она хочет пополнить разновидностями халатов. В разгар сезона хочет участвовать в программе Кива и получить займ в сумме 4000 сомони сроком на 8 месяцев для закупа сезонных товаров.
texts.en:
Born in 1970, Sarvarbi N. is divorced and has 4 children. She sells women’s clothes at the Pandjsher market in Dushanbe. She began her entrepreneurial activity in 2004 with lingerie sales and increased her goods assortment every year. She currently sells women’s sweaters, wool pullovers, vests and a variety of lingerie. Sarvarbi delivers the goods from the Korvon market in Dushanbe. She now wants to add a variety of robes to her goods assortment. Sarvarbi would like to participate in the Kiva program and obtain this $1100 loan to purchase seasonal goods. She will repay the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of women's robes

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
S. lives in Pursat Province, Cambodia where she sells groceries out of her home for a profit.  As another income, she raises pigs in a stall behind her house. 

She was born in 1983 and is married with two children; both are still young and are pupils.  Her husband is a rice farmer. 

Since she sold all her pigs to the slaughterer, she hopes to acquire more pigs to raise.  Therefore, she decided to request a loan to purchase more piglets to raise.  The remaining loan amount will be used to increase her stock of groceries to re-sell.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van N. is 56 years old and lives with her husband and her children in Battambang province, Cambodia. She stays at home and with her husband, Siv San, 61, earns a living by raising pigs on a plot of land behind her house. This couple together make about US$ 4 every day. Four of their children are employed as garment factory workers, while two are in school.  Mrs. Van N. would like to take out a loan to expand her livestock by adding more pigs and purchasing feed as well. (Mrs. Van N. and her husband were unavailable so her oldest daughter is pictured instead.)

loans.use: buying more pigs to raise and purchasing feed

loans.name: Soam

texts.en: Soam S., 23, is married and lives with her husband in Battambang province. She grows various kinds of vegetables and oranges and sells them at the market to earn approximately US$ 2 in profit every day, while her husband Horm Sokhum, 30, pictured here, is a construction foreman and makes US$ 6 a day. This couple has one little child. Mrs. Soam is asking a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use for his commute to work. This will reduce the cost that he spends every day on public transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for transport for her husband

loans.name: Makole F Group

texts.en:
Roy has owned a small drinks shop in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for 3 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $190. Every day she works at her business. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more drink materials for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and to pay school fees for their children.

Roy is 38 years old, married, and has four children: ages between 9 and 17. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Rosaria, Fatuma, Wini and Kibibi. Each woman also has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more materials (drinks) to expand her business.

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.ru:
Хусейн 1985 года рождения, женат. Занимается продажей верхней одежды на рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. Предпринимательскую деятельность начал в 2004 году с продажи мужской обуви. В ее ассортименте большой выбор женского пальто, короткие и длинные, с мехами и без них, а также имеются шерстяные джемперы и безрукавки. Товары закупает на оптовом рынке «Корвон». 
Ассортимент продаваемых им товаров пополнился разновидностями халатов. Хусейн  хочет участвовать в программе Кива и получить займ в сумме 4000 сомони для закупа сезонных товаров.
texts.en:
Huseyn M. was born in 1985 and is married. He sells outerwear at the Korvon market in the city of Dushanbe. He started this enterprise in 2004, selling men's shoes. His inventory includes a wide selection of women's coats, both short and long, with fur and without, as well as wool sweaters and vests. He purchases his goods at the Korvon wholesale market. He has broadened his product range to include an assortment of robes. Huseyn would like to participate in Kiva's program and take out a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni to purchase seasonal goods.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of men's and women's robes

loans.name: Koing

texts.en: Koing L., 27, is a staff member at a private company and is able to make US$ 5 every day. She is single and lives with her sister and her mother in Battambang province. Her sister, Ream Soklin, 36, pictured here, has a business selling grocery products in the community, earning about US$ 3 per day to help support the family as well. L. is asking for a loan to expand her sister's grocery store by adding more items to meet her customers' needs.

loans.use: To expand a grocery store

loans.name: Makole F Group

texts.en:
Melania has owned a small food vendor store in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for 2 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 250. Every day she works at her business. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more foodstuffs for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and get more food for her family.

Melania is 45 years old, widowed, and has two children: ages 20 and 18. She also cares for one additional dependent. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members Janeth, Lucy, and Dora. Each woman also has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to expand her business

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Y., 44, lives Pursat Province, Cambodia.  She earns a living by selling grocery items from her house.  She sells items such as cooked food, plastic goods and sweets for kids.  She has been in this business for a long time and is especially skilled in attracting customers.  

Y. is married and currently has four children, two of whom are single while the others are married.  Her husband is a local fruit grower.  

Y. works hard everyday and is a very responsible to her family.  Recently, she sold all the groceries from her store.  Because grocery selling is Y.'s main source of income for supporting her family's living expenses, she would like to ask for a loan to purchase a range of groceries to then sell.

loans.use: To purchase a range of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en: Chhuon S., 34, pictured here, is married and lives with his wife in Battambang province, Cambodia. He operates a moto-taxi and is able to make US$ 3 in profit per day. His wife, Chea Aun, 35, has a business selling flowers and earns US$ 2 a day as well. This couple has two school-aged children. Chhuon S. is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike to run his own moto-taxi.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle to operate a moto-taxi.

loans.name: Zulaiho

texts.ru:
Шарипова Зулайхо родилась 1976 году. Она после развода с мужем, начала свою предпринимательскую деятельность. Предпринимательством занимается шесть лет и на данный момент торгует детскими одеждами.  Торгует на рынке «Панджшер» города Душанбе. В ее ассортименте большой выбор детской одежды, начиная от детского нижнего белья до курточек и шапочек.  Она закупает товар на оптовом рынке «Корвон».  
Зулайхо хочет закупить сезонный товар и желает участвовать в программе Кива, чтоб получить денежные средства для расширения бизнеса в сумме 4000 сомони.
texts.en:
Zulaiho S. was born in 1976, and after divorcing her husband, she went into business. She has been in business for six years and at present sells children's clothing at the Panjshir market in the city of Dushanbe. Her inventory includes a broad selection of children's clothing, ranging from children's undergarments to jackets and caps, which she purchases at the Korvon wholesale market. Zulaiho wants to purchase seasonal items and wishes to participate in Kiva's program in order to take out a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni to have the wherewithal to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of children's clothing (jackets, pants and pullovers)

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem S. is 47 years old and lives in Battambang province, Cambodia. He is a security guard at a casino and earns US$ 4 a day, while his wife, Keo Sireiya, 26, pictured here, is a wedding planner, earning about US$ 3 per day. This couple is asking for a US$ 1000 loan to open a beauty shop and purchase more clothes and cosmetics to rent out during wedding ceremonies.

loans.use: To open a beauty shop for brides

loans.name: Makole F Group

texts.en:
Christina J. has been a drinks and bites seller in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for 2 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 190. Every day she works at her business. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more drinks and bites for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and pay school fees.

Christina J. is 26 years old, married, and has two children: ages 12 and 7. She also cares for one additional dependent. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Christina A. and Janeth. Each woman also has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and bites for the expansion of her business

loans.name: Leub

texts.en: Leub P., 48, is a widow who resides in Battambang province, Cambodia. She makes and sells rice cake. She walks with her cake and sells it from house-to-house to earn a living and is able to make US$ 4 per day. She is also supported by four of her children who work as local doctors, a garment worker and a goldsmith. Mrs. Leub P. is asking for a loan to purchase medicines for her two children who work as local doctors to sell.

loans.use: to purchase medicines for sale

loans.name: Run

texts.en: Run N., 25, is a construction worker building houses and lives with his wife in Battambang province, Cambodia. He makes US$ 5 every day and his wife stays at home looking after four young children. Run N. would like to take out a loan to purchase construction tools.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools.

loans.name: Chadulu L Group

texts.en:
Esta has owned a small charcoal store and has been a maize seller in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for 14 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 175. Every day she works at her business. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and maize for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and to save money.

Esta is 40 years old, married, and has four children: aged between 22 and 16. She also cares for two additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members Joyce, Janeth and Chipegwa. Each woman has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and maize for the expansion of her business

loans.name: La

texts.en:
L. currently resides with five other family members in his small family home in Pursat Province.  

He sells firewood out of his house by selling wholesale to customers.  He usually carves wood from the forest to then sell, from which he can make around $5 per day.  

He is married and the father of four children; all four of them are students and also help their parents in selling firewood.  His wife is a farmer, and is always a good homemaker who cooks tasty foods for family and cares for the children. 

L. humbly requests a loan to buy cows and buffalo to raise for offspring, and to use them to transport firewood to sell directly to customers' houses.

loans.use: To buy cows and buffalo to raise

loans.name: Chadulu L Group

texts.en:
Maria has been a seamstress in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for 15 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 175. Every day she works at her business. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy another sewing machine for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Maria is 40 years old, divorced, and has three children: aged between 20 and 4. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members Mary, Aisha, and Elizabeth. Each woman has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Chadulu L Group

texts.en:
Sarafina has been a clothing seller in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for four years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. She works at her business every day. Sarafina is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and to save money.  

Sarafina is 27 years old and single. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Lucy and Rose. Each woman also has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to expand her business.

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en:
S. has been farming for a long time and she specializes in growing rice.  It is a skill she learned from her grandparents. 

She is 24 years old, married and has two children, both of whom are teenagers and in school.  Her husband is a local fisherman and also helps his wife in growing rice. 

The couple is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike that will be used to ride for catching fish.  The family lives in Pursat Province and they appear in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr: Boubacar est un jeune commerçant dans le populaire quartier de Lyndiane. Grâce à son commerce il entretient sa famille de 3 enfants. Il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer ses activités et gagner davantage de profits.
texts.en:
Boubacar is a young merchant in the working class neighborhood of Lyndiane. Thanks to his business, he supports his family of 3 children. He is requesting this loan to bolster his little business and earn more profit from it.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolstering his little business

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Cette jeune ziguinchoroise gére une téléboutique. Elle offre des services variés : fax, éléphone, vente de carte de crédit pour téléphone mobile etc
Elle demande ce crédit pour renforcer ses activités et augmenter ses revenus. Avec son activiét, elle soutient sa mére qui est veuve dans le populaire quartier de Grand Dakar au sud de Ziguinchor.
texts.en:
This young woman comes from Ziguinchor and manages a tele-boutique. She offers varied services: fax, telephone, sale of rechargeable cell phone cards, etc. She is requesting this loan to bolster her little business and increase her income. The revenue from this business allows her to support her mother who is a widow and lives in the working class neighborhood of Grand Dakar in the south of Ziguinchor.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolstering her little business

loans.name: Lameka's Group

texts.en:
B. Lameka is the chairperson of the Kyerima Dembe group in Kayunga. He is a business man and is very active and devoted. He started with a business of making waragi (a strong type of local brew), which he supplied to customers around Kyerima.  Later, he joined a more profitable business of running a boda boda. Currently, he owns two motorcycles for the transportation business.  B. requests a loan to buy another motorcycle so that he can increase his income in order to pay for his children’s school fees. 

B. is also a farmer.  The crops he grows are for his family's consumption and are sold. B. was blessed with six children, four of which are still in school.  He also cares for two orphans that attend school. He is able to care for all of these children because of his hard work.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
P., 27, earns a living selling firewood from his house.  He usually carves wood from the forest and also purchases from a wholesale supplier. 

He is married with one young child.  His wife's name is Kunthea, 22, and she is a local rice farmer.  She also relies on both seasons for growing rice, including the dry season and rainy season.  

In view of the fact that rice farming is an important source of income for the family's needs and that the dry season is coming, P. and Kunthea have applied for a loan to buy another plot of farmland for growing rice in the dry season. 

They both are people living in Pursat Province.

loans.use: To buy another plot of farmland for growing rice in the dry season

loans.name: Samali's Group

texts.en:
K. Samali is the leader of the loan group, Buyinza United, based in Nazigo. She is a social, friendly, and hard working lady.  She operates a retail shop that she has owned for four years. In the shop, she sells sugar, salt, cooking oil, bread, and many other items.  K. is requesting a loan to purchase more items to resell.  

She is grateful for the loans she has received from Pearl Microfinance because they have allowed her to improve her shop. Before the loans, she had very little to offer her few customers.  Now she has so much to offer.  This has attracted many customers and increased her profit.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her retail store

loans.name: Ibrahim's Group

texts.en: M. Ibrahim is the leader of the loan group, Biva Muntuuyo, based in Lugazi. He is married and has six children.  He has a tailoring business that he has been operating for eleven years. His workshop produces both casual and formal suits for men. He is well known for the services he renders and this wins him more loyal customers. To fulfill his customer's orders, he enlists the help of his brother and two other workers.  Currently, he owns three sewing machines.  He is requesting a loan to buy more materials for his business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing materials

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is thirty one year old she is married and mother of two children. All her kids are in school. She lives at Abofour a suburb of Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She was formerly in the next two towns from Abofour but relocated as a result of her husband and the market where she trades. Abofour is a busy farming community. 

She has been selling food for the past 7 years in taking care of her family. She sells gari and beans with ripe plantain in the community market at Abofour. Gari and beans is enjoyed by many Ghanaians because it contains lots of protein and it is also affordable to buy.

Elizabeth business is doing well due to human relation and the tasty meal she sells. The market day for the community is every Thursday so after the said day business begins to slow down. Her major challenge has to do with funds to make business progress.

Elizabeth wants the loan to buy food stuffs like gari, plantain, beans, charcoal etc. to restock her inventory. It has also being her dream to save more from her business proceeds in taking care of the children in school. Elizabeth belongs to a village bank called Fear Not. She hopes to receive GH¢500 to make business progress.

loans.use: She wants the loan to buy food stuffs like gari, plantains and beans etc.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Forty-six-year-old Abena K., a resident of the remote area of Abofour, is the married mother of three children, two married and one in junior high school. Abena has been a food vendor for 20 years in the Abofour community market, selling ‘ampesi’ and rice with stew, food mainly purchased by the traders who come to do business. She says that her food has been embraced by loyal customers, but a lack of adequate funds has made it very difficult for her to fully develop the business.

Abena is requesting this loan to buy more bags of raw materials including rice, meat, and charcoal; having these additional stocks will help her to maintain her business in the event of commodity price increases.

Abena wants to use any additional proceeds to support her children in their education. It has also been her dream to add the sale of soft drinks to her existing business; the additional income will be used to support her husband in maintaining their family. She is grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy additional foodstuffs including yams, plantains, rice, meat, and fish.

loans.name: Margaret Kyeyune Group

texts.en: Margaret K. is the leader of the loan group, Wojje Azeewo, which is based in Nazigo. She is married and has children that attend school.  She also cares for two other relatives and pays their school fees. With her husband, she farms bananas, maize, beans, cassava, and sweet potatoes to sell.  They have been able to buy a pick up truck to transport their produce to the market.  They also rent out the truck to others.  Additionally, Margaret and her husband own a motorcycle business.  Margaret is requesting a loan to buy more quality seeds for the farm and repair her motorcycle.

loans.use: to buying more quality seeds for her farm and repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Mudi

texts.en:
Married with seven children who are currently in school, 52-year-old Mudi Y. lives in Abofour, located in the Ashanti region of Ghana, where she sells foodstuffs such as bags of maize in the local market.

Mudi is an achiever, and her focus is to save enough money to provide her children with quality educations, but without adequate funds this dream won’t be realized. Mudi is therefore humbly requesting your help through a loan to purchase an increased stock of maize directly from the farmers to satisfy her customers’ needs. This will allow her to save more to support her husband in taking care of their family.

loans.use: To purchase bulk stocks of cassava and maize.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth F., 40, is married and the mother of seven children, four who are in school and three who are farmers in the community. A resident of Abofour, a suburb of Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana, Elizabeth is a resourceful woman who loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living.

Elizabeth has sold bananas in the Abofour market for more than three years now, regularly trekking to surrounding villages in the central part of Ghana to purchase them in bulk from the farmers and then, after ripening, retailing them to her customers.

A lack of adequate working capital prevents Elizabeth from buying a large enough stock of bananas to generate sufficient profit. She is therefore requesting a loan that will allow her to increase the size of her bulk purchases and also buy grocery products such as rice, sugar, milk and vegetable oil to add to her product line.

Elizabeth believes that this loan will enable her to earn more income to support her business growth and her family.

loans.use: To purchase bulk supplies of bananas and grocery products.

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
C. is a 57-year-old and has been running two businesses for a long time: raising pigs and growing vegetables on her own farmland. She is married and the mother of six children: three are single and other three are married and live outside the family home. One of her single sons and her husband assist her in the business.

The family lives in a rural area of Pursat Province. Because C.'s farmland is small for them, they have difficulty growing crops; thus, she would like to ask for a loan to purchase one more plot of farmland. The loan will help them increase their productivity higher than the previous year.

loans.use: To purchase another plot of farmland

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: Sarah N. is one of the executive members of the Twesige loan group in Kayunga. Sarah is well known in her community because of her work. She operates a drug store that she has owned for ten years. People refer to her as “musawo,’ which means doctor. In places far away from the town council, it’s hard to find a hospital therefore Sarah offers much needed medicine.  Her store is a blessing to the people since it reduces the transport cost and time necessary to seek health services from a big hospital. Sarah is able to treat illnesses like malaria, colds, coughs, minor injuries and accidents and at times provides delivery services to women in her area. She is requesting a loan to stock her shop with more medications and medical supplies.

loans.use: to buy medication and medical supplies

loans.name: Abrewa

texts.en:
Abrewa Y., a 45-year old resident of Abofour, is the married mother of three children, all independent. Her husband has been very supportive, but his business has slowed down, making it difficult for Abrewa to sustain her business.

She is a food vendor in her neighborhood selling kenkey, a popular meal prepared from milled maize grains and consumed with hot pepper and fried fish. Many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper, so Abrewa has a large customer base.

Abrewa is requesting the loan to buy more raw materials such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to thereby increase income to support her business growth.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Fazira's Group

texts.en: Fazira N. is the chairperson of the Twesige loan group in Kayunga. She is married and has five children who attend school.  Additionally, she also cares for two relatives, one of whom is an orphan. Fazira used to own a small retail shop.  Now she is a poultry farmer and also sells milk from her three cows. These businesses have been allowed her to provide for her family well.  She has raised a new brood of chicks.  A loan will help her resettle and feed them.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed for her new chicks

loans.name: Sheitu

texts.en:
Married with three children attending school, 26-year-old Sheitu M. lives with her husband in Abofour, a suburb of Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana. A resourceful young woman, she loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living.

Trekking to surrounding villages in the Central part of Ghana to purchase bulk stocks of bananas from farmers, Sheitu has been retailing them in the Abofour market for more than eight years now. Unfortunately, a lack of adequate working capital prevents her from buying enough stock to earn sufficient profit to support her family. Sheitu is therefore requesting this loan to purchase larger supplies of bananas to increase her sales volume.

She believes this loan will enable her to save more income to support her business growth; as well, she wants to use part of the additional profits to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase bananas  in bulk.

loans.name: Jubail's Group

texts.en:
S. Jubail is a member of the Twesige loan group in Kayunga. He has been with his lending group for twelve years.  He stated with a loan of 50,000 shillings and has upgraded to a 2,500,000 shilling loan. He is grateful for the loans since they have improved his business and helped him out of poverty. He is married and has ten children, three of whom attend school.  He also cares for three orphaned relatives. 

Jubail has a taxi transportation business.  In addition, he buys cows from Mbalala in western Uganda and sells them to butchers in and around Kayunga and Mukono. He has been able to buy himself a plot of land for family farming.  He also owns three cows that give him milk both for sale and home consumption. Jubail is requesting a loan to buy more cows to sell and pay for their transportation costs.

loans.use: to buy more cows to sell

loans.name: At

texts.en:
M., 27, is a local firewood seller. He normally leaves his house for a few days or a week to cut wood in the forest, and he sells the wood by transporting it directly to his customers' houses, earning an average of US$ 5 per day. He now lives with two young children and his wife in the family home.

M. always pays a lot in transportation and he hopes to reduce the cost of transportation; thus, he is asking for a loan to buy a motorcycle for the family's daily driving needs. M. lives in Pursat Province and he was not available for photographing so his wife is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his family's daily transportation

loans.name: Abdukosim

texts.ru: Абдукосим мужчина в возрасте 37 лет , женат имеет троих детей.Сам работает оптовым поставщиком куриных яиц.Он закупает с птицефабрик и раздаёт многим продавцам яиц в розницу.Также его жена продаёт яйца на рынке "паншабе"(название базара).Абдукосим решил увеличить свой товарооборот взяв кредит в Микроинвесте.Он вместе с женой уже пятый год занимается этим бизнесом, поэтому у него есть постоянные покупатели.
texts.en:
Abdukosim is a 37-year-old man, and is married with three children. He works as a wholesale supplier of chicken eggs. He buys from the poultry farm and distributes eggs to many retail merchants. In addition, his wife sells eggs at the Panshabe bazaar. Abdukosim decided to increase his turnover by taking out a loan with MicroInvest. He and his wife have already been in this business for five years, so he has regular customers.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Eggs

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort N. sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at Nyankumasi near Cape Coast. Comfort has received junior high education.  She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a trader. Comfort has been selling fish for about 6 years now. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back for the expansion of her trade in fish.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. has a business selling soft drinks in Nyankumasi, near Cape Coast. Mary attended school through junior high school. She is married and she has 2 children. Her husband is a trader.

Mary has been selling soft drinks since 2005. She is responsible for paying her family's utility bills and other expenses. She is requesting a loan so she can buy more soft drinks to sell. She wants to meet the demands of her customers. She will reinvest the profit back into the business so she can expand her trade.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Sarkis

texts.en: Sarkis is a 42-year-old married man with three children, living in Anjar in the Bekaa Valley. Sarkis owns a home-based workshop where he works at affixing precious stones on jewelry. Today and in order to improve his output quality, Sarkis is requesting $1,200 to buy a new microscope.

loans.use: Buy a microscope for his jewelry-making

loans.name: Wafic

texts.en:
Wafic is a 65-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa, with his wife and their seven children. Wafic has been working as a mason for thirty-five years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new tools for his work and to do some maintenance work on his car. This is his second loan and he has paid on time before this.

His previous loan helped him improve his work condition. His clients are people from his area. Wafic decided on doing his business because he learned it, which means he has experience in his business. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase new tools for his work and to do some maintenance work on his car

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose M. is married and has 5 dependants. She has received schooling through to junior high. Rose sells mattresses at the Nyankumasi lorry park near Cape Coast, which she has done for 8 years now. Her husband is a trader. Rose uses her income to help her husband in paying the children's school fees and the family's utility bills, since her husband's income is not sufficient to meet those needs.

Rose will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of sleeping mattresses to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to reinvest for the expansion of her trade in soft sleeping mattresses.

loans.use: Rose will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of sleeping mattresses to meet the increase in demand by her customers.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 35-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa, with his wife and their two children. He has owned a photography studio for eight years. Ibrahim requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new camera for his studio. This is his second loan and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his business. His clients can be anybody. Ibrahim decided on doing his business because he always liked taking pictures. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: Ibrahim will use the loan to purchase a new camera for his studio

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 55-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa, with his wife and their five children. Ahmad has owned a vegetable shop for a year. He also sells cigarettes and some food and candies.

Ahmad requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a refrigerator for his shop. This is his second loan and he has always paid on time. His previous loan helped him improve his business. His clients are his friends and neighbors. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: to  purchase a refrigerator for his shop

loans.name: Hasanin

texts.en:
Hasanin is a 25-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa. Hasanin has been working as a mason for four years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase new tools for his business. This is the first time that Hasanin has requested a loan.

Hasanin is speciA. in his work because he does it well, thanks to his experience. His clients are people from his area. Hasanin decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase new tools for his business

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric A. is married and has 3 children. He has received schooling through senior high. Eric sells video CDs and DVDs at Nyankumasi near Cape Coast, which he has done since 2006. His wife is a petty trader. Eric uses his income to pay for their children’s school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Eric will use the loan as additional capital to enable him to increase the sale of video CDs and DVDs for both foreign and local movies and music to meet the increase in demand by his customers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Eric plans to reinvest for the expansion of  his business in music and video CDs and DVDs.

loans.use: additional capital to  increase his inventory of video CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Nasrullo

texts.en:
Nasrullo B. is 48 years old. He is married with two children. Ever since he was young, he has raised animals. He had his own cattle, and little by little over time, he has been improving and expanding the business with the goal of improving his family’s standard of living and continuing to pay for his children’s education.

IMON International has been a fundamental part of Nasrullo´s business because of having provided loans which have been used to purchase calves and cows. Today, once again, Nasrullo faces this need, but he trusts that his loan will be granted so that he can help his business and his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Abduvosit

texts.en:
Abduvosit is a hard-working farmer because he knows that the only way he can support and provide for his loved ones is through hard work and dedication. Consequently, he leaves home every day at dawn to work in his farm and to look after his cattle.

Abduvosit wishes to expand his business by purchasing calves and fodder for them. That is the reason why he is asking for a loan. He will always cherish the memory of all those who gave him a helping hand when he needed it by granting his request.

These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves in order to expand his business

loans.name: Ezozkhon

texts.en:
Ezozkhon R. is a young mother with a great desire to get ahead in life. Her great spirit, strong will and hard work have allowed her to improve her quality of life and that of her family. For the past 4 years, this persevering lady has been working very hard, raising and selling cattle and with the income she generates she provides a better quality of life for her kids, who are her greatest joy. She asks for a 700 USD loan with a term of 9 months in order to buy more calves to later sell when they are fully grown. With this investment she will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life. Let’s support this dedicated mother's proposal!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.
